original: grum po ni 'khyor zhing 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: grum po ni 'khyor zhing 'gro ba'o //
translated: The hunchback is one who walks bent over.

original: lkugs pa ni mod la smra mi nus pa'o ;
analyzed: lkugs pa ni mod la smra mi nus pa'o ;
translated: The mute is one who cannot speak immediately.

original: / glegs bam la la las ni blun po zhes zer te /
analyzed: / glegs bam la la las ni blun po zhes zer te /
translated: In some texts, the word “fool” is used.

original: der yang don ni 'di nyid yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: der yang don ni 'di nyid yin no zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: And in that case, this is the meaning, say some.

original: dig ba zhes bya ba ni tshig smra ba thogs shing ye shes la 'thug por smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dig ba zhes bya ba ni tshig smra ba thogs shing ye shes la 'thug por smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The “stutterer” is one who speaks with difficulty, because his speech is slow.

original: rna ba mi gsang ba ni sgra gsang chen pos thos pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba mi gsang ba ni sgra gsang chen pos thos pa'o //
translated: The “deaf” is one who hears with great difficulty.

original: yan lag nyams pa ni lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa tshad las chung ba nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag nyams pa ni lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa tshad las chung ba nyid do //
translated: The “cripple” is one whose hands, feet, etc. are smaller than normal.

original: yan lag ma tshang ba ni yan lag lhag pa 'am ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang ba ni yan lag lhag pa 'am ma tshang ba'o //
translated: The “deformed” is one who is either missing a limb or has an extra one.

original: mdog mi sdug pa ni yan lag rnams mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: mdog mi sdug pa ni yan lag rnams mi sdug pa'o //
translated: The “ugly” is one whose limbs are unattractive.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, the Lord has said, “What is the reason for that?” Anticipating this question, he says, “Therein, the bodhisattva,” etc.

original: rang bzhin gyi yongs su dag pa nyid kyis stobs la sogs pa yongs su dag par mi 'thad pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yongs su dag pa nyid kyis stobs la sogs pa yongs su dag par mi 'thad pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The non-feasibility of the purification of the powers, etc. by the intrinsic purity is stated by the Lord with the words: “Subhuti, when all dharmas are empty of own-marks, then this is not feasible: ‘these are the five skandhas,’ etc.

original: kun rdzob tu rtogs pa ni rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rtogs pa ni rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The understanding of the conventional is stated with the words: “Subhuti, it is so, it is so.”

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to remove the doubt that the above is not feasible, he says: “Why is it so, Subhuti? Because all dharmas are empty of own-marks.”

original: 'di skad du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid yin yang ngo bo nyid kyi dag pa'i chos yongs su mi shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la de lta bu'i ye shes bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i chos bsgom
analyzed: 'di skad du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid yin yang ngo bo nyid kyi dag pa'i chos yongs su mi shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la de lta bu'i ye shes bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i chos bsgom
translated: The meaning is that although all dharmas are intrinsically pure, the illusory dharmas are cultivated in order to generate that kind of knowledge in those beings who are endowed with the ignorance of the dharmas that are pure by intrinsic reality.

original: pa la mi zhum pa nyid kyis na kun rdzob tu stobs la sogs pa yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: pa la mi zhum pa nyid kyis na kun rdzob tu stobs la sogs pa yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: By not being discouraged in that, one attains the purification of the powers, etc. in the conventional sense.

original: bcu pa sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sa chen po'i phyogs gang na zhes bya ba la sogs @286b pa gsungs pa yin te ba tsha can ni lan tshva mang ba'o
analyzed: bcu pa sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sa chen po'i phyogs gang na zhes bya ba la sogs @286b pa gsungs pa yin te ba tsha can ni lan tshva mang ba'o
translated: The meaning of the increase of the characteristic of being a Buddha-family member is stated in the tenth chapter beginning with Subhuti, it is thus: for example, in whatever place there is a great earth... and so on. Salty means having much salt.

original: // gram sa nis phyogs rtsub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: // gram sa nis phyogs rtsub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Sandy means having rough places.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams las rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa 'phel ba thob par 'os pa rnams ni nyung ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams las rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa 'phel ba thob par 'os pa rnams ni nyung ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: By saying Bodhisattvas are few, it shows that those who are worthy of attaining the increase of the peak realization among the Buddha-families are indeed few.

original: bcu gcig pa 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdag nyid can gyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dpe'i dbye bas 'gres gsum bstan pa ni rab 'byor gzhan yang 'di lta ste dper na sems can gyi ris ni
analyzed: bcu gcig pa 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdag nyid can gyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dpe'i dbye bas 'gres gsum bstan pa ni rab 'byor gzhan yang 'di lta ste dper na sems can gyi ris ni
translated: The eleventh is the three examples of the small, medium and great increase of the meaning of the cause for attaining the result of buddhahood itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thob pa'i rgyu rnam par 'phel ba bcu gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thob pa'i rgyu rnam par 'phel ba bcu gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement Subhūti, it is like this: for example, in the realm of sentient beings... and so on is said. The so-called path of the perfection of wisdom means the eleventh increase of the cause for attaining the tathagata, that is the meaning of the term.

original: bcu gnyis pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The twelfth is the meaning of the increase of the nature of non-arising of the mind that is discordant with the perfections. The statement Subhūti, moreover, a bodhisattva... and so on is said.

original: de la thab zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i lo rtog mi skya ba'i don gyis de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la thab zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i lo rtog mi skya ba'i don gyis de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The word fire means the non-arising of the thought of the wholesome roots, and that is the afflictions of passion, etc.

original: bcu gsum pa gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtogs pa'i sems mi skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtogs pa'i sems mi skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of the increase of the own-being of the non-arising of the thought of the realization of the possession of form, etc., is stated in the passage beginning with Subhuti, thus should a Bodhisattva and so on.

original: de la kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas go rims bzhin du yang dag par gzung pa dang yongs su gzung ba dang mchog tu gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pas go rims bzhin du yang dag par gzung pa dang yongs su gzung ba dang mchog tu gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: There, by the attachment to the imagined, the relative, and the fulfilled natures, one becomes respectively one who grasps at what is right, one who grasps at what is wrong, and one who grasps at what is supreme.

original: phyin ci log dang bral ba nyid kyis na rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su song bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang bral ba nyid kyis na rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su song bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And by being free from error, one becomes one who has gone to the goal.

original: bcu bzhi pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bsdus pa shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i nang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bsdus pa shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i nang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the increase of the perfection of knowledge that summarizes all the perfections is stated in the passage beginning “Subhūti, it is thus: for example, within the view of the transitory collection…”

original: lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni tshangs pa'i dra bas zhus pa la sogs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni tshangs pa'i dra bas zhus pa la sogs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The sixty-two views should be understood from the Questions of Brahma’s Net and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung mangs kyi dogs nas ma bris so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung mangs kyi dogs nas ma bris so //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not write more here.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par 'phel ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu'i srog gi dbang po'i nang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par 'phel ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu'i srog gi dbang po'i nang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: To clarify the increase of the perfections as explained above, the passage beginning “Subhūti, it is thus: for example, within the life faculty of a person…” is stated.

original: @287a * // bco lnga pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @287a * // bco lnga pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the increase of the nature of obtaining all perfections is stated in “Subhūti, therefore, a bodhisattva mahāsattva…” and so on.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bsod nams kyi mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bsod nams kyi mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the question “Why is that?” is anticipated and answered, “Because it is the supreme merit.”

original: don nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir dri bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir dri bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach the meaning extensively, the question is asked, “Subhūti, what do you think?” and so on.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The question “Why is that?” is anticipated as before and answered, “Subhūti, a bodhisattva…” and so on.

original: de la mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam bzhi rtogs pa yin pas na bla na med par 'gyur bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam bzhi rtogs pa yin pas na bla na med par 'gyur bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi smos pa yin no //
translated: The four phrases beginning with “unsurpassed” are mentioned because of the realization of the four paths of seeing and so on.

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gsum thob par byed pa yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi rnam rol pas zhes bya ba la sogs tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gsum thob par byed pa yin pas na sangs rgyas kyi rnam rol pas zhes bya ba la sogs tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “the manifestation of the Buddha” are mentioned because of the attainment of the three bodies: the Dharma body, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body.🔽When all perfections are attained, one becomes a śrāvaka.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa na nyan thos su yang 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la bcom ldan 'das ci nyan thos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob pa na nyan thos su yang 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la bcom ldan 'das ci nyan thos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: In response to this doubt, Subhūti says, “Blessed One, how is one a śrāvaka?”

original: gzhan gyi don nyid du slob pas nyan thos ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid du slob pas nyan thos ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor nyan thos kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said that one is not a śrāvaka because one trains for the sake of others. “Subhūti, even the perfection of a śrāvaka” and so on.

original: bcu drug pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar gyur pa'i rang gi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po da ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu drug pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar gyur pa'i rang gi rnam par 'phel ba'i don ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po da ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the increase of one's own in the approach to perfect complete enlightenment is stated in the passage beginning with Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, now.

original: de la yang mngon par zhen pa 'ching ba yin pa ni yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' de 'di ji snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mngon par zhen pa 'ching ba yin pa ni yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' de 'di ji snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There, the bondage of attachment is stated in the passage beginning with If the Bodhisattva thinks.

original: mi spyod de zhes bya ba ni dngos po la nye bar dmigs pa ni phyin ci log yin zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mi spyod de zhes bya ba ni dngos po la nye bar dmigs pa ni phyin ci log yin zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Does not practice means that the perception of an entity is a perversion.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid de kho na nyid yin pa ni de ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid de kho na nyid yin pa ni de ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The reality of non-attachment is stated in the passage beginning with That is.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa nyid ni rnam par 'phel ba yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa nyid ni rnam par 'phel ba yin par gzung ngo //
translated: Thus, just as it was explained, the increase should be understood.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: 'dzam bu gling sogs skye bo snyed //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling sogs skye bo snyed //
translated: As many beings as there are in Jambudvipa,

original: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs //
translated: The virtues of worshiping the Buddhas, and so on,

original: rnam mang du ni dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: rnam mang du ni dper mdzad nas //
translated: are cited as many examples,

original: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //
translated: and are the nature of the sixteen increases.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par @287b rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las bslab pa'i la'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o /🔽// / de ltar rnam par 'phel bas rnam par spel ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bdag nyid du gyur par son pa mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid nges par bstan pa'i don du bsngags par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa nyid
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par @287b rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las bslab pa'i la'u zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o / // / de ltar rnam par 'phel bas rnam par spel ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bdag nyid du gyur par son pa mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid nges par bstan pa'i don du bsngags par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa nyid
translated: This concludes the twenty-fifth chapter of the Treatise on the Pith Instructions of the Perfection of Wisdom, called “The Trainings.”

original: kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the definition of the culmination of the training, which is the arrival at the nature of the peak experience of the training, the praise is stated with “The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with the training in the perfection of wisdom…” and so forth.

original: de dag ni 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa rnyed par dka' ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa rnyed par dka' ba nyid du ston to //
translated: The phrase “these should be desired” teaches the difficulty of attaining the peak experience of the training.

original: dad pa phul du byung ba yang dag par skyes pa nyid kyis 'dod pa la smod par byed pas de nges par ston par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i gang zag dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa phul du byung ba yang dag par skyes pa nyid kyis 'dod pa la smod par byed pas de nges par ston par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i gang zag dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Because of the arising of perfect, excellent faith, one disparages desire. The one who teaches that is the person of the Bodhisattva Vehicle, etc.

original: khyer bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ded par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyer bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ded par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is carried away is the one who is carried across.

original: mi mnyam pa'i nyes pa thams cad med pa'i phyir pha rol gyi 'gram mnyam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i nyes pa thams cad med pa'i phyir pha rol gyi 'gram mnyam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The even shore on the other side is nirvana, i.e., Buddhahood, because it is free from all the faults of unevenness.

original: kha cig ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i don gyi phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis na go rims bzhin du de dag gi 'tshal ba dang yongs su bsams pa dang yongs su bzung ba'i zhes bya'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i don gyi phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis na go rims bzhin du de dag gi 'tshal ba dang yongs su bsams pa dang yongs su bzung ba'i zhes bya'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some believe that what they desire, what they intend, and what they hold refer, respectively, to the perfection of one's own and others' aims and the perfection of both.

original: gzhan dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis na de skad ces bya'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis na de skad ces bya'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: The others are so called because they bring about the completion of the three knowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase “those qualities of a buddha” is a statement of the topic.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos de dag dang rang byung gi chos de dag dang zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrogs pa'i chos de dag dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi🔽dbye bas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i chos de dag dang rang byung gi chos de dag dang zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrogs pa'i chos de dag dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbye bas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those qualities endowed with knowledge, those qualities of self-arising, those qualities that are not lost, and those qualities that are not shared in common are explained by way of the three knowledges, such as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: des na de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos bla na med pa yongs su rdzogs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos bla na med pa yongs su rdzogs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the unsurpassable qualities of the three knowledges are described as being complete.

original: de yang sems can gyi don yongs su btang ba'i nges pa yin zhes gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can gyi don yongs su btang ba'i nges pa yin zhes gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The request to not abandon the welfare of sentient beings is expressed by the phrase “Blessed One, if we were to hear such a teaching from another buddha, Blessed One, we would go to him and ask about it.”

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba spang ba'i don du snying rje chen po mngon du byed pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sems
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bu rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba spang ba'i don du snying rje chen po mngon du byed pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sems
translated: Having great compassion means that even at the time of realizing suchness, he manifests great compassion in order to abandon falling into nirvana, and thus he engages in the welfare of sentient beings and so on.

original: bskyed pas snying rje chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pas snying rje chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he has great compassion.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsol @288a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsol @288a * //
translated: Similarly, anticipating the question, Why is that?

original: pa ni gang dag sems bskyed pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni gang dag sems bskyed pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, Those who give rise to such an attitude... and so on.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par dang mi slob pa'i lam rtogs pa'i dbye bas go rims bzhin du bdag brgal bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang khyad par dang mi slob pa'i lam rtogs pa'i dbye bas go rims bzhin du bdag brgal bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi smos pa yin no //
translated: The four phrases having crossed over, and so on, are stated respectively in terms of the categories of the paths of seeing, meditation, no more learning, and the distinctive path.

original: 'di skad ces yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su snying rje chen po la sogs pa mngon du byed pa'i ngo bos sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad
analyzed: 'di skad ces yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su snying rje chen po la sogs pa mngon du byed pa'i ngo bos sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad
translated: In this way, by the power of skill in means, at the stage of nonconceptuality, the essence of manifesting great compassion and so on is the defining characteristic of not abandoning the welfare of sentient beings.

original: mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos sems bskyed pa la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa bla na med pa ni nges pa zhes bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos sems bskyed pa la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa bla na med pa ni nges pa zhes bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The complete, unsurpassed generation of the thought of all-knowledge and so on, as mentioned above, is called the “ascertainment” of the three types of all-knowledge, such as all-knowledge, as explained above.

original: de skad du yang /🔽kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: de skad du yang / kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyi //
translated: And it is said:🔽The complete, unsurpassed

original: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
translated: Dharmas of the three types of all-knowledge

original: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //🔽bstan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba // bstan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: Are not abandoning the welfare of sentient beings.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is called the teaching.

original: de ltar bstan pas nges par gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni sems kun tu gnas pa yin pas de bstan pa'i phyir zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas nges par gyur pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni sems kun tu gnas pa yin pas de bstan pa'i phyir zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te /
translated: Since the characteristics of ascertained things are taught in that way, the characteristic of the mind’s abiding is taught.

original: gang rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa de dag bsod nams ji tsam zhig sgye bar 'gyur zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: gang rjes su yi rang bar bgyid pa de dag bsod nams ji tsam zhig sgye bar 'gyur zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The question is asked, “Bhagavan, how much merit will those who rejoice in this have?”

original: theg pa la dang por zhugs pa dang / dpyod pa la zhugs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang skye ba gcig gis thogs ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni kha cig na re ci rigs par sngar bshad pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gis rnam par rtog pa bzhi'i gnyen po rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pas rnam pa bzhir
analyzed: theg pa la dang por zhugs pa dang / dpyod pa la zhugs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang skye ba gcig gis thogs ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni kha cig na re ci rigs par sngar bshad pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gis rnam par rtog pa bzhi'i gnyen po rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pas rnam pa bzhir
translated: “Those who have entered the vehicle for the first time, those who have entered analysis, those who are irreversible, and those who are impeded by a single birth” — by this, some assert that the four types of realization of the four types of antidotes to the four types of conceptuality are taught by the previously explained paths of seeing and meditation, respectively.

original: bshad pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: bshad pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: They assert that the four types are explained.

original: gzhan dag ni rtags dang / rnam par 'phel ba dang / brtan pa dang / sems kun tu gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i dbye bas ba shad pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rtags dang / rnam par 'phel ba dang / brtan pa dang / sems kun tu gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i dbye bas ba shad pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the first is explained by the distinctions of sign, increase, stability, and the realization of the nature of mental stability.

original: de la theg pa dang po la zhugs ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de la theg pa dang po la zhugs ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: Here, the first vehicle is the stage of action in faith.

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bdun pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bdun pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The one who has entered action is the one who abides in the seven stages beginning with the Joyous.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa sa gsum la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa sa gsum la gnas pa'o //
translated: The irreversible one is the one who abides in the three stages beginning with Immovable.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni sa bcu pa'o zhes gzhan dag 'chad do //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni sa bcu pa'o zhes gzhan dag 'chad do //
translated: The one obstructed by a single birth is the tenth stage.

original: sems kun tu gnas pa ston pas nus pa'i lan gyi don gsungs @288b pa ni koo shi ka yang ri rab ri'i rgyal po yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kun tu gnas pa ston pas nus pa'i lan gyi don gsungs @288b pa ni koo shi ka yang ri rab ri'i rgyal po yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer to the question of the ability to teach mental stability is stated in the passage beginning with “Kausika, even Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains.”

original: srang grangs su zhes bya ba ni srang ga tshad kyis so //
analyzed: srang grangs su zhes bya ba ni srang ga tshad kyis so //
translated: “In terms of weight” means in terms of the amount of weight.

original: 'di skad du tshad dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis srad tshad 'di tsam zhig go zhes tsha de gzhal bar nus so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis gling bzhi pa la stong gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad ni gzung du rung gi
analyzed: 'di skad du tshad dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis srad tshad 'di tsam zhig go zhes tsha de gzhal bar nus so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis gling bzhi pa la stong gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad ni gzung du rung gi
translated: In this way, the measure of the trichiliocosm can be grasped by yogins and yoginis, but🔽the measure of the merit of rejoicing is not like that.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshad ni de lta ma yin no zhes don gyi thabs kyis bsod nams tshad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid ni sems kun tu gnas pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams kyi tshad ni de lta ma yin no zhes don gyi thabs kyis bsod nams tshad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid ni sems kun tu gnas pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the nature of the samadhi of merit beyond measure is said to be the complete stability of the mind.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:🔽Taking as an example the four continents, the one thousand worlds,

original: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
translated: and the second and third thousand worlds,

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //🔽ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni // ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
translated: through the abundance of merit,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the samadhi is proclaimed.

original: rtags la sogs pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la dro ba la sogs pa des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin par khong du chung par bya'o //
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la dro ba la sogs pa des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin par khong du chung par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that those signs, etc. are, respectively, the nature of the four aspects of the heat, etc. of the clear realization of the peak.🔽After the factors conducive to penetrative insight, there is the path of seeing, which is to be explained as the antidote to the four types of conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders that are discordant with it.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam yin te des de na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin po gnyen po dang bcas pa brjod par bya ba yin pas re zhig thog mar 'jug pa'i phyogs
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam yin te des de na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin po gnyen po dang bcas pa brjod par bya ba yin pas re zhig thog mar 'jug pa'i phyogs
translated: First, the path of seeing is taught in the context of the first conception of apprehendeds that is based on all of them.

original: ma lus pa la brten pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das sems can gang dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa la brten pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das sems can gang dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Those sentient beings who are of the Mahāyāna and who have entered the Mahāyāna…”

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa bdud kyi phyogs su gyur pa bdud kyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa zhes bya ba ni smod par brjod pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa bdud kyi phyogs su gyur pa bdud kyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa zhes bya ba ni smod par brjod pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: The three words blessed by Mara, fallen into Mara's power, and died in Mara's domain are used to distinguish the small, middling, and great degrees of the deprecation.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems bskyed pa 'di dag mngon par bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems bskyed pa 'di dag mngon par bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, anticipating the question, Why is that? he says, Blessed One, those who have accomplished these productions of the thought....

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan nas rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa de nyid ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan nas rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa de nyid ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: Having taught by way of the reverse, he teaches the very same misconception by way of the forward order, saying, Blessed One, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who....

original: sgyu ma lta bur bsgoms pas gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de lta bu'i sems bskyed pa dang rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa la @289a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur bsgoms pas gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de lta bu'i sems bskyed pa dang rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa la @289a * //
translated: By cultivating the illusion-like, the bodhisattvas, free from the discriminations of duality and non-duality, should enter into the generation of the thought, the rejoicing, etc.

original: 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “should enter into.”

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na rjes su gsung bar mdzad pa ni koo shi ka de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na rjes su gsung bar mdzad pa ni koo shi ka de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is well-spoken, the approval is stated by “Thus it is, Kauśika,” etc.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ston pa ni koo shi ka rigs kyi bu bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ston pa ni koo shi ka rigs kyi bu bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The second apprehension-discrimination based on the side of negation is taught by “Kauśika, the son or daughter of a family…” etc.

original: mi mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i dngos po gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las ldog pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mi mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i dngos po gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las ldog pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: “Does not displease” means that the power of turning away from the apprehension-discrimination of the thing to be abandoned is intended.

original: de bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa yin pa nyid kyis na bsngags par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa yin pa nyid kyis na bsngags par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the Bhagavān is just so, and so forth.

original: 'di skad du 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs dag la go rims bzhin du len pa dang 'dor ba'i rnam pas gzung bar bya ba yin no snyam pa ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i
analyzed: 'di skad du 'jug pa dang ldog pa mi dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs dag la go rims bzhin du len pa dang 'dor ba'i rnam pas gzung bar bya ba yin no snyam pa ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i
translated: Thus, it is said that the aspects of engagement and disengagement, and the non-apprehension and the nature of non-apprehension, are to be respectively accepted and rejected in terms of the mode of apprehension.🔽The conceptual thoughts of apprehension based on the aspects of engagement and disengagement are, because they engage without connection to the thing, mistaken appearances.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni dngos po dang ma 'brel par 'jug pa nyid kyis na log par snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par rang bzhin can 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgur
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni dngos po dang ma 'brel par 'jug pa nyid kyis na log par snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par rang bzhin can 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgur
translated: They are not in accordance with the object. They are explained to be of nine types, individually, by the division of the object, as will be explained.

original: gyur pa rnam pa ni gegs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang 'dra bar de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa rnam pa ni gegs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang 'dra bar de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Since they are obstacles, they should be known as adverse factors, like the afflictions.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
translated: In engagement and disengagement,

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de //
translated: the discriminations of the apprehended are each

original: dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //🔽min pa'i bdag nyid dag shes bya //
analyzed: dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul // min pa'i bdag nyid dag shes bya //
translated: of the nature of nine,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and should be known as the nature of the non-object.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bshad par bya ba yin pas so so'i skye bo'i skyes bu rdzas su yod pa'i rten can gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bstan pa ni de ltar rjes
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bshad par bya ba yin pas so so'i skye bo'i skyes bu rdzas su yod pa'i rten can gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bstan pa ni de ltar rjes
translated: Thus, having explained the two discriminations of the apprehended, the two discriminations of the apprehender should be explained. The first discrimination of the apprehender, which is based on the substantial existence of the individual person, is taught as follows:

original: su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, with a mind of rejoicing, generate the thought of enlightenment, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsol pa ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni bdag rdzas su yod pa kho na la 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pas mngon par zhen nas dge pa la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa de'i phyir @289b 'bras bu bkur stir
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas gsol pa ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gang gi phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni bdag rdzas su yod pa kho na la 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pas mngon par zhen nas dge pa la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa de'i phyir @289b 'bras bu bkur stir
translated: The response to this qualm is stated with “Thus, son of noble family…” and so forth.

original: byas par 'gyur ba la sogs pa brjod kyi gzhan sangs rgya nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byas par 'gyur ba la sogs pa brjod kyi gzhan sangs rgya nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reason is that ordinary beings, thinking that the self is substantially existent, cling to it with the conception that it exists. They rejoice in virtue. Therefore, the result is said to be an honor to the self and so on, but not to buddhahood and so on. This is the meaning.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kyang chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes shes pa ma yin nam 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog par gzhag pa dang po ni ma khyab pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kyang chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes shes pa ma yin nam 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog par gzhag pa dang po ni ma khyab pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it the case that ordinary beings also know that all phenomena are selfless? The first formulation of the conception is not universal.

original: de rnams kyi de ni lhag par mos pa yid la byed pa yin la 'dir ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pa yin par bzhed pas mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de ni lhag par mos pa yid la byed pa yin la 'dir ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pa yin par bzhed pas mi mtshungs so //
translated: The latter is the attention of superior aspiration, but here it is the attention on reality, so they are not similar.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag gis btags pa tsam du yod pa'i rten can gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gis 'dun pa bskyed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag gis btags pa tsam du yod pa'i rten can gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gis 'dun pa bskyed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bgyid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag btags par yod pa nyid 'dzin pa po yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pas 'phags pa rnams rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems bskyed
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bgyid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag btags par yod pa nyid 'dzin pa po yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pas 'phags pa rnams rjes su yi rang bar byed pa'i sems bskyed
translated: The conception of the self as the apprehender of mere nominal existence is the conception of the self as the apprehender of the mere nominal existence of the self.🔽The conception of the self as the apprehender of the mere nominal existence of the self is the conception of the self as the apprehender of the mere nominal existence of the self.

original: pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ni gtso bla na med pa'i byang chub yang dag par bskyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rjes su brjod pa gsungs pa ni koo shi ka de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

translated: Because it is not in contradiction with reality, the expression of approval is stated: “Kauśika, through the power of the Tathāgata,” and so on.

original: chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rjes su yi rang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas rjes su yi rang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin no //

original: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas //
translated: They are divided into ordinary beings and āryas.

original: sems can rdzas dang btags yod par //
analyzed: sems can rdzas dang btags yod par //
translated: They are sentient beings, substantial realities, and imputed realities.

original: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: They are conceptualizations and apprehensions.

original: so sor de dag dgu bdag nyid //
analyzed: so sor de dag dgu bdag nyid //
translated: Individually, they have nine natures.

original: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
analyzed: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
translated: If the object of apprehension does not exist in that way,

original: de dag gang gi 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag gang gi 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: what do you assert they apprehend?

original: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yin //
translated: In that way, they are apprehensions.

original: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are defined as empty of essence.

original: de la yul gyi dbye bas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ji ltar na rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la yul gyi dbye bas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ji ltar na rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: Here, how are the first conceptualizations that apprehend objects divided into nine types?

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don ston pas bcom ldan 'das sems sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don ston pas bcom ldan 'das sems sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān was asked, “The mind is like an illusion,” and so on, demonstrating the meaning of engaging conceptualization.

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni rnam pa gang gis so //
translated: “ In what way” means “by what type of aspect.”

original: de kho na nyid du ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshag na rgya bar 'gyur ba ni sems sgyu ma lta bu ma yin la sgyu ma nyid ma yin zhing de las gzhan ba'i chos kyang ma yin no zhes slar dris pa'i sgo nas
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshag na rgya bar 'gyur ba ni sems sgyu ma lta bu ma yin la sgyu ma nyid ma yin zhing de las gzhan ba'i chos kyang ma yin no zhes slar dris pa'i sgo nas
translated: In reality, if one were to fully and completely realize any aspect, then it would be substantial, but it is not like that. It is not a mind that is like an illusion, nor is it an illusion, nor is it a phenomenon that is other than that.

original: ston pas rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pas rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Teacher said this in response to Subhūti’s question, “What do you think, Subhūti?” and so on.🔽The passage beginning “Subhūti, any phenomenon that is utterly isolated” means that any phenomenon that is empty of essence is not understood to exist because it is not produced.

original: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni zhes bya ba ni chos gang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par mi 'gyur la /🔽yul med pa la dgag pa yi //
analyzed: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni zhes bya ba ni chos gang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par mi 'gyur la / yul med pa la dgag pa yi //
translated: It is not tenable to say that it does not exist🔽because of the reasoning that goes,🔽“There is no application of negation

original: sbyor ba legs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba legs pa yod ma yin //
translated: to that which does not exist as an object.”

original: rnam par rtog la brten na yang //
analyzed: rnam par rtog la brten na yang //
translated: If it were based on conceptualization,

original: kun rdzob par 'gyur yang dag min //
analyzed: kun rdzob par 'gyur yang dag min //
translated: it would be conventional, not real.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas med pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas med pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is not tenable to say that it does not exist.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slang du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das chos ma mchis pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slang du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das chos ma mchis pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: As before, he raises the doubt, Why is that? and says, Bhagavan, a non-existent dharma....

original: chos thams cad dben pa nyid kyis na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por med pa ni chos gang shin tu dben pa'i chos de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa nyid kyis na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por med pa ni chos gang shin tu dben pa'i chos de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: Since all dharmas are void, they do not exist as causes and effects. He says, A dharma that is utterly void... and so on.

original: thob par bgyid pa 'am spong bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa 'am 'jig par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thob par bgyid pa 'am spong bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa 'am 'jig par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To attain or abandon means to produce or destroy.

original: @290b don 'di nyid rgya cher ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: @290b don 'di nyid rgya cher ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: To extensively teach this very meaning, he says, Bhagavan, how... and so on.

original: de kho na nyid du rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs pa po med pa nyid do zhes nye bar sdud pas gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs pa po med pa nyid do zhes nye bar sdud pas gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To summarize, there is no realization of reality and no realizer, he says, Bhagavan, when... and so on.

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na rjes su snang bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //🔽'on kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu shin tu rnam par dag pa las 'bras bu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin rab 'byor gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis phyin ci ma
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na rjes su snang bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // 'on kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu shin tu rnam par dag pa las 'bras bu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin rab 'byor gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis phyin ci ma
translated: The one who is pleased by the good speech is Subhuti, and the one who says well said, well said is the Lord.

original: log pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: However, it is said that from a very pure cause, a pure effect arises in the conventional sense. Subhuti, because... and so on, means that because both cause and effect are like illusions, there is no error.

original: dben pa zhes bya bar yang mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽rgyal bas stong nyid lta kun yang //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya bar yang mngon par zhen par bya ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // rgyal bas stong nyid lta kun yang //
translated: This is the intention. Subhuti, it is said... and so on, means that even emptiness should not be grasped as emptiness.

original: nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs //
translated: The Victorious One taught emptiness as the relinquishment of all views.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: de dag sgrub tu med par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag sgrub tu med par gsungs //
translated: are said to be incapable of being established.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dben pa la mngon par zhen pa yang phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis dben pa la mngon par zhen pa yang phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the essence of the error is the adherence to voidness.

original: de la yin na ni de rtogs nas ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhe na /
analyzed: de la yin na ni de rtogs nas ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhe na /
translated: If it were so, then having realized it, how could one fully awaken to enlightenment?

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To this, the Lord says, “Subhūti, the bodhisattva who thus…” and so on.

original: de ltar ma brtags na gcig pu nyams dga' ba nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin du yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ma brtags na gcig pu nyams dga' ba nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin du yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, if one does not analyze, it is the nature of the superficial, since it is delightful as a solitary state. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyis na don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And just this is stated from the point of view of the ultimate, “Subhūti, the bodhisattva who thus…” and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu nye bar bsdu ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu nye bar bsdu ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary in terms of the conventional is indicated by the passage beginning with “Subhūti, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, the great being, should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bka' stsal ba'i don zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya mod kyi mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba'i don zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya mod kyi mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement is “although he does not fully awaken, he does fully awaken.”

original: de bzhin du rjes su gsung bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su gsung bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement of agreement is indicated by the passage beginning with “So it is, Subhūti.”

original: dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The statement “he is one who does what is difficult” is intended to mean “based on the conventional truth.”

original: de nyid kyis na don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang @291a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang @291a * //
translated: Therefore, in terms of the ultimate truth,

original: du byas pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: du byas pa ni bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin te /
translated: the question is asked in the passage beginning with “Bhagavān, how is it?”

original: bka' stsal pa'i zhes bya ba ni dka' ba byed pa 'di yin zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa'i zhes bya ba ni dka' ba byed pa 'di yin zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: The statement “he is one who does what is difficult” is the meaning of the statement.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to ;
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to ;
translated: Similarly, in order to respond to the doubt, Why is that? he says, Bhagavan, it is because of this.

original: / byed pa po dang las dang bya ba mi dmigs par bstan pa la mi zhum pa la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa nyid kyis na rgyal ba'i yum la spyod pa yin par gsol pa ni
analyzed: / byed pa po dang las dang bya ba mi dmigs par bstan pa la mi zhum pa la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa nyid kyis na rgyal ba'i yum la spyod pa yin par gsol pa ni
translated: He says, They practice the Mother of the Victorious Ones by engaging in the perfection of wisdom through not being disheartened by the teaching of the non-apprehension of agent, action, and object, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'di skad bshad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'di skad bshad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, Bhagavan, if this is explained like this, and so forth.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the second conception is expressed by Bhagavan, it is like this, and so forth.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba 'dis ni rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa bsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba 'dis ni rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa bsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: By saying because of the non-apprehension of conceptions, he teaches the elimination of the conception of lineage.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of the third conception is expressed by Bhagavan, it is like this, and so forth.🔽

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: For example, a magical person and so on.

original: 'di snyam du bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur te zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur te zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: By I have approached unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he removes the conception of true establishment.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na gzugs brnyan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi ba'i don ni bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na gzugs brnyan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di skad du dben pas dben pa ma rtogs pa'i tshul du /

original: sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa dang / sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa dang / snang brnyan tsam du zad pas shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul pa dang /
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa la 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa dang / sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam yang dag par 'grub pa dang / snang brnyan tsam du zad pas shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul pa dang /
translated: It is the definite lineage of a buddha since it enters the levels of buddhahood, such as the Immovable and so on. It is the perfect accomplishment of the path of seeing and so on since it realizes the illusion like nature of phenomena.

original: yon tan dang skyon mthong ba sngon du 'gro pa'i blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba la sogs pa nyid kyis rang gi rtogs pa dang / dman zhing gya nom pa ma yin pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa thag sring bar byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon mthong ba sngon du 'gro pa'i blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba la sogs pa nyid kyis rang gi rtogs pa dang / dman zhing gya nom pa ma yin pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa thag sring bar byed pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the undeluded object of consciousness since it is merely a reflection. It is the antidote and the counteragent since it is preceded by the observation of good qualities and faults. It is the distancing of the lower levels of śrāvakas and so on since it is the realization of all, it is not inferior and it is not gross.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba dad mthun pas sprul pas sems can gyi don bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis skye bo thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i 'bras bu la skyon med pa nyid kyis ni rnam pa thams cad du gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu gzung
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba dad mthun pas sprul pas sems can gyi don bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis skye bo thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i 'bras bu la skyon med pa nyid kyis ni rnam pa thams cad du gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu gzung
translated: One should understand that the bodhisattva's practice is to be adopted in all ways by those who have the intention to benefit others, by those who are endowed with the intention to benefit others through emanations and by those who are endowed with the power of correct skill in means, since they are faultless in the result of establishing all beings in nirvana.🔽

original: pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can rnam pa dgu ni rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pas de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas

translated: The first nine aspects of the conception of apprehending are to be abandoned by bodhisattvas on the peak stage of the path of seeing, the stage of preparation.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni dka' ba byed pa ma yin te /

analyzed: sems can rnams gdul bar bya'o snyam du zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin du zin kyang /

original: smras pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa yin te /
translated: and the answer is given:🔽Because sentient beings are isolated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni don dam par rdzas su dmigs su med pas sgyu ma lta bu nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni don dam par rdzas su dmigs su med pas sgyu ma lta bu nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Form and so on are like illusions, because they are not ultimately substantially perceived.

original: bar du zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word even includes the twelve sense bases and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas thugs su chud pa'i chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas thugs su chud pa'i chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: The phenomena realized by the Tathagatas and so on are also emptiness.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni lha'i bu dag de ltar na chos thams cad dben pa nyid du blta'o zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni lha'i bu dag de ltar na chos thams cad dben pa nyid du blta'o zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: The summary is stated: Thus, divine princes, all phenomena should be seen as isolated.

original: de ltar mi dmigs par bstan pa la zhum pa med par spyad par bya'o zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs par bstan pa la zhum pa med par spyad par bya'o zhes smras pa ni /
translated: The statement Thus, one should practice without discouragement in the teaching of non-apprehension is as follows:

original: lha'i bu dag gal te de ltar chos thams cad dben pa nyid du bshad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gal te de ltar chos thams cad dben pa nyid du bshad pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Divine princes, if it is said that all phenomena are explained as isolated, and so on.

original: skrag par mi byed pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: skrag par mi byed pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: What is the reason for not being afraid?

original: rab 'byor ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in “Subhūti, why is it so?” and so forth.

original: 'jigs pa po dang 'jigs pa dang 'jigs par bya ba ma dmigs par len zhus ba ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa po dang 'jigs pa dang 'jigs par bya ba ma dmigs par len zhus ba ni /
translated: The question about the non-apprehension of the one who is afraid, the fear, and that of which one is afraid,

original: bcom ldan 'das dben pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dben pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: is stated in “Bhagavan, it is because of being isolated” and so forth.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni bcom ldan 'das rgyu 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni bcom ldan 'das rgyu 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The summary is stated in “Bhagavan, for this reason” and so forth.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skrag par byed pa dang / skrag pa dang / skrag par bya ba med pas zhum par 'gyur ba med pa dang / de bas na gtsor nges par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skrag par byed pa dang / skrag pa dang / skrag par bya ba med pas zhum par 'gyur ba med pa dang / de bas na gtsor nges par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is saying that because of emptiness, there is no one who is afraid, no fear, and nothing of which one is afraid. Therefore, one does not become fainthearted. Therefore, one primarily practices the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of definite emergence.

original: de ltar na rjes la 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes la 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the postulation of a subsequent conceptualization is eliminated.

original: 'di skad du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / thabs mkhas ba dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / thabs mkhas ba dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: it is without support because it lacks a spiritual friend and skill in means,🔽it is an incomplete path because it is not the antidote for all the obscurations to omniscience,🔽it is a path that goes by the conditions of others because it depends on the instructions of the Tathagata and so forth,

original: shes bya'i sgrib ba mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis lam ma tshang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyis mchog nyid la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa nyid kyi ched du bya ba las ldog pa dang /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib ba mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis lam ma tshang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad kyis mchog nyid la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa nyid kyi ched du bya ba las ldog pa dang /
translated: it is the opposite of the purpose because it does not engage in the supreme and so forth for all sentient beings,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas /
translated: and it is not the antidote for the obscurations to omniscience because it is the antidote for the afflictive obscurations.

original: nyi tshe ba'i lam gyi byed pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid @293b kyis 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa mthong ba sna tshogs pa nyid dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i lam gyi byed pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid @293b kyis 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa mthong ba sna tshogs pa nyid dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa dang /
translated: The path of limited activity, the various views of the first result and so on due to having a focal object, not knowing the abodes and migrations due to not abandoning all latent states of ignorance,

original: theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mjug tu 'gro ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin pas ldog par
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mjug tu 'gro ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin pas ldog par
translated: the knowledge of all aspects that subsumes the entire Great Vehicle, and the final nirvana of all due to being faultless, are not to be apprehended.

original: bya ba bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rten can nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la blang bar bya ba nyid du byung ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog par bya ba'i phyogs kyi rten can nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la blang bar bya ba nyid du byung ba ni /
translated: The second conception to be reversed is the conception that the vehicle of the hearers and solitary realizers, which is the basis for the position to be reversed, is to be adopted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi spang bar bya ba yin par de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi spang bar bya ba yin par de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas /
translated: The minds and mental factors of the bodhisattva's path of seeing are objects to be abandoned because they are the occasion of the antidote to the objects to be abandoned.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in terms of the reversal of the objects to be abandoned.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of falling into existence and peace,

original: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
translated: inferior realization,🔽lack of complete acceptance,🔽lack of complete aspects of the path,🔽going by the conditions of others,🔽wrong practice,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dang // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya pa log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dang // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya pa log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
translated: limited practice, and various practices,🔽confusion about abodes and engagement,

original: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
translated: and following after others,

original: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
translated: these are the nine conceptual thoughts.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te //🔽nyan thos la sogs yid la 'byung //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te // nyan thos la sogs yid la 'byung //
translated: They are the basis of the reversal of the path of śrāvakas and so on.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They arise in the mind of śrāvakas and so on.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po skyes bu rdzas su yod pa so so'i skye bo'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po skyes bu rdzas su yod pa so so'i skye bo'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How is the first conception of grasping, which is based on the individual who is substantially existent, ninefold?

original: rtog pa dang po'i don ni /
analyzed: rtog pa dang po'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the first conception is

original: bcom ldan 'das chos gang la yang zhum par 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te 'dzin pa dang gtang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos gang la yang zhum par 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te 'dzin pa dang gtang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: the request, “Bhagavan, there is no dharma whatsoever that is discouraged,” and so on, because there is no conception of grasping and abandoning.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
translated: In order to clarify that, the request, “Why is that?” and so on, is made.

original: rnam par rtog ba gnyis pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog ba gnyis pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the second conception is

original: rab 'byor 'on kyang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'on kyang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin no //
translated: the request, “Subhūti, if, on the other hand,” and so on.

original: de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs su med par bstan pa la de ltar zhum par mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa gang spyod pa de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog🔽pa med pas rgyal ba'i @294a * //
analyzed: de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs su med par bstan pa la de ltar zhum par mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa gang spyod pa de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas rgyal ba'i @294a * //
translated: If one practices in that way, one practices the perfection of wisdom. This is the conceptual thought of mental activity.

original: yum la yang dag par spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
