analyzed: yum la yang dag par spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who practices without becoming discouraged, etc., in the teaching of the non-apprehension of all dharmas, practices correctly in the Mother of the Victors.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the third conceptual thought is

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as stated in the passage beginning with the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices in that way.

original: de ltar spyod pa la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khams gsum char dang 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar mthu chen po nyid thob pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khams gsum char dang 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar mthu chen po nyid thob pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: One who practices in that way is one who pays homage. One pays homage because one attains the state of great power, free from conceptual thought connected with all three realms.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the fourth conceptual thought is

original: rab 'byor 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med grangs med pa dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med grangs med pa dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: immeasurable world systems, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs te zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas khyad par can gyi don bskyed par bya bas dgongs pas rtog par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs te zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas khyad par can gyi don bskyed par bya bas dgongs pas rtog par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “He sees with the eye of a buddha” means that he is free from the discrimination of abiding, and he is intent on generating the special meaning, and he is intent on the thought.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni bya ba yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas rjes su 'dzin par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni bya ba yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas rjes su 'dzin par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “He benefits” means that he takes care of them by completing their activities.

original: dgongs par mdzad pa ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin du nges par 'dzin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs par mdzad pa ni skal ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin du nges par 'dzin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He is intent” means that he is intent on their nature of having good fortune.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid kyis bsngags pa ni rab 'byor gang yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phan 'dogs par mdzad pa nyid kyis bsngags pa ni rab 'byor gang yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The praise by the Tathāgata of his own benefit is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhūti, any bodhisattva.”

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The former, beginning with Why is it so, Subhuti? anticipates an objection and then says, Subhuti, in this great billion-world universe, etc.

original: 'di nyid rgya cher ston pa ni rab 'byor stong gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid rgya cher ston pa ni rab 'byor stong gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To explain this very point, he says, Subhuti, in this great billion-world universe, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa lnga pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lnga pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the fifth conception is

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: stated in Subhuti, a bodhisattva mahasattva who is endowed with Dharma, etc.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: By saying does not abandon all beings, he refutes the conception of non-existence.

original: chos thams cad stong par brtag pa yin te zhes bya ba 'dis dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong par brtag pa yin te zhes bya ba 'dis dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: By saying all dharmas are to be viewed as empty, he refutes the conception of existence.

original: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis po gzhan dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis po gzhan dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the sixth conception is stated in the passage beginning “Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva, a great being, is endowed with two dharmas.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dngos por brtags pa'i rnam par @294b rtog pa ngas rab tu spang bar bya'o zhes smras pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dngos por brtags pa'i rnam par @294b rtog pa ngas rab tu spang bar bya'o zhes smras pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” He does what he says he will do means that he fulfills the meaning of what he says, “I will completely abandon the conception that investigates the reality of dharmas.

original: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa yin no //
translated: ” For this very reason, he is considered by the Buddhas.

original: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the seventh conception is stated in the passage beginning “Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in this way.

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gnas pa 'di ni chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gnas pa 'di ni chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: ” This very perfection of wisdom, i.e., this station, is his mother, because it gives birth to the Tathāgatas.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to clarify that very thing, it is said, “Why is it so?”

original: de nyid kyis gnas shing de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dbye bas de skad smos pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gnas shing de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dbye bas de skad smos pa shes par bya'o //
translated: “Dwelling in that very thing and acting in that way” should be understood as referring to the distinction between meditative equipoise and subsequent attainment.

original: sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bcu gcig ni rab tu dga' ba nas brtsams te sangs rgyas kyi kun tu 'od kyi rab tu rtogs pa thob pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bcu gcig ni rab tu dga' ba nas brtsams te sangs rgyas kyi kun tu 'od kyi rab tu rtogs pa thob pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The eleven terms beginning with “the protector of sentient beings who are without a protector” should be applied in order, beginning with the Joyous, up to the attainment of the universal illumination of a Buddha.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni lha'i bu dag de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni lha'i bu dag de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary is stated in the passage beginning, “Thus, O sons of the gods…”

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' ji skad bshad pa'i gnas pas gnas pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ming la sogs pa yongs su brjod
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' ji skad bshad pa'i gnas pas gnas pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ming la sogs pa yongs su brjod
translated: Because the Bodhisattvas who abide by the abiding as explained are addressed by name, etc., by the Buddhas, the Lords,

original: par mdzad cing chos ston pa sngon du 'gro bar ched du brjod pa yang chad du brjod par mdzad pa de bas na spro ba 'phel bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par mdzad cing chos ston pa sngon du 'gro bar ched du brjod pa yang chad du brjod par mdzad pa de bas na spro ba 'phel bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and because they are taught the Dharma, and because they are made to utter the exclamation of rejoicing, therefore, the growth of their delight is made to increase.

original: 'di nyid dpes gsal bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid dpes gsal bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This very thing is clarified by an example, beginning with “Subhuti, it is thus, etc.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ming ni mtha' yas pa nyid kyis gzung bar mi nus pa nyid yin pas bsgre bar mdzad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ming ni mtha' yas pa nyid kyis gzung bar mi nus pa nyid yin pas bsgre bar mdzad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since the names of all bodhisattvas are infinite, they cannot be grasped, so he mentions them by saying “other bodhisattva great beings.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'a kya thub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na bsngags par 'os pa'i byang chub sems dpa' med do zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sh'a kya thub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na bsngags par 'os pa'i byang chub sems dpa' med do zhe na /
translated: If one says that there are no praiseworthy bodhisattvas in the buddha realm of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: de bzhin du rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says “Subhūti” and so on.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi sangs rgyas @295a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi sangs rgyas @295a * //
translated: This is saying, “In order to encourage the bodhisattvas who dwell in their own buddha realms, the Tathāgatas of other buddha realms praise the bodhisattvas of this buddha realm.”

original: kyi zhing na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming la sogs pa brjod pa la brtson zhing chos ston par mdzad pa de bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyang nga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming
analyzed: kyi zhing na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming la sogs pa brjod pa la brtson zhing chos ston par mdzad pa de bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyang nga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming
translated: Just as I teach the Dharma by striving to proclaim the names and so forth of the bodhisattvas who dwell in my buddha realm, likewise Akshobya and so forth also teach the Dharma by striving to proclaim the names and so forth of the bodhisattvas who dwell in my buddha realm.🔽

original: la sogs pa brjod pa la brtson pas chos ston to zhes brjod pa yin no //🔽rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa brjod pa la brtson pas chos ston to zhes brjod pa yin no // rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: Just as I teach the Dharma by endeavoring to proclaim the names, etc. of the bodhisattvas who dwell in my buddha-field, in the same way, Akṣobhya, etc. teach the Dharma by endeavoring to proclaim the names, etc. of the bodhisattvas who dwell in my buddha-field.🔽The meaning of the eighth conception is expressed in the question beginning with the words, “Those Lord Buddhas. . . .”

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i lan gyi tshig rnam par 'byed pa ni rab 'byor sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i lan gyi tshig rnam par 'byed pa ni rab 'byor sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The answer is analyzed in the words beginning with “Subhūti, those Lord Buddhas. . . .”

original: rab 'byor 'on kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni phyir mi ldog ba'i zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la gnas pa ni nges par phyir mi ldog pa thob pa yin no zhes
analyzed: rab 'byor 'on kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni phyir mi ldog ba'i zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la gnas pa ni nges par phyir mi ldog pa thob pa yin no zhes
translated: “But, Subhūti, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not declare those irreversible Bodhisattvas to be irreversible” means that those who abide on the eighth stage and so forth are definitely irreversible because they are free from the conception of an antidote.

original: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the ninth conception is expressed by the question, “Blessed One, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not declare those Bodhisattvas to be irreversible.”

original: yod pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, those Bodhisattvas who exist” and so forth is stated.

original: de dag nyid kyang gang zhig yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas ston pa ni gang da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyang gang zhig yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas ston pa ni gang da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Anticipating the doubt “What are they?” the teacher states “Those who are now” and so forth.

original: mi bskyod pa'i zhes gsungs pa ni de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rgyud yongs su dag pa mang du skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i zhes gsungs pa ni de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rgyud yongs su dag pa mang du skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Akshobhya” is stated because many of those who have purified their continuums are born in his buddha-field.

original: gzhan dag la yang bsgrib ni rab 'byor gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang bsgrib ni rab 'byor gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And also to others, Subhuti, it is said, “Whoever, etc.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rin po che tog smos pa ni de dang rigs mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nye bar mo tshan pa yin par shes par bya'o //🔽khyad par du 'phags pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pas yongs su bzung ba'i stobs kyis sa mi g-yob las kyang sngar ci zhig ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba thogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rdzu 'phrul la dbang thob pa'i byang chub
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rin po che tog smos pa ni de dang rigs mthun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nye bar mo tshan pa yin par shes par bya'o // khyad par du 'phags pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pas yongs su bzung ba'i stobs kyis sa mi g-yob las kyang sngar ci zhig ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba thogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rdzu 'phrul la dbang thob pa'i byang chub
translated: The mention of the Bodhisattva Ratnaketu should be understood as an instance of the inclusion of Bodhisattvas of similar type.

original: sems dpa' gang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa rnams ma gtogs par ming la sogs pa brjod pa'i yul du gyur pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems dpa' gang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gnas pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa rnams ma gtogs par ming la sogs pa brjod pa'i yul du gyur pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the power of being taken hold of by a special spiritual friend, etc., the Bodhisattva, who is unshakable, who has attained mastery over the superknowledges, who goes as he wishes without the concept of an obstruction, goes to the Buddha-fields of Akshobhya, etc., and is present there. He is present there, except for the irreversible Bodhisattvas, as an object of the expression of name, etc.

original: 'di skad du kun rdzob tu ji lta ba @295b bzhin du 'dzin pa dang 'dor bar byed pa dang / yang dag pa nyid du yid la mi byed par yid la mi byed pa dang / chos nyid kyi khams gsum char dang nye bar 'brel pa dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du kun rdzob tu ji lta ba @295b bzhin du 'dzin pa dang 'dor bar byed pa dang / yang dag pa nyid du yid la mi byed par yid la mi byed pa dang / chos nyid kyi khams gsum char dang nye bar 'brel pa dang /
translated: The element of reality is connected to all three realms,🔽and yet one should abide in emptiness without abiding in it.🔽One should not cling to things, and yet one should cling to all levels.🔽All phenomena are imputations, and yet they are not substantially existent.

original: stong pa nyid du mi gnas pas gnas pa dang / dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pa sa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa dang ; rdzas su yod pa med pas chos thams cad btags pa dang / de kho na nyid shes pa'i ma chags pas mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chags pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mi gnas pas gnas pa dang / dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pa sa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa dang ; rdzas su yod pa med pas chos thams cad btags pa dang / de kho na nyid shes pa'i ma chags pas mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chags pa dang /
translated: One should be free of attachment to the knowledge of thatness, and yet one should be attached.

original: mnyam pa nyid bsgom pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis gnyen po dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par ma shes pa nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba la thogs pa la don dam pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas 'dzin pa 'jug pa ni bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid yin no zhes
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid bsgom pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis gnyen po dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par ma shes pa nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba la thogs pa la don dam pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas 'dzin pa 'jug pa ni bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid yin no zhes
translated: The conception of the self as substantially existent is the engagement of the conception that apprehends the ultimate as a thing due to the nonunderstanding of the perfection of wisdom and the freedom to go as one wishes due to the obstruction of the conception of the self as substantially existent.

original: de ltar so so'i skye bo dang 'brel ba'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor pa'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas
analyzed: de ltar so so'i skye bo dang 'brel ba'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor pa'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas
translated: Thus the first nine aspects of the conception of the self that are related to ordinary beings are to be abandoned by bodhisattvas on the path of seeing during the stage of preparation.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the teaching of the antidotes to them.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus:

original: 'dzin pa dang ni 'dor ba dang // yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang ni 'dor ba dang // yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
translated: Apprehending, discarding, mental activity, and the elements,

original: gsum char nye bar 'brel pa dang // gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po brtags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //
analyzed: gsum char nye bar 'brel pa dang // gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po brtags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //
translated: The third is the imagination of the self of the person.

original: 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The first is the imagination of what is unreal,🔽The second is the imagination of the self of phenomena,🔽The third is the imagination of the self of the person.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: The second imagination of what is unreal is based on the imputed existence of a person. How is it ninefold?

original: rtog pa dang po'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang po'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the first conception is stated in the passage beginning “Subhūti, moreover, a bodhisattva mahāsattva…” and so on.

original: mos la zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid la sogs pa ched du bya bar 'gro ba'i bsam pas skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba 'am zhi ba'o zhes chos thams cad yid la byed cing da  dung mi skye ba'i chos la bzod
analyzed: mos la zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid la sogs pa ched du bya bar 'gro ba'i bsam pas skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba 'am zhi ba'o zhes chos thams cad yid la byed cing da  dung mi skye ba'i chos la bzod
translated: “Interest” means that with the intention of going to the goal of being supreme among all sentient beings and so on, one mentally engages with all phenomena, thinking “nonarising” or “peace,” and one obtains the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'am phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang thob pa rtogs par yang mi byed pa zhes pa ste de ltar na ched du bya bar nges par mi 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'am phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang thob pa rtogs par yang mi byed pa zhes pa ste de ltar na ched du bya bar nges par mi 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it shows the absence of the conceptual thought of uncertainty about the aim.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni rab @296a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni rab @296a * //
translated: The meaning of the second conceptual thought is as follows:

original: 'byor yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /🔽de dag ni nyan thos kyi sa rang sangs rgyas kyi sa spangs pa yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni lam nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'byor yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / de dag ni nyan thos kyi sa rang sangs rgyas kyi sa spangs pa yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni lam nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: Subhuti, those Lord Buddhas do not reveal to those Bodhisattvas that they are irreversible from the supreme enlightenment.🔽 This shows the absence of the conceptual thought of holding to a path, since it says, They have abandoned the level of the Sravakas and the level of the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: / de dag gis ni sangs rgyas nyid la re bar bya ste zhes bya ba 'dis kyang rang gi lam nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar ston te /
analyzed: / de dag gis ni sangs rgyas nyid la re bar bya ste zhes bya ba 'dis kyang rang gi lam nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar ston te /
translated: And this shows the absence of the conceptual thought of holding to one's own path, since it says, They should hope for Buddhahood.

original: gzhan du na phyin ci log tu 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyis mi srid par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na phyin ci log tu 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyis mi srid par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be a mistake, and it would be impossible for a Buddha.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the third misconception is stated in the passage beginning “Those also are unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: As before, the question is anticipated with “Why is that?” and the answer is given in the passage beginning “Subhūti, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones.”

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyod pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa las dben pas rjes su gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyod pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa las dben pas rjes su gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, “moving in the perfection of wisdom” means dwelling in the absence of the misconception of arising and ceasing.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the fourth misconception is stated in the passage beginning

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti.”

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang dag rmongs pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis rgya cher nyan pa la sogs pa byed cing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang dag rmongs pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis rgya cher nyan pa la sogs pa byed cing /
translated: “They will stand in irreversibility” means that those bodhisattvas who, by not being confused and so on, listen extensively and so forth,

original: de rnams kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa de dag kyang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa de dag kyang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: and those who practice pure conduct and so on in their presence, will stand in irreversibility, free from the concepts of being endowed and not being endowed.

original: rnam par rtog pa lnga pa'i don ni rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lnga pa'i don ni rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the fifth conception is stated in “Subhūti, it is like this. Those who hear the perfection of wisdom…” and so on.

original: smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dmigs su med pas mos pa gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa dmigs su med pas mos pa gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The one who is intent on the non-apprehension of conceptualization based on form, etc., and who abides in the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi rgyur sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur ba de ni shin tu phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi rgyur sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur ba de ni shin tu phyir mi ldog pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: will abide in the state of irreversibility, and will teach the Dharma to beings for the sake of their enlightenment.

original: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la @296b sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la @296b sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sixth conceptualization is stated in the passage beginning with:🔽Subhuti, when you say 'suchness,' etc.

original: rab 'byor gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i tshig bzlas nas lan btab pa ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i tshig bzlas nas lan btab pa ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Having repeated the words beginning with Subhuti, when you say, etc., the reply is given in the passage beginning with Subhuti, except for suchness, etc.

original: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan dmigs su med pas don dam par gang yang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur pa med kyi yang kun rdzob tu ni rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan dmigs su med pas don dam par gang yang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur pa med kyi yang kun rdzob tu ni rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i
translated: Because all phenomena are the nature of the dharmadhātu, apart from suchness no other phenomenon is observed. Therefore, ultimately nothing at all abides in suchness.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But conventionally, the family abides in suchness, free from the conceptualization that destroys the family.🔽This is the intended meaning.

original: don dam pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsal bar bstan pa ni rab 'byor re zhig de bzhin nyid de nyid dmigs su med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsal bar bstan pa ni rab 'byor re zhig de bzhin nyid de nyid dmigs su med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach this clearly from the perspective of the ultimate, he says, “Subhūti, if suchness itself is not apprehended…”

original: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the seventh conception is stated in “Subhūti, suchness…” and so on.

original: de kho na nyid du na de bzhin nyid dam de las gzhan pa'i chos byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'i 'on kyang kun rdzob tu don du gnyer ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas don du gnyer bar bya ba'i dngos po la
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na de bzhin nyid dam de las gzhan pa'i chos byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'i 'on kyang kun rdzob tu don du gnyer ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas don du gnyer bar bya ba'i dngos po la
translated: However, in the conventional, one who is free of the conception of non-purposive striving observes

original: dmigs nas mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: dmigs nas mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: the object of purposive striving and fully awakens.

original: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ni chos mi ston to zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ni chos mi ston to zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eighth conception is that Subhūti said, “Suchness does not teach phenomena.”

original: de kho na nyid du na de bzhin nyid du chos mi ston gyi 'on kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rgyu yod pa nyid kyi chos ston to zhes bya bar dngos so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na de bzhin nyid du chos mi ston gyi 'on kyang kun rdzob tu rgyu med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rgyu yod pa nyid kyi chos ston to zhes bya bar dngos so //
translated: In reality, suchness does not teach phenomena, but in the conventional, one who is free of the conception of non-causal striving teaches phenomena that have a cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni rab 'byor chos gang bstan par bya ba'i chos de yang dmigs su med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni rab 'byor chos gang bstan par bya ba'i chos de yang dmigs su med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the ninth conception is that Subhūti said, “The phenomenon that is to be taught is also not observed.”

original: phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas bstan bzhin pa'i chos dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas bstan bzhin pa'i chos dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since there is no discursive thought that focuses on the Dharma of opponents, the Dharma that is being taught is not an object of focus. This is the meaning of the above statement.

original: 'di skad du nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba nyid ji skad du bshad pa'i ched du bya bar nges par mi 'byung ba dang / phan pa dang mi phan pa 'thob pa dang spangs pa nyid kyis lam dang lam ma yin pa nges par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba nyid ji skad du bshad pa'i ched du bya bar nges par mi 'byung ba dang / phan pa dang mi phan pa 'thob pa dang spangs pa nyid kyis lam dang lam ma yin pa nges par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: This is what is being said: the listeners and so on do not definitely attain the very liberation that is explained, nor do they definitely attain the purpose that is explained. They do not ascertain the path and what is not the path through obtaining and abandoning what is beneficial and what is not beneficial.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyi dngos po mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / nam mkha' la gnas @297a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid skye ba dang 'gag pa dang / bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyi dngos po mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / nam mkha' la gnas @297a * //
translated: They do not possess the entire range of things that are endowed with or devoid of the cause and effect of the nature of the conventional, which are arising and ceasing, uninterrupted and appearing as alternatives, and which abide in space.

original: pa'i bya dang 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa dang / de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pas 'dod pa med pa dang /🔽don dam ba'i bden pa la brten pas rgyu med pa dang / ser sna shin tu goms par byas pa'i chos nyid kyis bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba'i dngos po dmigs pa la de kho na'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas 'dzin par byed pa 'jug pa ni bdag btags pa nyid yin no zhes de ltar 'phags pa rnams
analyzed: pa'i bya dang 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa dang / de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pas 'dod pa med pa dang /🔽don dam ba'i bden pa la brten pas rgyu med pa dang / ser sna shin tu goms par byas pa'i chos nyid kyis bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba'i dngos po dmigs pa la de kho na'i dngos por mngon par zhen pas 'dzin par byed pa 'jug pa ni bdag btags pa nyid yin no zhes de ltar 'phags pa rnams
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the seventh stage is like a bird that has the ability to fly in the sky, but not the ability to land on the ground.  The bodhisattva who is on the eighth stage is like a bird that has the ability to fly in the sky and the ability to land on the ground.🔽  The bodhisattva who is on the ninth stage is like a bird that has the ability to fly in the sky, the ability to land on the ground, and the ability to walk on the ground.🔽  The bodhisattva who is on the tenth stage is like a bird that has the ability to fly in the sky, the ability to land on the ground, the ability to walk on the ground, and the ability to enter a cage.

original: dang 'brel pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu byang chub sems dpa' dag gi mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog
analyzed: dang 'brel pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu byang chub sems dpa' dag gi mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog
translated: The second type of conception related to the apprehended, the nine types of conception of the apprehended, are to be abandoned by the bodhisattva on the path of seeing, in terms of the mental states and mental factors that engage them.

original: pa'i sgo nas brjod pa yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas brjod pa yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is expressed in terms of their cessation by teaching the states that are their antidotes.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:🔽Not arising as intended,🔽determining the path to be not the path,🔽birth with cessation,🔽possessing entities, not possessing,

original: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gag dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang // gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang // don dang gnyer dang rgyu med dang // phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
analyzed: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gag dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang // gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang // don dang gnyer dang rgyu med dang // phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
translated: destroying abodes and lineages,🔽meaning, purpose, no cause,🔽and observing opponents

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
translated: are the other conceptions of the apprehended.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa zhes pa'i mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa zhes pa'i mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities for conceptions that are not conceptions of the apprehended.

original: de la mu dang po ni yul drug tu snang ba'i gzung ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni yul drug tu snang ba'i gzung ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The first alternative is the perception that has the aspect of the apprehended, which appears as the six objects.

original: gnyis pa ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can no /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can no /
translated: The second is the perception that has the aspect of the apprehender, which is momentary.

original: gsum pa ni de nyid kyi skad cig gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni de nyid kyi skad cig gzhan du'o //
translated: The third is the same, but in another moment.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the perfection of wisdom, which is free from those aspects.🔽Is it the lineage itself or the conception of the lineage?

original: rigs nyid yin gyi rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs nyid yin gyi rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni tshig phyi ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is connected with the latter phrase.

original: re zhig rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs kyang yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs kyang yin te /
translated: First, whatever is the conception of the lineage is the lineage,

original: dper na gnyen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i dus kyi rigs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnyen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i dus kyi rigs bzhin no //
translated: just as the lineage at the time of the establishment of the antidote is.🔽Is it the lineage itself or the conception of the lineage?

original: rigs nyid yin gyi rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni tshig snga ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs nyid yin gyi rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni tshig snga ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is connected with the former phrase.

original: re zhig yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang yin te /
translated: The conceptualization that is the correct establishment is also the conceptualization of the objective support.

original: dper @297b na yang dag par rtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper @297b na yang dag par rtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the application to the correct objective support of correct realization.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam ngar rtog pa nyid yin gyi yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa de ni dper na dmigs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam ngar rtog pa nyid yin gyi yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa de ni dper na dmigs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The conceptualization that is the objective support but not the correct establishment is, for example, like the incomplete objective support.

original: phyogs 'dis lhag ma rnams kyang rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis lhag ma rnams kyang rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: By this method, the rest should be inferred.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the path of seeing together with the antidote that is the opposing side,

original: byang chub chen po 'grub par bya ba'i phyir da ni mthong ba'i lam rgyu rnam pa gsum po gang dang bcas par bzhed ba de brjod par bya ba yin pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam yang dag par ston bas byang chub chen po la gzhan 'god pa'i
analyzed: byang chub chen po 'grub par bya ba'i phyir da ni mthong ba'i lam rgyu rnam pa gsum po gang dang bcas par bzhed ba de brjod par bya ba yin pas mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam yang dag par ston bas byang chub chen po la gzhan 'god pa'i
translated: Now, in order to accomplish great enlightenment, it is necessary to explain the three aspects of the path of seeing, so in order to demonstrate the path of seeing and so forth, and in order to establish others in great enlightenment,

original: rgyu dang po bstan pa'i don du gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang po bstan pa'i don du gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: the first cause is taught. The request is made with “Bhagavan, the perfection of wisdom is profound,” and so forth.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: As before, the question “Why is that?” is anticipated and answered with “Bhagavan, suchness,” and so forth.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa yin na yang kun tu zhum pa la sogs pa ma byas par bla na med pa'i byang chub kun rdzob tu rtogs par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes spro ba bskyed pa ston pas
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa yin na yang kun tu zhum pa la sogs pa ma byas par bla na med pa'i byang chub kun rdzob tu rtogs par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni dka' ba byed pa yin no zhes spro ba bskyed pa ston pas
translated: Even though all phenomena are non-arisen, it is difficult to attain the unsurpassed enlightenment conventionally, without becoming discouraged, etc.🔽 By teaching this, he shows the encouragement.

original: byang chub la mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa ston pas gzhan dag rtogs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub la mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa ston pas gzhan dag rtogs par byas pa yin no //
translated: By teaching the path of seeing, etc. in regard to enlightenment, he causes others to understand.

original: don dam pa la brten nas ni dka' ba ci yang med do zhes bya ba ni koo shi ka gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa la brten nas ni dka' ba ci yang med do zhes bya ba ni koo shi ka gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: In regard to the ultimate, there is nothing difficult at all. This is stated by Kausika, whoever says this...

original: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na bsngags par byed pa ni 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis gang dang gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par smras pa nyid kyis na bsngags par byed pa ni 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis gang dang gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no //
translated: Since it is well-spoken, he praises it: Whatever has been explained by the noble Subhuti...

original: ci la yang thogs pa med do zhes bya ba ni gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ci la yang thogs pa med do zhes bya ba ni gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: He is not obstructed in any way means he does not cling to anything.

original: rang gis smras pa'i don bstan par byed ba ni bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gnas brtan rab 'byor las brtsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gis smras pa'i don bstan par byed ba ni bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gnas brtan rab 'byor las brtsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of what he himself said is the statement beginning, “Blessed One, I will begin with the elder Subhūti.”

original: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni ji ltar smos pa'i stong pa nyid kyi chos rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni ji ltar smos pa'i stong pa nyid kyi chos rtogs pa'o //
translated: “The Dharma that accords with the Dharma” is the realization of the Dharma of emptiness as it is described.

original: legs par smras so zhes gsungs pa ni koo shi ka khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di nyid ci'i phyir snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs @298a * //
analyzed: legs par smras so zhes gsungs pa ni koo shi ka khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di nyid ci'i phyir snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs @298a * //
translated: “Well said” is stated in “Kauśika, yours.”🔽Similarly, anticipating the doubt, “Why is that?” he says, “Kauśika, the elder Subhūti . . .”

original: pa bsu nas koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pa bsu nas koo shi ka gnas brtan rab 'byor ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating the doubt, “Why is that?” he says, “Kauśika, the elder Subhūti . . .”

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa khams gsum pa so so'i nyon mongs pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po spong bar byed pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir go rims bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag🔽par rjes su mi mthong zhing mi dmigs na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa khams gsum pa so so'i nyon mongs pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po spong bar byed pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir go rims bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing mi dmigs na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not seen or observed as the nature of emptiness of the path of seeing that abandons the lesser, middling, and greater afflictions of each of the three realms such as the desire realm, and so on, in that order.

original: chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig dgu po rnams yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig dgu po rnams yin no //
translated: The nine phrases beginning with “not seen or observed” and ending with “the reality of phenomena is not observed” are stated.

original: spyir chos thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dmigs su med pa'i phyir grangs ji lta ba bzhin chos thams cad dben par gnas pa dang chos thams cad mi dmigs par gnas par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyir chos thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dmigs su med pa'i phyir grangs ji lta ba bzhin chos thams cad dben par gnas pa dang chos thams cad mi dmigs par gnas par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In general, the causes and effects of all phenomena are not observed. Therefore, all phenomena should be understood to abide in isolation and all phenomena should be understood to abide in nonobservation, in accordance with the enumeration.

original: gal te de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nyan thos rnams dang mtshungs pa kho nar gnas par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nyan thos rnams dang mtshungs pa kho nar gnas par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then bodhisattvas would be just the same as śrāvakas.

original: koo shi ka yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Kausika,  and so on is stated.

original: gnas pa de dag thams cad pas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ma gtogs par gzhan rnam pas so //
analyzed: gnas pa de dag thams cad pas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ma gtogs par gzhan rnam pas so //
translated: All those abodes, and so on, is in terms of the other abodes except for the Tathagata's abode.

original: gnas pa 'dis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa'i phan yon bstan pa nyid kyis byang chub chen po'i phyir mthong pa'i lam la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan par mjug bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa 'dis gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa'i phan yon bstan pa nyid kyis byang chub chen po'i phyir mthong pa'i lam la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan par mjug bsdus pa yin no //
translated: One should abide in this abode is the conclusion of the teaching of the benefits of the Bodhisattva's abode by the path of insight, and so on, for the sake of great enlightenment.

original: shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las snying po'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o /
analyzed: shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las snying po'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-seventh chapter of the Ornament of Clear Realization, the chapter on the essence.

original: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i byang chub kyi mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa yang dag par bstan pas mthong ba'i lam rtogs pa'i phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyi mchod pa byas so zhes smras pa ni de nas de'i tshe lha'i bu zhes bya🔽ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i byang chub kyi mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa yang dag par bstan pas mthong ba'i lam rtogs pa'i phyir rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyi mchod pa byas so zhes smras pa ni de nas de'i tshe lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The monks who have the perfection of cause, having been taught the path of seeing of enlightenment and so forth as explained, have made offerings to the monks who have realized the path of seeing. This is stated in Then at that time, the devaputras... and so forth.

original: lha'i bu rnams man d'a ra ba'i me tog thogs nas 'khor der 'dus pa ni dge slong rnams kyi smon lam gyi stongs kyis me tog rnyed pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams man d'a ra ba'i me tog thogs nas 'khor der 'dus pa ni dge slong rnams kyi smon lam gyi stongs kyis me tog rnyed pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The devaputras, holding mandara flowers, gathered in that assembly. It should be understood that the cause of obtaining the flowers is the power of the monks' aspirations.

original: rtogs pa yid ches pa bas gong nas gong du mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam yang byas par 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni tshig 'di skad ces kyang gsol te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa yid ches pa bas gong nas gong du mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam yang byas par 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni tshig 'di skad ces kyang gsol te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to increase realization and confidence more and more, they also made aspirations. This is stated in They also said these words... and so forth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ne bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ne bshad zin to //
translated: Then the Blessed One... and so forth has been explained.

original: bskal pa stong phrag nyi shur zhes bya ba ni mi rnams @298b kyi tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas brtsams te lo bcu'i bar du 'grib pa 'di ni mtshon dang nad dang mu ge rnams kyis mthar phyin par byas pas 'grib pa'i bar gyi bskal pa dang
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag nyi shur zhes bya ba ni mi rnams @298b kyi tshe lo dpag tu med pa nas brtsams te lo bcu'i bar du 'grib pa 'di ni mtshon dang nad dang mu ge rnams kyis mthar phyin par byas pas 'grib pa'i bar gyi bskal pa dang
translated: Twenty times a great eon is called a great eon.🔽The first is the eon of decrease from immeasurable to ten years in length.

original: po'o // tshe lo bcu pa de las kyang 'phel bar 'gyur zhing tshe lo brgyad khri par gyur cing yang de bzhin du 'grib par gyur pa na che lo bcu par 'gyur ba ste /🔽de ltar 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i dbye bas bar gyi bskal pa bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: po'o // tshe lo bcu pa de las kyang 'phel bar 'gyur zhing tshe lo brgyad khri par gyur cing yang de bzhin du 'grib par gyur pa na che lo bcu par 'gyur ba ste / de ltar 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i dbye bas bar gyi bskal pa bco brgyad yin no //
translated: The second is the eon of increase from ten to eighty thousand years in length.🔽The third is the eon of stability, which is eighty thousand years in length.

original: tshe lo bcu pa de nyid las kyang 'phel bar gyur cing tshe lo brgyad khri par gyur pa 'di ni 'phel ba'i bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu yin no //
analyzed: tshe lo bcu pa de nyid las kyang 'phel bar gyur cing tshe lo brgyad khri par gyur pa 'di ni 'phel ba'i bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu yin no //
translated: The fourth is the eon of decrease from eighty thousand to ten years in length.🔽These four are called intermediate eons.🔽Twenty of these are called a great eon.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi 'phel pa dang 'grib pa'i dus ji srid yin pa bar gyi bskal pa dang po 'grib pa'i dus dang phyi ma 'phel ba'i dus kyang de srid yin pas thams cad dus mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi 'phel pa dang 'grib pa'i dus ji srid yin pa bar gyi bskal pa dang po 'grib pa'i dus dang phyi ma 'phel ba'i dus kyang de srid yin pas thams cad dus mnyam pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the time of increase and decrease of the other continents is the same as the first intermediate kalpa of decrease and the last intermediate kalpa of increase.

original: de ltar na bar gyi bskal pa gcig gis ni snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa'i phyir dang bcu dgus ni stongs par byed pa'i phyir bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig rten 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bar gyi bskal pa gcig gis ni snod kyi 'jig rten 'jig pa'i phyir dang bcu dgus ni stongs par byed pa'i phyir bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig rten 'jig pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the world remains destroyed for twenty intermediate kalpas: one intermediate kalpa for the destruction of the receptacle world and nineteen intermediate kalpas during which the receptacle world has been destroyed.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur zhig nas 'dug go //🔽de bzhin du bar gyi bskal pa gcig gis ni snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang / bcu dgus ni chags par byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur zhig nas 'dug go // de bzhin du bar gyi bskal pa gcig gis ni snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang / bcu dgus ni chags par byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: The world remains destroyed for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur chags nas gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur chags nas gnas pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the world remains created for twenty intermediate kalpas: one intermediate kalpa for the creation of the receptacle world and nineteen intermediate kalpas during which the receptacle world stays created.

original: de ltar bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu'i grangs kyis tshad pa ni bskal pa chen po ste 'di ni bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cu'i grangs kyis tshad pa ni bskal pa chen po ste 'di ni bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The measure of a great eon is the number of eighty intermediate eons, and this is the Fortunate Eon.

original: bskal pa skar ma lta bu ni de lta bu ma yin te smon lam dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis shin tu ring ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa skar ma lta bu ni de lta bu ma yin te smon lam dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang gis shin tu ring ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eon is not like a star, because it is very long due to the power of prayers and roots of virtue.

original: de bas na 'grib pa'i dus na ji skad du bshad pa'i bar gyi bskal pa'i chad kyi dus yongs su chad pa yin pas bskal pa stong phrag nyi shur zhes gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'grib pa'i dus na ji skad du bshad pa'i bar gyi bskal pa'i chad kyi dus yongs su chad pa yin pas bskal pa stong phrag nyi shur zhes gsung pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the time of decrease is twenty thousand eons as explained, it is the time of the interruption of the intermediate eons, so it is said to be twenty thousand eons.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu mtshan gyi don nyid du gzhan dag la tshig dang don yang dag pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa so sor gtong pa ste rgyu gnyis pa bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba ni kun dga' bo byang chub sems
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu mtshan gyi don nyid du gzhan dag la tshig dang don yang dag pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa so sor gtong pa ste rgyu gnyis pa bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba ni kun dga' bo byang chub sems
translated: The second cause is the explanation of the introduction: Ananda, the bodhisattvas who wish to attain the perfection of wisdom in this way should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang su dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang su dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The one who is a bodhisattva, a great being, etc.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar mi rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar mi rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, why is that? anticipating a question, he says, because, in this way, people, etc.

original: smod par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig @299a * //
analyzed: smod par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig @299a * //
translated: The seven words beginning with does not disparage

original: bdun ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa bdun dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽smon pa slu bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi yul la 'jug pa'i smon lam la gal te gzhan du smon pas slu bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: bdun ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa bdun dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o // smon pa slu bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi yul la 'jug pa'i smon lam la gal te gzhan du smon pas slu bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi
translated: are to be explained as being incompatible with the seven realizations beginning with the knowledge of all modes, respectively.

original: don du rnam par smin pa sbyin par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don du rnam par smin pa sbyin par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the vow is not deceived means that if the vow to enter the domain of unsurpassed enlightenment is not deceived by the vow to be otherwise, then that wholesome root is not dedicated to the disciples and the solitary Buddhas for the sake of their ripening.🔽This is what it means.

original: gleng bslang ba byas nas da ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'brel ba'i yongs su gtad pa chung du'i don ni kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gleng bslang ba byas nas da ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'brel ba'i yongs su gtad pa chung du'i don ni kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Having introduced the subject, now, the meaning of the brief entrustment connected with the Tathagata is stated with “Therefore, Ananda, etc.”

original: gtad do zhes bya ba ni rab tu gtod pa'o //
analyzed: gtad do zhes bya ba ni rab tu gtod pa'o //
translated: “Entrust” means to entrust completely.

original: rjes su gtad ngo zhes bya ba ni slar yang gtod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su gtad ngo zhes bya ba ni slar yang gtod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Entrust again” means to entrust once more.

original: kha cig ni 'dzin pa'i don du gtad pa nyid yin pas 'phags pa kun dga' bo ni rgyal pa'i yum gyi sdud pa po yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dzin pa'i don du gtad pa nyid yin pas 'phags pa kun dga' bo ni rgyal pa'i yum gyi sdud pa po yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that since it is entrusted for the sake of retention, the noble Ananda is the compiler of the Mother of the Victorious Ones.

original: gzhan dag ni 'chang ba la sogs pa'i don nyid du gtad pa yin pas sdud pa po ni rdo rje 'dzin ched po nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'chang ba la sogs pa'i don nyid du gtad pa yin pas sdud pa po ni rdo rje 'dzin ched po nyid yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that since it is entrusted for the sake of upholding and so forth, the compiler is the Great Vajra Holder himself.

original: de la rnam par chud gsan pa ni gzhan du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par chud gsan pa ni gzhan du byed pa'o //
translated: Among those, “forgetting” means to act otherwise.

original: gtang ba ni rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gtang ba ni rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'o //
translated: “Abandoning” means to completely reject.

original: brjed pa ni yid la ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: brjed pa ni yid la ma byas pa'o //
translated: “Forgetting” means not bringing to mind.

original: tshig gi yan lag ni tshig gi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: tshig gi yan lag ni tshig gi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The limbs of speech are one part of speech.

original: sku gsum thob par byed pa yin pas na go rims bzhin du yum ste bskyed pa 'byin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sku gsum thob par byed pa yin pas na go rims bzhin du yum ste bskyed pa 'byin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since it causes the attainment of the three bodies, it is the mother, respectively, in the sense of generating, giving birth, and nourishing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par bskyed pa yin pas thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par bskyed pa yin pas thob par byed pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the cause of attaining omniscience, since it generates it.

original: yongs su gtad pa 'bring gi don ni kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa 'bring gi don ni kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the medium entrustment is stated in the passage beginning with “Ānanda, this perfection of wisdom should be taken up. ”

original: yongs su gtad pa chen po'i don ni kun dga' bod ltar bzhugs shing 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa chen po'i don ni kun dga' bod ltar bzhugs shing 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the great entrustment is stated in the passage beginning with “Ānanda, as long as the Tathāgata remains and lives. ”

original: de dang des zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dang des zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “By that and by that” is connected to “by that benefit. ”

original: phan par sems pa de dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la phan par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: phan par sems pa de dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la phan par 'dod pas so //
translated: “By that thought of benefit” is by the wish to benefit the Tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel ba'i yang yongs su gtad pa chung du'i don ni kun dga' bo gang dag 'das pa'i dus su byung bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'brel ba'i yang yongs su gtad pa chung du'i don ni kun dga' bo gang dag 'das pa'i dus su byung bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the lesser entrustment in relation to the bodhisattvas is stated in the passage beginning “Ānanda, those who have appeared in the past…”

original: yongs su gtad pa 'bring gi don ni kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin @299b no ;
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa 'bring gi don ni kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin @299b no ;
translated: The meaning of the medium entrustment is stated in the passage beginning “Ānanda, those bodhisattvas…”

original: / chen po'i don ni kun dga' bo 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / chen po'i don ni kun dga' bo 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the great entrustment is stated in the passage beginning “Ānanda, it is like this: this perfection of wisdom…”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang nyid sgom pa la sogs pa las ches mang ba'i bsod nams kyi mtshan nyid can byang chub thob pa'i bar mchod pa'i rgyu gsum pa ston pas kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa🔽pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang nyid sgom pa la sogs pa las ches mang ba'i bsod nams kyi mtshan nyid can byang chub thob pa'i bar mchod pa'i rgyu gsum pa ston pas kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa🔽pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The third cause of worship, which has the characteristic of merit that is greater than the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom itself, up to the attainment of enlightenment, is taught by the statement beginning “Ānanda, if you had as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā river…”🔽The fourth cause of worship, which has the characteristic of merit that is greater than the worship of the perfection of wisdom itself, up to the attainment of enlightenment, is taught by the statement beginning “Ānanda, if you had as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā river…”

original: skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam yang zhes bya ba skad cig la sogs pa smos pa ni go rims bzhin du gang zag dbang po rnon po dang 'bring dang rtul po shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam yang zhes bya ba skad cig la sogs pa smos pa ni go rims bzhin du gang zag dbang po rnon po dang 'bring dang rtul po shes par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: A moment, a flash, an instant is a moment, etc. The mention of moments, etc. is for the purpose of showing that the person is of sharp, middling, or dull faculties, respectively.

original: de la dus kyi mtha' ni skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de la dus kyi mtha' ni skad cig ma'o //
translated: Among these, the limit of time is a moment.

original: yang skad cig ma brgya nyi shu la de'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: yang skad cig ma brgya nyi shu la de'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: Twenty-four moments are one of its moments.

original: de skad cig ma drug cu la ni thang cig go //
analyzed: de skad cig ma drug cu la ni thang cig go //
translated: Sixty of those moments are one instant.

original: thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam mo //
analyzed: thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam mo //
translated: Thirty instants are one second.

original: yi ge'i bdag nyid kun mthar yang //
analyzed: yi ge'i bdag nyid kun mthar yang //
translated: At the end of all the syllables,

original: mig btsums tshad du gnas pa can //
analyzed: mig btsums tshad du gnas pa can //
translated: it is present in the measure of a wink.🔽How is it possible to teach the Dharma in one moment?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyi skad cig ma gcig gis chos ston par ji ltar rung zhe na brjod pa ston pa po'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang gis nyan pa po rnams la skad cig ma gcig gis bstan pa'i chos snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa bskyed pas
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyi skad cig ma gcig gis chos ston par ji ltar rung zhe na brjod pa ston pa po'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang gis nyan pa po rnams la skad cig ma gcig gis bstan pa'i chos snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa bskyed pas
translated: It is possible because the listeners generate the consciousness endowed with the light of the Dharma to be taught in one moment through the power of the bodhisattva teacher.

original: des de la chos bstan pa na yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: des de la chos bstan pa na yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: When he teaches the Dharma to that person, he says, “Yes, I am a Buddha.”

original: de ltar ji skad bshad pa gsum ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad pa gsum ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that these three, as they have been explained, are the causes for attaining perfect full enlightenment.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: byang chub la gzhan ston pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtod dang // de thob par chad med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhan ston pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtod dang // de thob par chad med pa'i rgyu //
translated: The teaching of enlightenment to others, the dedication of its causes, and the uninterrupted cause for its attainment

original: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽rgyu dang bcas pa mthong ba'i lam ji skad du bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa mi snang ba la mthu yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa mthong ba dang mi snang bar gyur pa'i dpe ston pas de nas bcom
analyzed: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do // zhes gsungs pa yin no // rgyu dang bcas pa mthong ba'i lam ji skad du bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa mi snang ba la mthu yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa mthong ba dang mi snang bar gyur pa'i dpe ston pas de nas bcom
translated: are the characteristics of great merit.

original: ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The example of Akṣobhya, the Tathāgata, is taught in order to show that the path of seeing, together with its cause, as it has been explained, has the power to make the non-appearance of conceptualization manifest. Therefore, the Bhagavān says, “Then the Bhagavān, at that time,” and so on.

original: de la bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: It is unshakable because it has completely transcended all the domains of Mara.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
translated: It is like an ocean because it is the source of all good qualities.

original: zab mo'i chos khong du chud pa'i phyir zab mo'o //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos khong du chud pa'i phyir zab mo'o //
translated: It is profound because it has penetrated the profound Dharma.

original: dpes bstan pa'i don bshad pa ni kun dga' bo de ltar chos @300a * //
analyzed: dpes bstan pa'i don bshad pa ni kun dga' bo de ltar chos @300a * //
translated: The meaning of the simile is explained in the passage beginning with the words, “Ananda, in this way, all dharmas . . .”

original: thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin ta mag lam du yang snang bar yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po mthong ba'i lam na mi snang bar bstan🔽pa'i don du smos pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin ta mag lam du yang snang bar yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bzhi ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po mthong ba'i lam na mi snang bar bstan pa'i don du smos pa yin no //
translated: The four phrases beginning with the words, “They do not appear in the path of seeing” are stated in order to show that the four conceptual thoughts of subject and object do not appear in the path of seeing.

original: don 'di nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas kun dga' bo nam mkha' byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas kun dga' bo nam mkha' byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to ascertain this very meaning, the passage beginning with the words, “Why is that?” is stated, concluding with the words, “Ananda, it is because space is inactive.”

original: de skad du kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ni shes pa po ma yin te gang gi phyir nam mkha' byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ni shes pa po ma yin te gang gi phyir nam mkha' byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, all imagined phenomena are not the knower, because space is without activity.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang ni mthong ba po ma yin te gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang ni mthong ba po ma yin te gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the dependent is not the seer, because it is inconceivable, like a magical creation.

original: yongs su grub pa yang dgos pa byed nus pa ma yin te gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i phyir tshor ba po ma yin pas so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa yang dgos pa byed nus pa ma yin te gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i phyir tshor ba po ma yin pas so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The perfected is not the experiencer, because all phenomena are unreal, and thus incapable of performing a function.
