original: nye bar bsdu ba ni kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary is stated in the passage beginning with “Ānanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in this way…”

original: gang gi don du ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam rgyu dang bcas par 'dod pa'i byang chub chen po de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi don du ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam rgyu dang bcas par 'dod pa'i byang chub chen po de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that great enlightenment for the sake of which the path of seeing and its causes are asserted as they have been explained?

original: byang chub chen po de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub chen po de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that great enlightenment?

original: byang chub chen po bshad pa'i don du gleng slob ba gsungs pa ni bslab pa thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i byang chub chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po bshad pa'i don du gleng slob ba gsungs pa ni bslab pa thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i byang chub chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement of the discussion for the purpose of explaining great enlightenment is: “the great enlightenment, the highest perfection of all trainings.”

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas kun dga' bo bslab pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas kun dga' bo bslab pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the statement of the objection, “Why is that?” is: “Ananda, this training is the great enlightenment.”

original: mthe bong gcig gis bteg ste slar gzhag kyang zhes bya ba ni gyen du btag nas slar yang dbab par byas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthe bong gcig gis bteg ste slar gzhag kyang zhes bya ba ni gyen du btag nas slar yang dbab par byas kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Even if it is raised by one finger and then put down again” means that even if it is raised up and then brought down again.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la snang ba la ltos nas brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la snang ba la ltos nas brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: “Those Lord Buddhas think like this” and so on is stated in terms of the appearance to the beings to be trained.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni rnam par rtog pa'i kun tu rgyu ba yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni rnam par rtog pa'i kun tu rgyu ba yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: But the Lords do not have the movement of conceptual thought.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzhal du med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzhal du med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, in order to respond to the qualm, “Why is that?” it is said, “The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable, etc.”

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because it is non-conceptual.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bslab pa gzhan dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @300b pa la slob par byed snyam pa la kun dga' bo 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bslab pa gzhan dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @300b pa la slob par byed snyam pa la kun dga' bo 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no
translated: Since there are other trainings such as in generosity, why is it that one should train in the perfection of wisdom? In response to this, it is said, “Ānanda, the past, etc.”

original: // spyir gleng slong bar mdzad nas da ni byang chub chen po'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad ma med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: // spyir gleng slong bar mdzad nas da ni byang chub chen po'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad ma med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Having generally raised the topic, now, in order to teach the essence of great enlightenment, it is said, “Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable, etc.”

original: mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: mi zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: The phrase inexhaustible means that the nature of the perfection of wisdom is the great enlightenment, which is inexhaustible wisdom because it is inexhaustible.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa'i don du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te zad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa'i don du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te zad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to express just this, he says, Why is that? anticipating the qualm, Because the perfection of wisdom does not exist. The meaning is: because it is inexhaustible.

original: 'di nyid rgya cher ston pa ni kun dga' bo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te de la mngon sum gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rgya cher ston pa ni kun dga' bo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te de la mngon sum gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: The phrase just this is taught extensively in the passage beginning with Ananda, whatever... There, valid cognition is the ascertainment of the nature of something that is directly perceived.

original: rjes su dpag bas dben pa nyid du rtogs pa ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag bas dben pa nyid du rtogs pa ni zad pa'o //
translated: Exhaustion is the realization of the absence of something through inference.

original: de gnyi gas sam lung gis 'di tsam zhig go zhes nges par gzung ba ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: de gnyi gas sam lung gis 'di tsam zhig go zhes nges par gzung ba ni tha ma'o //
translated: The end is the ascertainment of the mere existence of something through both of those or through scripture.

original: dgongs pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' rdzas su med pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma la sogs pa gzung bar mi nus pa de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' rdzas su med pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma la sogs pa gzung bar mi nus pa de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning is that just as space is not an entity that can be apprehended by valid cognition, etc., because it is merely the absence of an obstruction to contact, so too is the object.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to make this clear, he says, “Why is that?”

original: gzhung gi tshad bshad pas tshad ma la sogs pa brjod pa yin no zhen /
analyzed: gzhung gi tshad bshad pas tshad ma la sogs pa brjod pa yin no zhen /
translated: If you say that valid cognition, etc., are mentioned by the statement of the measure of the text,

original: kun dga' bo ngas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ngas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Ānanda, I have taught, etc.”

original: de kho na'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de kho na'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of reality, is the mother of the bodhisattvas.

original: de lta na 'o na tshad la sogs pa gang gi yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na tshad la sogs pa gang gi yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then whose are valid cognition, etc.?

original: ming gi tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de la chos rnams kyi ngo bo'i tshig bla dags ni ming gi tshogs so //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de la chos rnams kyi ngo bo'i tshig bla dags ni ming gi tshogs so //
translated: He says, “The collection of names, etc.” Therein, the words that are the nature of phenomena are the collection of names.

original: de rnams nyid kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags ni tshig gi tshogs so //
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags ni tshig gi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of words is the name of those very [syllables].

original: de gnyi ga'i rten yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i rten yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: The collection of letters is the basis of both of those.

original: tshad dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ming la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la de yang gtso bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ming la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la de yang gtso bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom connected with measure is the nature of names, etc. And that is not the principal perfection of wisdom. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid gsal bar ston pa'i don du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //🔽'di skad du don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin yin la de ston par byed pas nye bar gdags pa'i @301a * //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar ston pa'i don du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // 'di skad du don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin yin la de ston par byed pas nye bar gdags pa'i @301a * //
translated: In order to clarify that very [point], it is said Why is that? and so on.

original: tshul gyis gzhung gi bdag nyid can la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i yang dag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul gyis gzhung gi bdag nyid can la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i yang dag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Ultimately, the Tathāgata's wisdom itself is the perfection of wisdom. Since it teaches that, it is designated by the method of the treatise that has the nature of the text as the perfection of wisdom. But that is not the real [perfection of wisdom].

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, with reference to reality, it is said, “Ananda, the perfection of wisdom is not endowed with a measure.”

original: de kho na nyid kyi tshul du tshad ma ma gsungs pa'i rgyu zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi tshul du tshad ma ma gsungs pa'i rgyu zhus pa ni bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The question, “Why is it not taught as a valid cognition with reference to reality?” is asked with, “Bhagavat, why is that?”

original: lan btab pa'i phyir kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan btab pa'i phyir kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The answer is, “Ananda, because the perfection of wisdom is inexhaustible,” and so forth.

original: dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas skyes pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas skyes pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Because of being isolated” means because of being the nature of the wisdom of arising through non-arising.

original: dben pa'i chos la zhes bya ba ni dngos po skye ba med pa la stong pa nyid dmigs su med de chos can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dben pa'i chos la zhes bya ba ni dngos po skye ba med pa la stong pa nyid dmigs su med de chos can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The phrase in the Dharma of voidness means that in the non-production of things, voidness is not perceived, because the substratum does not exist.

original: gzhal du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang skye ba med pas ma skyes pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang skye ba med pas ma skyes pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because it is immeasurable means that it is the essence of non-arisen intuition, because it is neither exhausted nor produced.

original: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni kun dga' bo 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement the Tathagatas of the three times are distinguished by the intuition of exhaustion and non-production is found in the passage beginning Ananda, in the past....

original: de la skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis na zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis na zad pa'o //
translated: There, exhaustion is due to momentariness and impermanence.

original: rgyun gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyis na yongs su zad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi mi rtag pa nyid kyis na yongs su zad pa'o //
translated: Complete exhaustion is due to the impermanence of the continuum.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The summary is found in the passage beginning, Therefore, Ananda...

original: 'di skad du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dri ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du brtags pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dri ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa nyid du brtags pa rnams ni /
translated: imagined.

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from the dharmadhātu,

original: gang phyir chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: gang phyir chos yod ma yin te //
translated: there are no phenomena.🔽Since the essence of the dharmadhātu is like space, it is neither ceasing nor arising.

original: zhes bya bas chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid nam mkha' bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ram gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par spyod pa'i tshad ma la sogs pas 'thad pa'i dngos po med pas nam
analyzed: zhes bya bas chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid nam mkha' bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ram gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par spyod pa'i tshad ma la sogs pas 'thad pa'i dngos po med pas nam
translated: Since it is neither a single nor a multiple entity, and since it is not a thing that is established by valid cognition that analyzes causes and effects, it is like a sky flower.

original: mkha'i pad ma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du dri ma rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba med pas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i mtshan
analyzed: mkha'i pad ma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du dri ma rnams zad pa dang mi skye ba med pas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i mtshan
translated: Since it is neither ceasing nor arising, the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising, which are the essence of all phenomena that are realized without error, do not exist.

original: nyid chos kyi sku shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji lta ba'i bdag nyid ni byang chub chen po yin par brjod @301b par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid chos kyi sku shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji lta ba'i bdag nyid ni byang chub chen po yin par brjod @301b par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reality of the perfection of wisdom, the dharmakāya, is to be described as the great enlightenment.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
analyzed: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
translated: The knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements and of non-production

original: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //🔽zad med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
analyzed: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de // zad med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
translated: is called enlightenment.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are to be known respectively as the exhaustion of the defilements and the non-production of the defilements.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid bstan pa na dngos po la shin tu shas cher mngon par zhen bsal la zhig dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas zad pa la zad do snyam pa'i shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas mi skye ba la mi skye bar shes pa yin par brjod pa des na byang chub chen po rang gi ngo bo la log par bsgrub pa'i gnas nyid yin par dngos su bstan pa'i don du de nas tshe
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid bstan pa na dngos po la shin tu shas cher mngon par zhen bsal la zhig dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas zad pa la zad do snyam pa'i shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas mi skye ba la mi skye bar shes pa yin par brjod pa des na byang chub chen po rang gi ngo bo la log par bsgrub pa'i gnas nyid yin par dngos su bstan pa'i don du de nas tshe
translated: Thus, when reality is taught, some people, due to their strong attachment to things, think that the knowledge of exhaustion is the exhaustion of things due to the thought of the destruction of things, and the knowledge of non-production is the non-production of future things due to the thought of non-production. Therefore, in order to directly teach that the great enlightenment is the basis for the negation of its own nature, the text says:

original: dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: de bzhin du rjes su gsung bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su gsung bar mdzad pa ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar zad pa med pa'i phyir dang chos rnams kyi skye ba med pas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid can byang chub chen po ni🔽zad pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pas bsgom pa na 'di lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhes gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pas bsgom pa na 'di lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhes gsol pa ni bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.🔽The Lord said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de gang gi phyir sbyor ba'i dus nyid nas brtsams te chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral bas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur sgom par byed do zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor byang chub
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de gang gi phyir sbyor ba'i dus nyid nas brtsams te chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral bas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur sgom par byed do zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor byang chub
translated: This fault does not exist, because it is said that from the very beginning of the practice, all dharmas are like illusions, free from arising and destruction, and one cultivates all dharmas as illusion-like.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs zad pa med pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs zad pa med pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, the non-exhaustion of form, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang gsal bar byed pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang gsal bar byed pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is also clarified in another way, saying Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, ignorance, etc.

original: de la skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs ni 'dir ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs ni 'dir ma rig pa'o //
translated: There, the state of affliction in a previous birth is ignorance here.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni 'du byed do //
translated: Similarly, the state of merit, etc. is formation.

original: de bzhin du skye ba 'dir nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'i phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba 'dir nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'i phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the five aggregates of the moment of conception in this birth are consciousness.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba phan chad kyi skye mched drug mdong pa'i bar du ming dang gzugs so //🔽de @302a * //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba phan chad kyi skye mched drug mdong pa'i bar du ming dang gzugs so // de @302a * //
translated: The six sense spheres from the moment of conception until the moment when the eye sense faculty encounters visible form is name-and-form.

original: nas ji srid dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus par ma gyur pa de srid ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: nas ji srid dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus par ma gyur pa de srid ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense spheres from the moment when the eye sense faculty encounters visible form until the moment when the three, i.e., the sense faculty, the object and consciousness, come together is the six sense spheres.

original: ji srid du tshor bar gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod pa'i don du mi 'gyur ba de srid kyi bar du ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du tshor bar gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod pa'i don du mi 'gyur ba de srid kyi bar du ni reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is from the moment when the three, i.e., the sense faculty, the object and consciousness, come together until the moment when the cause of the three sensations is determined.

original: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi sngon du bde ba nyams su myong ba'i gnas skabs ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi sngon du bde ba nyams su myong ba'i gnas skabs ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Sensation is the experience of pleasure prior to the passion of sexual union.

original: yul tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi sngon du 'dod pa'i yon tan dang 'khreg  pa'i 'dod chags la kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs su ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: yul tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi sngon du 'dod pa'i yon tan dang 'khreg  pa'i 'dod chags la kun tu spyod pa'i gnas skabs su ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the experience of the passion of sexual union prior to the experience of the object of sensation.

original: yul tshor ba'i gnas skabs ni len pa'o //
analyzed: yul tshor ba'i gnas skabs ni len pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the state of the object of sensation.

original: yul thob pa'i rgyur yongs su rgyug pas yang srid pa'i las nye bar bsags pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: yul thob pa'i rgyur yongs su rgyug pas yang srid pa'i las nye bar bsags pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: Becoming is the accumulation of the karma of renewed existence by the pursuit of the cause of the attainment of the object.

original: las des ma 'ongs pa na yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: las des ma 'ongs pa na yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is the future linking of that action.

original: de phan chad nas ji srid tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi bar gyi gnas skabs de ni rga shi'o //
analyzed: de phan chad nas ji srid tshor ba'i gnas skabs kyi bar gyi gnas skabs de ni rga shi'o //
translated: Aging and death is the period from then until the experience of feeling.

original: de ltar na sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar gnyis gnyis dang bar du brgyad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa yan lag bcu gnyis dum bu gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar gnyis gnyis dang bar du brgyad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa yan lag bcu gnyis dum bu gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, the twelve members of dependent origination are divided into three parts, two at the beginning and end, and eight in the middle.

original: mi zad par zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mi zad par zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “without exhaustion” means without cessation, as before.

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “free from the two extremes” means free from eternalism and nihilism.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtha' dang dbus med par lta ste zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni sgyu ma lta bu yin pa nyid kyis na skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa dang bral ba yin no zhes blta'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtha' dang dbus med par lta ste zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni sgyu ma lta bu yin pa nyid kyis na skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa dang bral ba yin no zhes blta'o //
translated: The phrase “view dependent origination as free from middle and extremes” means that dependent origination is like an illusion, free from arising, cessation, and enduring.

original: 'di lta bu nyid ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de ltar rnam par blta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu nyid ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de ltar rnam par blta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the passage beginning with Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who views in this way.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa ni mi zad pa la mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa ni mi zad pa la mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mental activity is the accomplishment of the imperishable.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: The skill in means is the practice of dependent origination.

original: de nyid ston pa ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That itself is taught in the passage beginning with How does the Bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na kun rdzob tu chad par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: de ltar na kun rdzob tu chad par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: If it is like this, there would be nihilism in the conventional.🔽 To this, the Lord says, Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who views dependent origination in this way...🔽

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par blta bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam par blta bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: rgyu med par zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rgyu yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu rgyu yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase without a cause is because a cause does exist conventionally.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la skye ba'i rgyu med pas @302b na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la skye ba'i rgyu med pas @302b na rtag pa'o //
translated: The phrase permanent, etc., means that because there is no cause for its arising, it is permanent.

original: skyes pa la 'jig pa med pas na brtan pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la 'jig pa med pas na brtan pa'o //
translated: Because there is no destruction of what has arisen, it is stable.

original: mngon par gsal ba dang yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'jug pas na ther zug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba dang yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'jug pas na ther zug pa'o //
translated: Because it does not enter into the nature of manifestation and transformation, it is eternal.

original: gnas skabs gzhan thob pa dang bral bas na rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan thob pa dang bral bas na rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i chos can no //
translated: Because it is free from the attainment of another state, it is a non-transforming dharma.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs bzhin du ji ltar mi zad pa'i rnam pas mngon du bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar dmigs bzhin du ji ltar mi zad pa'i rnam pas mngon du bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be realized in the aspect of non-exhaustion while form, etc., is being perceived?

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pas bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs pas mthong ba'i lam gyi bya ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pas bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa thams cad spangs pas mthong ba'i lam gyi bya ba ston pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, when, etc. shows the function of the path of seeing by means of the non-perception of all dharmas such as form, etc., through the abandonment of all grasping at self and dharmas.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar chos thams cad ma mthong ba yin pa'i phyir gang dag dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas zad pa la zad do snyam pa'i shes pa dang dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas mi skye ba la mi skye'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni zad
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar chos thams cad ma mthong ba yin pa'i phyir gang dag dngos po 'jig pa'i bsam pas zad pa la zad do snyam pa'i shes pa dang dngos po mi skye ba'i bsam pas mi skye ba la mi skye'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni zad
translated: Because all phenomena are not seen in that way, those who think that things are destroyed and have the knowledge “they are destroyed” and those who think that things do not arise and have the knowledge “they do not arise”🔽are said to have the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa yin par brjod pa de dag gi ltar na zad pa dang mi skye ba dang bral bas shes pa 'di mi rung ngo //
analyzed: pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa yin par brjod pa de dag gi ltar na zad pa dang mi skye ba dang bral bas shes pa 'di mi rung ngo //
translated: But according to them, this knowledge of elimination and nonarising is not tenable because it is devoid of elimination and nonarising.

original: 'di ltar skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag gi go rims bzhin du zad pa dang skye ba'i gags byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gog pas 'gog pa med pa don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo rang bzhin du gyur pa la dngos po la log par
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag gi go rims bzhin du zad pa dang skye ba'i gags byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gog pas 'gog pa med pa don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo rang bzhin du gyur pa la dngos po la log par
translated: Because cessation is characterized by obstructing the arising and nonarising of things, respectively, cessation does not exist ultimately. The nature of suchness is natural.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rgol pa khyed kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo skyes pa zad pa ci zhig dang ma skyes pa'i mi skye ba'i chos ci zhig 'thob ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rgol pa khyed kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo skyes pa zad pa ci zhig dang ma skyes pa'i mi skye ba'i chos ci zhig 'thob ste /
translated: What is it that is obtained, what is it that is not obtained, by the power of the path of seeing, by you who are an opponent who is attached to the idea that the nature of conceptual thought, etc. is produced and exhausted, and that the nature of non-production is obtained?

original: 'on kyang cung zad kyang ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang cung zad kyang ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But it is not anything at all.

original: de'i phyir zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa ni ji skad du bshad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of exhaustion and non-production should be understood just as it is explained.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
translated: In the nature that is not terminated,

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: by the path called “seeing,”

original: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
translated: what kind of conceptual thought is exhausted?

original: skye med rnam pa ci zhig thob //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye med rnam pa ci zhig thob // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: What kind of non-production is obtained?

original: de lta ma yin te chos yang dag par yod par khas len na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad du spangs par 'thad pa shin tu dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te chos yang dag par yod par khas len na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad du spangs par 'thad pa shin tu dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, if one accepted that phenomena really exist, it would be extremely difficult to make sense of the Blessed One’s abandonment of all conceptual thoughts that are afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience.

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa stong pa yin pa'i phyir bdag med do snyam du bsgom zhing bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yongs su dor te des dben pa'i ngo bo phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa stong pa yin pa'i phyir bdag med do snyam du bsgom zhing bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yongs su dor te des dben pa'i ngo bo phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos
translated: Thus, since birth and destruction are empty, meditate on the thought “I do not exist,” and completely abandon clinging to a self.

original: can @303a * //🔽la yang dag par dmigs nas /
analyzed: can @303a * // la yang dag par dmigs nas /
translated: Then, correctly observe the aggregates and so on, which are the nature of emptiness and are dependently arisen, and which possess the attributes of birth and destruction.

original: dngos po dang de'i blo dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir 'di dag ni sems tsam kho na yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes bya bar yid la byed cing 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems la mngon par zhen pa yongs su ma
analyzed: dngos po dang de'i blo dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir 'di dag ni sems tsam kho na yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes bya bar yid la byed cing 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems la mngon par zhen pa yongs su ma
translated: Then, because things and the mind that apprehends them are ascertained to be simultaneously observed, think, “These are only mind; external objects do not exist,” and completely abandon clinging to the mind that has the aspect of apprehending.

original: spangs pas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa spangs te /
analyzed: spangs pas phyi rol gyi don du mngon par zhen pa spangs te /
translated: Then, abandon clinging to external objects.

original: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med do snyam du nges par sems pa na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa tsam de yang rnam par bsal te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam🔽du nges par byas nas ;
analyzed: gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med do snyam du nges par sems pa na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig pa tsam de yang rnam par bsal te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig yang dag par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no snyam du nges par byas nas ;
translated: When one definitely thinks, “If there is no object, there is no subject,” one should eliminate the aspect of the subject, and think, “There is only the nondual pristine wisdom, which is the nature of reality.”

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: Then, because that is dependently arisen, it is like an illusion and has no essence.

original: yang dag par na gcig tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba yin no snyam du sgom par byed pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na 'ga' zhig gi nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du
analyzed: yang dag par na gcig tu dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba yin no snyam du sgom par byed pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na 'ga' zhig gi nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du
translated: One should meditate, thinking, “In reality, it is free from the nature of being imputed as a thing, a nonthing, and so on.” When the power of meditation is complete, like the consciousness of some people with respect to jewels, silver, and so on,

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam par mi rtog pa so sor rang gis rig par bya ba ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes pas na rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam par mi rtog pa so sor rang gis rig par bya ba ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes pas na rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong
translated: The yogi perfectly abandons the obscurations to omniscience because the nonconceptual mind that is the illusionlike nature free from all signs of error arises in any way whatsoever and is individually cognized.

original: ngo // de lta ma yin na dus thams cad du nam mkha' rdzas med pa tsam gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa bzhin du bskyed du med pa dang spang du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i chos shes pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid dang shes
analyzed: ngo // de lta ma yin na dus thams cad du nam mkha' rdzas med pa tsam gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa bzhin du bskyed du med pa dang spang du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i chos shes pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid dang shes
translated: If that were not so, then like the mere nonexistence of space, it would be impossible to generate and impossible to abandon, and the nature of the mind that is the mere knowledge of momentary phenomena and the characteristics of objects of knowledge would be the same in the ultimate.

original: bya'i mtshan nyid rnams gal te don dam par yod pa nyid gcig tu gyur na de'i tshe gnyen po bsgoms pas nam mkha' bzhin du de dag la cung zad kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: bya'i mtshan nyid rnams gal te don dam par yod pa nyid gcig tu gyur na de'i tshe gnyen po bsgoms pas nam mkha' bzhin du de dag la cung zad kyang mi byed de /
translated: In that case, the cultivation of the antidote would not do anything to them, like space.

original: de'i phyir dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i phyin ci log mi ldog pas na gzhan dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa gang yin pa dang / chos rnams kyang yod par khas len pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don khas len pa yin pas kho bos ngo mtshar gyi gnas su gyur par brtsis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i phyin ci log mi ldog pas na gzhan dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa gang yin pa dang / chos rnams kyang yod par khas len pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don khas len pa yin pas kho bos ngo mtshar gyi gnas su gyur par brtsis so //
translated: Therefore, since the error of clinging to things is not reversed, others assert that the Bhagavān has completely abandoned the obscurations to omniscience, and that he accepts that phenomena exist. Since these are mutually contradictory assertions, we consider them to be amazing.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la //🔽shes bya la yang ston pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la // shes bya la yang ston pa yi //
translated: Others say that phenomena exist🔽And that the Teacher has exhausted

original: sgrib pa zad par brjod pa gang //🔽de la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //
analyzed: sgrib pa zad par brjod pa gang // de la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //
translated: The obscurations to omniscience.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: We consider that to be amazing.

original: gang @303b gi phyir de ltar dngos po la mngon par zhen pa las grol bar mi 'thad pa de phyir skur ba 'debs pa dang sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo chos 'ga' yang bsal ba dang gzhag pa ma byas par gzugs la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung
analyzed: gang @303b gi phyir de ltar dngos po la mngon par zhen pa las grol bar mi 'thad pa de phyir skur ba 'debs pa dang sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo chos 'ga' yang bsal ba dang gzhag pa ma byas par gzugs la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung
translated: Since it is untenable to be liberated from clinging to things, therefore, without refuting or positing any phenomenon that is the nature of denial or superimposition, forms and so on are dependently arisen.🔽

original: ba kun rdzob tu yang dag pa'i ngo bor gyur pa 'di nyid la rang bzhin med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: ba kun rdzob tu yang dag pa'i ngo bor gyur pa 'di nyid la rang bzhin med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor brtag par bya ste /
translated: Because it is not tenable to be liberated from attachment to things, therefore, without eliminating or positing any phenomenon that is the essence of denial or superimposition, you should analyze this very dependent origination of form and so on, which is the nature of reality in the conventional sense, as being essenceless and so on.

original: de ltar sgyu ma'i rgyal pos sgyu ma'i rgyal po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa dang 'dra bar phyin ci log ldog pas de kho na nyid mthong na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgyu ma'i rgyal pos sgyu ma'i rgyal po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa dang 'dra bar phyin ci log ldog pas de kho na nyid mthong na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In this way, just as an illusory king defeats another illusory king, you should understand that by reversing misconceptions, you will see the way things really are and you will be liberated.

original: de skad du yang /🔽'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: de skad du yang / 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: As it is said:🔽There is nothing at all to be removed

original: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //🔽yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med // yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: And not the slightest thing to be added.🔽The real is to be seen as real

original: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong nas rnam par grol //
translated: And when it is seen, one is liberated.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos ma lus pa las 'das pa'i phyir bdud rnams yid mi bde bar gyur pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos ma lus pa las 'das pa'i phyir bdud rnams yid mi bde bar gyur pa bstan pa ni rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching that the demons become unhappy through meditating on the unerring reality as it has been explained, because all the phenomena that are adverse factors are transcended, is stated from “Subhūti, when” and so on.

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As before, anticipating the doubt “Why is that?” he says “The bodhisattva mahāsattva” and so on.

original: nye bar bsdu ba ni rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba ni rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The summary is stated from “Subhūti, therefore” and so on.

original: / gtsor mthong ba'i lam byang chub chen po'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya bar brjod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas dkyus ma mthong ba'i lam nyid rgya🔽cher ston pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: / gtsor mthong ba'i lam byang chub chen po'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya bar brjod snyam pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas dkyus ma mthong ba'i lam nyid rgya cher ston pa ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since the path of seeing is primarily the cause of great enlightenment, how should one practice the perfection of wisdom?🔽The doubt is anticipated by “Why is it so?” and the path of seeing itself is taught extensively with “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings…”

original: de ltar re re nas bstan nas spyir bsdus te brjod pa'i don du rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs
analyzed: de ltar re re nas bstan nas spyir bsdus te brjod pa'i don du rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs
translated: Having taught each of them individually, in order to express them in summary, it is said, “Subhūti, for bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, all six perfections…”

original: pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes sngar gsungs pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes sngar gsungs pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug
translated: Since it was previously stated, “Thus, this perfection of wisdom is the designation of the perfection of the six perfections,” the six perfections are perfected by the practice of the perfection of wisdom alone.

original: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, since it was previously stated that “this perfection of wisdom is the designation of the perfection of the six perfections,” it is the very practice of the perfection of wisdom that perfects the cultivation of the six perfections.🔽This is the meaning.

original: 'dir ni gzhung mdor bsdus te brjod par bzhed pa yin @304a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mdor bsdus te brjod par bzhed pa yin @304a * //
translated: Here, since it is intended to state the text concisely,

original: pa'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa re re'i spyad pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa re re'i spyad pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that by the practice of each perfection, such as generosity, the cultivation of the six perfections is perfected.

original: de yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sems can rnams la byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las kyis nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba ni de'i tshul
analyzed: de yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe sems can rnams la byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las kyis nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba ni de'i tshul
translated: Subhūti, here when the bodhisattva is giving a gift, he should be physically, verbally, and mentally loving to sentient beings.

original: khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi len pa po rnams gshe zhing 'khyal bar smra ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de bzhin du bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // de nyid kyi len pa po rnams gshe zhing 'khyal bar smra ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de bzhin du bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That is the perfection of morality.🔽That very patience with those who scold, revile, and so forth is the perfection of patience.

original: de nyid kyi slong mo pa'i khro zhing mtshang 'bru bar yongs su smra ba la sogs pas sbyin pa la spro ba mi 'dor ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi slong mo pa'i khro zhing mtshang 'bru bar yongs su smra ba la sogs pas sbyin pa la spro ba mi 'dor ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That very enthusiasm for giving, even when beggars are angry and abusive, and so forth, is the perfection of effort.

original: de nyid kyi sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems med pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo zhing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems med pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration is the dedication of that generosity to omniscience and the absence of a thought distracted by the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de nyid kyi sbyin pa byin pa na sgyu ma'i blos nye bar gnas pas gang la yang phan pa'am gnod par 'gyur ba ma mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sbyin pa byin pa na sgyu ma'i blos nye bar gnas pas gang la yang phan pa'am gnod par 'gyur ba ma mthong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the generosity of that bodhisattva, when he gives, being situated in the mind of illusion, not seeing any benefit or harm to anyone.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims bsrung ba nas shes rab bsgom pa'i bar du re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas bsdus pa ni mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims bsrung ba nas shes rab bsgom pa'i bar du re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas bsdus pa ni mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, each of the perfections, from morality up to wisdom, should be described as being included in the perfection of generosity, by way of the fulfillment of the six perfections.

original: de bas na 'di skad du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa so sor re re'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa so sor re re'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that each of the six perfections, such as generosity, is each one of the perfections, such as generosity.

original: ngo bor pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad phan tshun bsdus pa gang yin pa skad cig ma gcig pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bsdus pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug gis rnam par skyes
analyzed: ngo bor pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad phan tshun bsdus pa gang yin pa skad cig ma gcig pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bsdus pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug gis rnam par skyes
translated: The essence of the summit is the single moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that subsumes all transcendent perfections and is distinguished by the thirty six aspects that subsume the three spheres and are purified of the three spheres.🔽It should be understood that this is the path of seeing.

original: pa de ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa 'dir mthong ba'i lam yin par shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //🔽de skad du yang /🔽sbyin pa la sogs re rer yang //🔽de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
analyzed: pa de ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa 'dir mthong ba'i lam yin par shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no // de skad du yang / sbyin pa la sogs re rer yang // de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
translated: As the Abhidharmakośa states,

original: skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //🔽bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis // bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The single moment of perseverance🔽for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering🔽that subsumes the transcendent perfections

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: of generosity and so on is the path of seeing.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni sngon nyid spangs par gyur pas ji ltar rab kyi mthar thug par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs @304b 'di la spong bar bstan zhe na de ni nyes pa med de gang gi phyir dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni sngon nyid spangs par gyur pas ji ltar rab kyi mthar thug par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs @304b 'di la spong bar bstan zhe na de ni nyes pa med de gang gi phyir dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa
translated: Since such conceptions were previously abandoned, how could they be taught to be abandoned at this stage of realizing the culmination of the supreme?

original: la sogs pa'i mdo las gsang ba phra mo la rjes su 'jug pa dang mngon par shes pa chen po la gags byed pa'i kun du rmongs pa dag dang de'i sa bon ni sa bcu pa la spong ngo zhes gsungs pa de bas na ji skad du bshad
analyzed: la sogs pa'i mdo las gsang ba phra mo la rjes su 'jug pa dang mngon par shes pa chen po la gags byed pa'i kun du rmongs pa dag dang de'i sa bon ni sa bcu pa la spong ngo zhes gsungs pa de bas na ji skad du bshad
translated: There is no fault because the sutra the Definitive Commentary on Enlightened Intent and so forth states that the seeds of the two kinds of confusion that cause one to engage in subtle secrets and create obstacles to the great levels of deeper discernment are abandoned on the tenth level.

original: pa'i kun du rmongs pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu yang dag par bcad pas rgyu can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnam pa de lta bu rnams ni rab kyi mthar thug par rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas nas bcu pa dang 'brel pa'i
analyzed: pa'i kun du rmongs pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu yang dag par bcad pas rgyu can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnam pa de lta bu rnams ni rab kyi mthar thug par rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas nas bcu pa dang 'brel pa'i
translated: Therefore, since the cause of the habitual tendencies of confusion as explained is eliminated, the four kinds of conceptions of perceived objects and perceiving subjects are also eliminated.🔽Since the nature of the tenth level is that of the culmination of the supreme, it is connected with the tenth level.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la nges par spong bar byed pa yin la gzhan dag tu ni res 'ga' ba'i spong ba yin no zhes sngon gyi slob dpon rnams 'chad do //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la nges par spong bar byed pa yin la gzhan dag tu ni res 'ga' ba'i spong ba yin no zhes sngon gyi slob dpon rnams 'chad do //
translated: The clear realization of the summit is definitely an abandonment, but other states are sometimes abandonments.

original: skye bo blo dman pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su brtse ba'i bsam pas ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams yul gyi dbye bas re re zhing rnam pa dgur dbye ba byas pa yin la shes rab rno ba rnams kyis brnyas pa
analyzed: skye bo blo dman pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su brtse ba'i bsam pas ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams yul gyi dbye bas re re zhing rnam pa dgur dbye ba byas pa yin la shes rab rno ba rnams kyis brnyas pa
translated: In order to be understood by those of inferior intellect, the aforementioned conceptions are divided into nine types for each object through the intention to show compassion, but they are not divided in this way for those of sharp faculty

original: spang ba'i phyir shin tu phye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: spang ba'i phyir shin tu phye ba ma yin te /
translated: in order to avoid contempt.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The side of the antidote should be understood in the same way.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni ji skad du bshad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba yin la phyin ci log de yang thog ma med pa nas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni ji skad du bshad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba yin la phyin ci log de yang thog ma med pa nas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The condensed meaning here is this: All the conceptual thoughts of the apprehended and the apprehender, as they have been explained, are motivated by error. And that error is characterized by the beginningless adherence to entities.

original: do // de bas na de las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa can nyid kyis de 'gog pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i shes pas de spong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: do // de bas na de las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa can nyid kyis de 'gog pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i shes pas de spong ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cessation of that is by the knowledge of realitylessness, which has as its object and aspect the negation of that.

original: de spangs pa na de'i rtsa ba can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa gnas pa ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de spangs pa na de'i rtsa ba can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa gnas pa ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: When that is abandoned, how is the attainment of the cessation of the conceptual thoughts of the apprehended and the apprehender, which are rooted in that?

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di yang dag par skyes pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa bzhi po so sor rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas de dag
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di yang dag par skyes pa na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa bzhi po so sor rnam pa dgu'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas de dag
translated: When this path of seeing is properly generated, the four conceptions of the desire, form and formless realms, each with nine aspects, are abandoned, since the one hundred and eight conceptions of subject and object are abandoned.🔽Since they are included in the one hundred and eight afflictive obscurations that generate conceptions, they are abandoned by the reality of dependent origination.

original: gis bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'i bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis thob nas de dbang du bya ba'i phyir de nyid yang dang yang du bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa
analyzed: gis bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'i bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis thob nas de dbang du bya ba'i phyir de nyid yang dang yang du bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa
translated: Then, in order to master them, one should meditate on them again and again.

original: ni thabs lam mkhas pa thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te @305a * //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ni thabs lam mkhas pa thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te @305a * //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the complete meditation on all the methods of the path.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i rnal 'byor ba de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs nas dus phyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lam rig pa'i rkyen
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i rnal 'byor ba de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs nas dus phyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lam rig pa'i rkyen
translated: Because yogis who obtain the path of seeing are free from the fear of afflictive and knowledge obscurations, they enter into the meditative stabilization called the lion’s sport and later correctly contemplate dependent origination in forward and reverse orders, “Conditioned by ignorance, there are actions” and so on in forward order and “With the cessation of birth, aging and death cease” and so on in reverse order.

original: gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mthun pa dang skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mi mthun par yang dag par rtog pa 'di ni 'dir thabs mkhas pa yin par shes par bya'o
analyzed: gyis 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mthun pa dang skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa lugs dang mi mthun par yang dag par rtog pa 'di ni 'dir thabs mkhas pa yin par shes par bya'o
translated: This should be understood as the skill in means here.

original: // de skad du yang /🔽seng+ge rnam bsgyings ting 'dzin la //
analyzed: // de skad du yang / seng+ge rnam bsgyings ting 'dzin la //
translated: And it is said:🔽Having entered the meditative stabilization

original: snyoms par zhugs nas de nas ni //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs nas de nas ni //
translated: called the lion’s sport,🔽they contemplate dependent origination

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung lugs mthun dang // lugs mi mthun pa rtog par byed //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung lugs mthun dang // lugs mi mthun pa rtog par byed //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: in forward and reverse orders.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa rten rtogs pa sngon du btang ba yin na go sla bas rten bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa'i don du rab 'byor thabs la mkhas pa thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa zhes🔽bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa rten rtogs pa sngon du btang ba yin na go sla bas rten bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa'i don du rab 'byor thabs la mkhas pa thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Having described the path of seeing, in order to teach the path of meditation, which is the basis for abandoning the discordant class and so on, since it is easy to understand if the basis is presented first, the sutra states:🔽Subhuti, those who wish to grasp all skillful means.

original: thabs la mkhas pa thams cad ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa thams cad ni 'dir bsgom pa'i lam yin no //
translated: All skillful means are the path of meditation.

original: de yang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus bsdus pa yin la de yang dam pa thong rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus bsdus pa yin la de yang dam pa thong rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that this is subsumed by the nine serial absorptions and that is subsumed by the serial and transcendent absorptions.

original: de bas na 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan dang bo nas brtsams nas 'gog pa'i bar du song ste de'i 'og tu 'gog pa nas brtsams te bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ong pas de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsam gtan dang bo nas brtsams nas 'gog pa'i bar du song ste de'i 'og tu 'gog pa nas brtsams te bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ong pas de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i
translated: Therefore, it is said that bodhisattvas ascend from the first absorption to cessation and then descend from cessation to the first absorption.🔽In this way, they ascend and descend through the nine stages of meditative attainment: the four absorptions, the four formless states and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: rim pa gnyis kyis bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug ba dang dgur song zhing 'ongs nas yang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs te de las langs nas 'gog pa la zhes bya ba nas de bzhin
