original: sbyor ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa @307a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa @307a * //
translated: For the purpose of abandoning the conception of the path of preparation,🔽all phenomena are like illusions, and therefore they are inexpressible by the knowledge of the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: spang ba'i don du chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na thos pa dang bsam pa dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du tha snyad med pa brjod du med pa smrar med🔽pa tshig med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: spang ba'i don du chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na thos pa dang bsam pa dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du tha snyad med pa brjod du med pa smrar med pa tshig med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In order, they are inexpressible, ineffable, unspeakable, and wordless.

original: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eighth conception is stated in the passage beginning “All phenomena are beyond measure.”

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i don du chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis chos thams cad la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i don du chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis chos thams cad la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the purpose of abandoning the conceptual thoughts of the path of seeing, because of the method of the dharma-dhātu, all dharmas are without measure.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gzugs mtshan ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gzugs mtshan ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That very thing is clarified by the statement, “because form is signless, etc.”

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the ninth conceptual thought is stated, “because all dharmas are signless.”

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pas na mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pas na mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the purpose of abandoning the conceptual thoughts of the path of meditation, because all dharmas are emptiness, they are signless.🔽In this way, by benefiting those sentient beings who delight in the concise, and by having compassion for those sentient beings who delight in the extensive, the extensive and concise Dharma is taught.

original: 'di skad du mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pas chos mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams la rjes su brtse bas chos rgyas pa dang ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan mi byed bas sangs rgyas
analyzed: 'di skad du mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pas chos mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems can rnams la rjes su brtse bas chos rgyas pa dang ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan mi byed bas sangs rgyas
translated: Those who do not practice the meaning as it has been explained,

original: kyi mgon dang bcas pas yongs su ma bzung ba dang / byung ba 'gags pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu dang bral bas mthong ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang /
analyzed: kyi mgon dang bcas pas yongs su ma bzung ba dang / byung ba 'gags pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu dang bral bas mthong ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi yon tan med pa dang /
translated: and since the past is not established, the qualities of the path of preparation do not exist; and since the future does not exist, the qualities of the path of seeing do not exist; and since the present is not established, the qualities of the path of meditation do not exist.🔽Thus, in order to engage in the path of preparation, which connects one to nirvana, through the emptiness of the past and so on, in order to engage in the path of seeing through the establishment of emptiness and in order to engage in the path of meditation through meditating on the nature of the absence of intrinsic existence, I will engage in the illusionlike states.

original: zhib la sogs pa nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das par sbyor ba'i lam dang / stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam dang / rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgom par byed pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam la sgyu ma lta bur bdag gis 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar 'jug pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: zhib la sogs pa nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das par sbyor ba'i lam dang / stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam dang / rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgom par byed pa nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam la sgyu ma lta bur bdag gis 'jug par bya'o zhes de ltar 'jug pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu byang chub sems dpa'
translated: Thus the first set of nine aspects of the conception of the apprehended that are based on the position of engagement are eliminated.

original: rnams kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba nyid yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyis bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba nyid yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: and the path of cultivation, are to be abandoned by the path of vision and the path of cultivation, respectively.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:🔽In brief, the three paths of purification

original: mdor bsdus rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: mdor bsdus rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: are not taken up by the Buddha,🔽are devoid of good qualities in the three times,

original: bstang bas yongs su ma bzung dang // dus gsum @307b yon tan med pa dang // legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //
analyzed: bstang bas yongs su ma bzung dang // dus gsum @307b yon tan med pa dang // legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //
translated: and are the three kinds of bad paths.

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog 'di gcig ste //🔽sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog 'di gcig ste // sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: This is the one conceptual differentiation of the apprehended

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: that has the aspect of application as its sphere.

original: de ltar dang bo bstan nas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dag brjod par bya ba yin pa las rnam par rtog pa dang po'i don ni chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te byang chub kyi sems
analyzed: de ltar dang bo bstan nas gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dag brjod par bya ba yin pa las rnam par rtog pa dang po'i don ni chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te byang chub kyi sems
translated: Thus, having explained the first, he now explains the second conceptual differentiation of the apprehended. The meaning of the first conceptual differentiation is stated in the words: “because all dharmas are conducive to penetration.”

original: mi skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of non-arising, it is the realization of all phenomena through the principle of the realm of phenomena.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the second conception is stated as because all phenomena are naturally pure.

original: byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog ba bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yongs su shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog ba bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yongs su shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of not attending to the essence of enlightenment, it is the thorough understanding of all phenomena as naturally pure.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni chos thams cad tshig med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni chos thams cad tshig med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the third conception is stated as because all phenomena are beyond words.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad tshig gi lam las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad tshig gi lam las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of attending to the Hearer's Vehicle, it is because all phenomena are beyond the path of words.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni chos thams cad 'gog pa med pas spong ba mnyam pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni chos thams cad 'gog pa med pas spong ba mnyam pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the fourth conception is stated in the line “because of the sameness of abandonment through the non-cessation of all phenomena.”

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad skye ba med pas spong ba mtshungs pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad skye ba med pas spong ba mtshungs pas 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to dispel the conception of the vehicle of the solitary realizers, it is said that because all phenomena are the same in being unborn, they are not ceased, because they are not produced.

original: rnam par rtog pa lnga ba'i don ni chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob cing de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lnga ba'i don ni chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob cing de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the fifth conception is stated in the line “because of the attainment of nirvana and the sameness of suchness of all phenomena.”

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to dispel the conception of not attending to perfect complete enlightenment, it is said that because all phenomena are realized to be the same in suchness, they are naturally in nirvana.

original: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni chos thams cad mi 'ong mi 'gro mi shes mi skye shin tu mi skye ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus med pa'i phyir go
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni chos thams cad mi 'ong mi 'gro mi shes mi skye shin tu mi skye ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus med pa'i phyir go
translated: The meaning of the sixth conception is stated: “because all phenomena do not come, do not go, are not cognized, are not born, and are utterly unborn.”

original: rims bzhin du mi 'ong mi 'gro'o //🔽de bas na yod pa'i chos rnams mi shes shing da ltar byung ba mi skye la chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra @308a * //
analyzed: rims bzhin du mi 'ong mi 'gro'o // de bas na yod pa'i chos rnams mi shes shing da ltar byung ba mi skye la chos kyi dbyings dang 'dra @308a * //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of meditation, it is stated that they do not come and go, respectively, because the past and future times do not exist.

original: bar shin tu ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni bdag dang gzhan du mi lta ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bar shin tu ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni bdag dang gzhan du mi lta ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not cognized as existent phenomena, they are not born in the present, and they are utterly unborn because they are similar to the dharmadhātu.🔽The meaning of the seventh conception is stated: “because one does not view self and other.”

original: bsgom pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du rang dang gzhan nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du rang dang gzhan nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of nonmeditation, it is stated that one does not observe self and other.

original: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eighth conception is stated in the passage beginning “All phenomena are the noble ones’ ….”

original: bsgom pa med cing mi bsgom pa yang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pas na chos thams cad 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa med cing mi bsgom pa yang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa med pas na chos thams cad 'phags pa'o //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception that there is no meditation and that there is no nonmeditation, it says that all phenomena are the noble ones’ because they are free of the faults of origination and so on.

original: bsgom par 'os pa yin bas na dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom par 'os pa yin bas na dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: They are the arhats because they are worthy of meditation,

original: gang gi phyir sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are naturally pure by being like an illusion.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni chos thams cad khur bor zhing khur mi khyer ba'i phyir zhes gsungs ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni chos thams cad khur bor zhing khur mi khyer ba'i phyir zhes gsungs ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the ninth conception is stated in the passage beginning “All phenomena are free of the burden and do not carry a burden.”

original: don ji lta ba ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i khur med pa na khur bor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i khur med pa na khur bor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception that they are not as they are, it says that they are free of the burden because they are free of the burden of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: 'di skad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa med pas byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi rigs can nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i theg pa yid la mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas byang chub kyi sems mi skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa med pas byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi rigs can nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i theg pa yid la mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is said that the awakening mind does not arise in those who lack spiritual teachers and so on, that the essence of enlightenment is not brought to mind because there is no special excellence in the merit that focuses on the Buddha, that the vehicle of the bodhisattva is not brought to mind because one is of the śrāvaka type,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i theg pa la mngon du phyogs par byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa dang bral bas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i theg pa la mngon du phyogs par byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa dang bral bas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa dang /
translated: that the vehicle of the pratyekabuddha is brought to mind because one is of the pratyekabuddha type, and that perfect enlightenment is not brought to mind because one lacks the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bsgom pa dang / dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa med pa dang / dmigs pa yang med mi dmigs pa yang med pas bsgom pa yang med bsgom pa med pa yang ma yin pa dang / phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la dngos po la sogs par mngon par zhen pas ma rung bar gyur pa nyid kyi bdag gis ldog bar bya'o zhes de ltar bzlog pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bsgom pa dang / dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis bsgom pa med pa dang / dmigs pa yang med mi dmigs pa yang med pas bsgom pa yang med bsgom pa med pa yang ma yin pa dang / phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pas don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid la dngos po la sogs par mngon par zhen pas ma rung bar gyur pa nyid kyi bdag gis ldog bar bya'o zhes de ltar bzlog pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i gzung ba'i rnam
translated: The two kinds of conceptual thoughts that are the bases of the reversal of those are the nine kinds of conceptual thoughts that are to be abandoned in the context of the bodhisattva’s path of meditation.

original: par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam ba dgu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgom pa'i @308b lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba nyid yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs
analyzed: par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam ba dgu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsgom pa'i @308b lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba nyid yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs
translated: They are taught in terms of their reversal by the teaching of the context of their antidotes.

original: so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: Second, the mind and mental factors

original: 'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de //🔽sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de // sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi //
translated: are asserted to be the subjects that engage.🔽The nonarising of mind and the nonattention🔽to the essence of enlightenment,🔽the attention to the lesser vehicle,

original: snying po yid la mi byed dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
analyzed: snying po yid la mi byed dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
translated: and the nonattention to complete enlightenment,🔽meditation and nonmeditation,🔽the very reversal of those,

original: bsgom dang sgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa //🔽bsgom pa'i lam la shes par bya //
analyzed: bsgom dang sgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa // bsgom pa'i lam la shes par bya //
translated: and the conceptualization of the meaning that is not as it is

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: should be understood to be on the path of meditation.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis bstan nas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, having explained the two types of conceptions of apprehended objects, the first type of conceptions of the apprehending subject will now be discussed.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa dang po'i don ni chos thams cad yul med cing phyogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa dang po'i don ni chos thams cad yul med cing phyogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the first conception is stated in the lines “because all phenomena are devoid of objects and directions” and so on.

original: sems can du gdags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i don du chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas spyi dang khyad par gyi yul dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i don du chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas spyi dang khyad par gyi yul dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon the conceptualization of sentient beings, all phenomena are the nature of the dharmadhātu, and therefore they are free from the objects of universals and particulars.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to clarify that very point,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Why is that? Subhūti, form is empty by nature.”

original: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “by nature” means

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi spyi dang khyad par gyi yul dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi spyi dang khyad par gyi yul dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the nature of emptiness is free from the objects of universals and particulars.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni chos thams cad 'gog pa rab tu sim par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni chos thams cad 'gog pa rab tu sim par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the second conceptualization is stated as “because all phenomena are the cessation that brings relief.”

original: chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad 'gog pa'i stong pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan tshad med pa'i snying po dang ldan pa nyid kyi dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad 'gog pa'i stong pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan tshad med pa'i snying po dang ldan pa nyid kyi dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conceptualization of the non-reality-limit, he says, “because of the absence of the non-reality-limit,” because of the essence of the immeasurable excellences such as great compassion, which is the reality of all things.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni dga' ba med cing dga' ba dang bral ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni dga' ba med cing dga' ba dang bral ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the third conceptualization is stated, “because of the absence of the absence of delight and the absence of the absence of non-delight.”

original: stong pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na mngon par zhen pa dang mngon par ma zhen ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis na mngon par zhen pa dang mngon par ma zhen ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conceptualization of non-emptiness, he says, “because of the absence of the absence of delight,” because of the absence of the absence of delight in the illusion-like nature of all things, which is free from the extremes of reification and repudiation.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i @309a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i @309a * //
translated: The meaning of the fourth conceptualization is stated, “because of the absence of the absence of non-delight.”

original: don ni 'dod chags med cing 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pas dben pa'i phyir
analyzed: don ni 'dod chags med cing 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pas dben pa'i phyir
translated: For the sake of abandoning the conception of attachment, all phenomena are the essence of the dharmadhātu, and therefore are empty of attachment and non-attachment.

original: ro // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ro // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach just that, it is said, Why is that? anticipating doubt. Subhūti, form... and so on is stated.

original: de kho na dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnam grangs nyid la de kho na dang bcas pa'i sgrar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnam grangs nyid la de kho na dang bcas pa'i sgrar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Along with reality should be viewed as a synonym for reality, and the term along with should be viewed as a term for reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa lnga ba'i don ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lnga ba'i don ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the fifth conception is stated as because of natural purity.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chags pa dang ma chags pa dang bral bas chos thams cad la thams cad kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa nyid kyis na yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chags pa dang ma chags pa dang bral bas chos thams cad la thams cad kyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa nyid kyis na yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the discrimination of thorough differentiation, because all phenomena are pure by nature, being free from attachment and non-attachment, due to the non-arising of all natures.

original: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni chos thams cad chags pa dang ma chags pa'i zhen pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni chos thams cad chags pa dang ma chags pa'i zhen pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the sixth discrimination is stated as because all phenomena are free from the clinging of attachment and non-attachment.

original: dngos po'i ched du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis chags ba dang ma chags pa dang bral bas chos thams cad la zhen pa med ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ched du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis chags ba dang ma chags pa dang bral bas chos thams cad la zhen pa med ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the discrimination of objectification, because all phenomena are free from attachment and non-attachment, due to their illusion-like nature, they are free from clinging.

original: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the seventh discrimination is stated as the wisdom of the Buddha, and so on.

original: theg ba gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du gang gi phyir /
analyzed: theg ba gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du gang gi phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the conceptual thought of the three vehicles that is a form of renunciation, it is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from the dharmadhatu🔽there is no such thing as a dharma.

original: 'di ltar chos yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud pas chos thams cad byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud pas chos thams cad byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because all dharmas are by nature enlightenment, one should understand the Buddha’s gnosis.

original: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eighth conceptualization is stated in the passage beginning “All dharmas are emptiness” and so on.

original: yon ma dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad ni rnam par thar pa sgo gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yon ma dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du chos thams cad ni rnam par thar pa sgo gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In order to abandon the conceptualization of impure qualities, it is said that all dharmas are by nature the three doors of liberation.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du byams pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhe sdang ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du byams pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhe sdang ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa
translated: The meaning of the ninth conception is stated from “preceded by great love” and so on. In order to abandon the conception of the disturbance of conduct, the nature of love is the pacification of the faults of hatred and so on.

original: rab tu zhi bar byed pas chos thams cad sman lta bu'i @309b ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar byed pas chos thams cad sman lta bu'i @309b ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are the nature of medicine.

original: 'di skad du rdzas su yod par mi 'thad pas sems can du btags pa dang / snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir chos su btags pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos stong pa ma yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di skad du rdzas su yod par mi 'thad pas sems can du btags pa dang / snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir chos su btags pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos stong pa ma yin pa nyid dang /
translated: Thus, since it is untenable that they substantially exist, they are imputed as sentient beings, since they are mere appearances, they are imputed as phenomena, and since they are all-pervading, the phenomena of omniscience and so on are not empty.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pas chos la chags pa dang ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / ched du bya ba mi byed pas dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pa ma spangs pas chos la chags pa dang ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / ched du bya ba mi byed pas dngos po'i ched du bya ba byed pa dang /
translated: Since they do not relinquish attachment to all aspects, they are attached to phenomena. Since they realize the absence of entityness, they discern phenomena. Since they do not perform their function, they perform the function of entities.🔽Since they observe form and so on, they are liberated by the three vehicles. Since they do not enter the perfect, they are impure. Since they practice generosity and so on while observing them, their conduct is disturbed. They apprehend the self as substantially existent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyi yon ma dag pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs par dmigs te bsgrub pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes de ltar skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyi nges par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyi yon ma dag pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs par dmigs te bsgrub pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes de ltar skyes bu rdzas su yod pa la brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog
translated: Thus bodhisattvas who rely on a substantially existent person apprehend the self.

original: pa dang po rnam pa dgu ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs so zhes brjod pa yin no zhes /
analyzed: pa dang po rnam pa dgu ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs so zhes brjod pa yin no zhes /
translated: The first nine aspects are said to be objects of abandonment on the occasion of the path of preparation of the path of meditation. They are taught by way of their opposites, by way of the occasion of their antidotes.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it says:🔽The domain of the designation of sentient beings,

original: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
analyzed: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
translated: The designation of phenomena, and nonemptiness,🔽Attachment, differentiation, the nature of things,🔽Making things substantial, the three vehicles,🔽And the impurity of gifts,

original: chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la //
analyzed: chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa la //
translated: And the disturbance of conduct,

original: 'dzin par byed pa dang por te //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa dang por te //
translated: Are the first of the apprehensions.

original: shes par bya ba bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: shes par bya ba bsgrags pa yin //
translated: They are proclaimed to be objects of knowledge.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the first conception,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu brjod par bya ba yin pas rnam par rtog pa dang po'i don ni chos thams cad byams pa la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu brjod par bya ba yin pas rnam par rtog pa dang po'i don ni chos thams cad byams pa la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The second type of conception, which has nine aspects, is to be expressed, so the meaning of the first conception is stated in the passage beginning “All phenomena are grounded in love” and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du /
translated: In order to remove the conception that is confused about the obscurations to omniscience,

original: chos thams cad tshangs ba'i gnas ba bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad tshangs ba'i gnas ba bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are by nature the four abodes of Brahmā.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni chos thams cad tshangs par gyur pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i don ni chos thams cad tshangs par gyur pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the second conception is stated in the passage beginning “All phenomena are Brahmā” and so on.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i @310a * //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i @310a * //
translated: In order to remove the conception that is confused about the obscurations to the knowledge of the path,

original: rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du nyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu med pa nyid kyis mi bskyed pa'i phyir na chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis so //🔽rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni chos thams cad smon pa med pa'i phyir dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du nyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu med pa nyid kyis mi bskyed pa'i phyir na chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa nyid kyis so // rnam par rtog pa gsum pa'i don ni chos thams cad smon pa med pa'i phyir dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to eliminate the third misconception, he says, “Because of the absence of all faults, they are not produced. All phenomena are by nature nirvana.”🔽The meaning of the third misconception is stated in the line, “Because all phenomena are wishless and free of anger,” and so forth.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad la don du gnyer ba dang khong khro ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad la don du gnyer ba dang khong khro ba dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the misconception that is confused about the obscurations to the knowledge of all things, it is said that all phenomena are free of the pursuit of goals and of anger.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni rgya mtsho mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog ba bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan rin po che'i rgyur
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'i don ni rgya mtsho mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog ba bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan rin po che'i rgyur
translated: The meaning of the fourth conception is stated in the phrase because the ocean is limitless.🔽In order to eliminate the conception that is confused about the path that pacifies everything, the text says that all phenomena are the cause of the precious qualities of the ten powers and so on.

original: gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang mnyam pas rgya mtsho mu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang mnyam pas rgya mtsho mu med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the fourth conception is stated in the phrase “because the ocean is boundless,” because all phenomena are the cause of the jewels of the ten powers and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa lnga'i don ni nam mkha' mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lnga'i don ni nam mkha' mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the fifth conception is stated in the phrase “because space is boundless,”

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba dang mi ldan pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi nam mkha' dang mnyam pas nam mkha' mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba dang mi ldan pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi nam mkha' dang mnyam pas nam mkha' mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are equal to the space of emptiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni ri rab sna tshogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa drug pa'i don ni ri rab sna tshogs pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the sixth conception is stated: “because of the variety of Mount Meru.”

original: mi mnyam pa nyid la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog ba bsal ba'i don du mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa thams cad kyis bsgul bar mi nus pa nyid kyis na ri rab dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog ba bsal ba'i don du mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa thams cad kyis bsgul bar mi nus pa nyid kyis na ri rab dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of delusion regarding inequality, it is like Mount Meru, because it cannot be shaken by any misfortune.

original: chos thams cad ri rab sna tshogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ri rab sna tshogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: All things are the variety of Mount Meru.

original: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni gzugs mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdun pa'i don ni gzugs mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the seventh conception is stated: “because of the infinitude of form,” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du gzugs la sogs ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas mthar thug pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du gzugs la sogs ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas mthar thug pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of delusion regarding the truth of suffering, and so on, form, and so on, is the nature of the dharma-dhātu, and therefore it is not ultimately existent.

original: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa brgyad pa'i don ni nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eighth conception is stated beginning with “the orb of the sun’s rays.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba nyid kyis na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor @310b gyi 'od zer 'byung ba dang 'dra bas nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor mu
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba nyid kyis na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor @310b gyi 'od zer 'byung ba dang 'dra bas nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor mu
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of confusion about the nature of the afflictions, it is said that because all phenomena are naturally radiant, like the orb of the sun’s rays, the orb of the sun’s rays is seen to be without

original: med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: darkness.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni sgra thams cad mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu pa'i don ni sgra thams cad mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the ninth conception is stated beginning with “because all sounds are limitless.”

original: gnyis su med pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad ming tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas sgra thams cad mthar thug pa med pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyis na sgra thams cad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad ming tsam gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas sgra thams cad mthar thug pa med pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyis na sgra thams cad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of confusion about nonduality, it is said that because all phenomena are the nature of mere names, all sounds are without limit and are the same, and therefore all sounds are nonexistent.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o //🔽'di skad du rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma shes pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sgrib pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / lam thams cad yongs su ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid la sgrib pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o // 'di skad du rnam pa thams cad yongs su ma shes pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sgrib pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / lam thams cad yongs su ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid la sgrib pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: The perfections should be known to be infinite.🔽In this way, the confusion that obscures the knowledge of all aspects due to not knowing all aspects completely, the confusion that obscures the knowledge of the path due to not knowing all paths completely,

original: gzhi thams cad yongs su ma shes pas thams cad shes pa nyid la sgrib pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma shes pas thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa shes bya'i de bzhin nyid du yongs su ma shes pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad yongs su ma shes pas thams cad shes pa nyid la sgrib pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma shes pas thams cad zhi ba'i lam la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa shes bya'i de bzhin nyid du yongs su ma shes pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: the confusion that obscures the knowledge of all due to not knowing all bases completely, the confusion that obscures the path of the pacification of all due to not knowing the perfection of wisdom completely, and the confusion of being endowed with or not being endowed with suchness and so on due to not knowing the suchness of objects of knowledge such as form and so on completely.

original: bdud la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid la kun tu rmongs pa dang don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid la kun tu rmongs pa dang don la sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin la kun tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: Since they do not fully understand the nature of demons and so on, they are confused about the unequaled. Since they apprehend the meaning literally, they are confused about the truth of suffering and so on. Since they do not fully understand the nature of attachment and so on, they are confused about the nature of affliction.🔽Since they do not fully understand the characteristics of apprehended objects and the apprehending subject, they are confused about nonduality. They apprehend the person as truly existent, the cause for positing it as a sentient being, and they apprehend the self as truly existent, the subject that perceives the mere appearance that is the cause for positing it as a person.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas gnyis su med pa la kun tu rmongs pa la sems can du btags pa dang / de rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu snang ba tsam gyi yul can bdag btags bar yod pa nyid du 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes skyes bu btags par yod pa la brten pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas gnyis su med pa la kun tu rmongs pa la sems can du btags pa dang / de rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu snang ba tsam gyi yul can bdag btags bar yod pa nyid du 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes skyes bu btags par yod pa la brten pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las
translated: Thus they have two types of conceptual thoughts that apprehend the person as existing as a nominal imputation.

original: byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu byang chub sems dpa' spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs so zhes bstan rba yin no //
analyzed: byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu byang chub sems dpa' spang bar bya ba yin par de dang de'i gnyen po'i gnas skabs bstan pas ldog pa'i sgo nas gsungs so zhes bstan rba yin no //
translated: The nine aspects of the subject that is the occasion of engagement of the event are to be abandoned by the bodhisattva. They are taught by way of their cessation, through teaching the occasion of their antidote.

original: de skad du yang /🔽sems can btags dang de'i rgyu yi //
analyzed: de skad du yang / sems can btags dang de'i rgyu yi //
translated: And thus it is said:🔽The imputation of sentient beings and its cause

original: yul can de yis @311a * //
analyzed: yul can de yis @311a * //
translated: Are the object of that

original: rnam 'joms ba //🔽bsgom ba'i lam dang 'brel pa yi //
analyzed: rnam 'joms ba // bsgom ba'i lam dang 'brel pa yi //
translated: Which is to be destroyed.🔽The other nine aspects of the opposing factors

original: mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //
translated: Are connected with the path of meditation.🔽The three obscurations of the omniscience

original: bdag nyid ji bzhin kun mkhyen ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji bzhin kun mkhyen ni //
translated: That is just like the self🔽Are the three, the path of peace, suchness, and so forth,

original: gsum gyi sgrib pa rnam gsum dang // zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan la //
analyzed: gsum gyi sgrib pa rnam gsum dang // zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan la //
translated: And being associated and not being associated.🔽The non-uniformity of suffering and so forth🔽And the nature of the afflictions

original: mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //🔽rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //
analyzed: mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la // rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //
translated: Are the confusion about non-duality.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Conceptualization is asserted to be the last.

original: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas par bstan nas de rtogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog ba bzhi spangs pas yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i bsgom pa'i lam la mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyen po dang bcas par bstan nas de rtogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog ba bzhi spangs pas yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang
translated: Thus, having taught the path of meditation with its antidotes as antidotes to adverse factors, the perfection of all good qualities through the abandonment of the four misconceptions about that realization is stated in the line:

original: dag par bsgrub pa mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dag par bsgrub pa mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the perfect accomplishment of all buddhadharmas is limitless.

original: 'di skad du bsgom pa'i lam la goms pas rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi po 'tshe bar byed pa nyid kyis yams kyi nad du gyur pa 'di rnams zad par gyur na gags byed pa med bas dga' bas dbugs phyin pa thob pa bzhin du snying rje'i gzhan
analyzed: 'di skad du bsgom pa'i lam la goms pas rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi po 'tshe bar byed pa nyid kyis yams kyi nad du gyur pa 'di rnams zad par gyur na gags byed pa med bas dga' bas dbugs phyin pa thob pa bzhin du snying rje'i gzhan
translated: It is said that through familiarity with the path of meditation, the four types of misconceptions, which are like a plague, are destroyed and, since there are no longer any obstacles, one obtains the relief of joy, like someone who has been afflicted by a plague.

original: gyi dbang du gyur pas rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i bde ba bskyed par mkhas pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa thams cad rgya mtsho chen po la chu bo rnams bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas🔽pa 'bras bu rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa de dag gis mdzes par 'gyur ba la rnam pa thams cad du mngon du 'ong ba'i rnam pas rten par byed do zhes de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par grub pa mu med pa nyid
analyzed: gyi dbang du gyur pas rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i bde ba bskyed par mkhas pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa thams cad rgya mtsho chen po la chu bo rnams bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa 'bras bu rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa de dag gis mdzes par 'gyur ba la rnam pa thams cad du mngon du 'ong ba'i rnam pas rten par byed do zhes de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par grub pa mu med pa nyid
translated: and the entire ocean of the qualities of the three vehicles, which are the skill in generating the happiness of all beings in every way, are beautified by the bodhisattvas who abide on the path of meditation,🔽who have attained the perfection of the supreme result, and are approached in every way by the aspect of manifest enlightenment.

original: kyi phan yon che ba'i ngo bos bsgom pa'i lam yin par shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi phan yon che ba'i ngo bos bsgom pa'i lam yin par shes par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the path of meditation is characterized by the great benefit of the accomplishment of all the qualities of buddhahood, which is limitless.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is stated:

original: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
analyzed: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
translated: When these epidemics are exhausted,

original: yun rings lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //🔽rnam pa kun tu 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: yun rings lon nas dbugs phyin ltar // rnam pa kun tu 'gro ba yi //
translated: after a long time, they sigh with relief.🔽In every way, they attain

original: bde bsgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
analyzed: bde bsgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
translated: the perfection of the qualities that accomplish happiness.

original: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin //🔽'bras bu mchog gis spa ba yi //
analyzed: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin // 'bras bu mchog gis spa ba yi //
translated: Like a river in the great ocean.🔽The great being,

original: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //🔽rnam pa kun tu rten bar byed //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de la ni // rnam pa kun tu rten bar byed //
translated: adorned with the supreme fruit,🔽is always the support

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: for all of them.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rjes la bar chad med pa'i lam yin pas bar chad med ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi don ni sems can @311b gyi khams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rjes la bar chad med pa'i lam yin pas bar chad med ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi don ni sems can @311b gyi khams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the uninterrupted samādhi is stated in the line “all the realms of sentient beings,” and so on.

original: 'di skad du 'ga' zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis dang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa gang yin pa de dper mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'ga' zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis dang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa gang yin pa de dper mdzad nas /
translated: This is stated as follows: Suppose someone generates the merit of establishing the sentient beings of the three-million-fold world-realm as śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and as irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: de bas khyad par du 'phags pa bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de sangs rgyas nyid thob ba la bar chad med ba'i ting nge 'dzin de ma thag pa stun ma gang yin pa de ni 'dir bar chad
analyzed: de bas khyad par du 'phags pa bsod nams mang ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de sangs rgyas nyid thob ba la bar chad med ba'i ting nge 'dzin de ma thag pa stun ma gang yin pa de ni 'dir bar chad
translated: Therefore, the concentration that is immediately contiguous with the attainment of Buddhahood, which is the knowledge of all aspects, is the concentration without impediment.

original: med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the concentration without impediment here.

original: de ni 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la rab tu khyad par 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la rab tu khyad par 'phags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the perfection of wisdom should be cultivated because of the infinity of the accumulation of merit and knowledge of the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:🔽The merit of the beings of the trichiliocosm,🔽the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas,

original: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med la //
analyzed: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang // byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med la //
translated: and the bodhisattvas' perfection of realization,

original: bkod pa'i dge rnams dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: bkod pa'i dge rnams dper mdzad nas //
translated: are taken as examples.

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: By the abundance of merit,

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar med de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar med de //
translated: there is no impediment up to Buddhahood.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The concentration without obstruction

original: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid // ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad dngos po med par dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad dngos po med par dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The objective condition of this concentration without obstruction is the non-substantiality of all things.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is mindfulness.

original: rnam pa ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid yin par don gyis 'phangs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid yin par don gyis 'phangs par shes par bya ste /
translated: The aspect is the peacefulness of the nature of things, which is to be understood by implication.

original: gzhan du na bar chad pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs par mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bar chad pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs par mi nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to realize the concentration without obstruction.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
analyzed: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
translated: Its objective condition is non-substantiality.

original: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
analyzed: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
translated: Its dominant condition is mindfulness.

original: rnam pa zhi nyid 'di la ni //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa zhi nyid 'di la ni // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is peacefulness.

original: gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir gnas 'di la rab tu smra ba thabs la mkhas pa ma rtogs pa rnams kyi klan ka'i rgol ba rnams sna tshogs brgyud mar 'byung bas /
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir gnas 'di la rab tu smra ba thabs la mkhas pa ma rtogs pa rnams kyi klan ka'i rgol ba rnams sna tshogs brgyud mar 'byung bas /
translated: Because it is difficult to fathom, in this matter, the various disputes of those who are not skilled in the methods of exposition arise in succession.

original: da ni log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba yin pas log par rtogs pa dang po'i don ni sa'i khams mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba yin pas log par rtogs pa dang po'i don ni sa'i khams mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Now, in order to remove wrong understanding, the meaning of the first wrong understanding is stated: “because the earth element is limitless.”

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag dngos po med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa chos can 'thad pa la @312a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag dngos po med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa chos can 'thad pa la @312a * //
translated: The elements of the conditioned and unconditioned, by their very non-existence, are the basis for the apprehension of the subject.

original: log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis yon tan thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa yin pas sa dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi dmigs par gyur pas sa'i khams mu med pa nyid kyis
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis yon tan thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa yin pas sa dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi dmigs par gyur pas sa'i khams mu med pa nyid kyis
translated: In order to remove wrong understanding, by their similarity to illusions, they are the basis for all qualities, and by their similarity to the earth, they are the basis for all phenomena conventionally. Therefore, by the limitless earth element,

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rjes su rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rjes su rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one should realize the uninterrupted samādhi. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma rnams su yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma rnams su yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the later [passages], one should understand that the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is the uninterrupted samādhi.

original: thams cad du rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gnyis pa dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par 'dzin pa'i chos can log par rtogs pa sel ba'i don du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chu dang 'dra ba nyid kyis de kho
analyzed: thams cad du rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gnyis pa dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par 'dzin pa'i chos can log par rtogs pa sel ba'i don du chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chu dang 'dra ba nyid kyis de kho
translated: In order to eliminate the misconception that the second, the entity that is the object of observation, is a phenomenon that is apprehended as a real entity, it is said that all phenomena are naturally pure like water because they are like water in being naturally pure.

analyzed: na bzhin du dmigs pa'i ngo bor bzhag pas chu'i khams mu med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas gsum pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis me dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir snga ma
translated: In order to eliminate the misconception that the third, the entity that is the object of observation, is a real entity, it is said that all phenomena are like fire because they are like fire in being naturally radiant.
