original: khams mu med pa'i phyir dang / rtogs par bya ba med pas drug pa sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas rnam par shes pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad rnam par shes pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi de kho na bzhin du de
analyzed: khams mu med pa'i phyir dang / rtogs par bya ba med pas drug pa sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas rnam par shes pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad rnam par shes pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi de kho na bzhin du de
translated: Since the nature of the Thus-Gone One is the suchness of the equality of all phenomena, which is the nature of mere consciousness,

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas @312b rnam par shes pa mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin du chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas @312b rnam par shes pa mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin du chu'i khams dang me'i khams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: one should understand that the perfection of wisdom is limitless, since consciousness is limitless.

original: log par rtogs pa bdun pa'i don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bdun pa'i don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the seventh misconception is stated with “wholesome and unwholesome phenomena,” and so on.

original: ming du btags pa tsam du zad pas chos dkon mchog la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa nyid yin pas chos thams cad ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos bsags pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na
analyzed: ming du btags pa tsam du zad pas chos dkon mchog la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa nyid yin pas chos thams cad ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos bsags pa dang bral ba nyid kyis na
translated: Since they are not produced in reality, all phenomena are free from the accumulation of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos bsags pa tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag po'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos bsags pa tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are the nature of phenomena that are conventionally posited, virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena are immeasurable.

original: log par rtogs pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa brgyad pa'i don ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eighth misconception is stated in all phenomena and so on.🔽In order to dispel misconceptions about the jewel of Sangha, which is the negation of the observation of form and so on, it is said,

original: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa bkag pas dge 'dun dkon mchog la lag par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad sgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin pas snga ma bzhin du chos thams cad dge 'dun gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas chos thams cad bsags pa tshad🔽med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa bkag pas dge 'dun dkon mchog la lag par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du chos thams cad sgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin pas snga ma bzhin du chos thams cad dge 'dun gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas chos thams cad bsags pa tshad🔽med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all phenomena are the nature of the Sangha, all phenomena are immeasurable.

original: log par rtogs pa dgu pa'i don ni chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas thabs la mkhas pa la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin mu med pa nyid dang mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin
analyzed: log par rtogs pa dgu pa'i don ni chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te / sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas thabs la mkhas pa la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin mu med pa nyid dang mnyam pa nyid kyi de bzhin
translated: The meaning of the ninth misconception is stated in the passage beginning with “all phenomena are called meditative stabilization” and so on.🔽In order to dispel the misconception that the non-observation of generosity and so on is a lack of skill in means, he says that all phenomena are meditative stabilization because they are the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: du thabs la mkhas pa yod pas chos thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin mu med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du thabs la mkhas pa yod pas chos thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin mu med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all phenomena are skill in means in that way, all phenomena are meditative stabilization because they are the attainment of limitless meditative stabilization.

original: log par rtogs pa bcu pa'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bcu pa'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the tenth misconception is stated in the passage beginning with “all the qualities of a buddha” and so on.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo gnyi gar rtogs pa bkag pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo gnyi gar rtogs pa bkag pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir
translated: The refutation of the realization of both the entity and the nonentity refutes the misconception that the realization of the Tathāgata is an entity.

original: chos thams cad rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rtogs pa gzhag pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽log par rtogs pa bcu gcig pa'i don ni chos thams @313a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rtogs pa gzhag pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir ro // log par rtogs pa bcu gcig pa'i don ni chos thams @313a * //
translated: In order to dispel that misconception, it is said that all phenomena are posited as the realization of the Tathāgata in the relative truth of the yogi because all the qualities of the Buddha are limitless.

original: cad mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: cad mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the eleventh misconception is stated in the line “because all phenomena are limitless.”

original: spros pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad mu med pa'i chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: spros pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pas chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad mu med pa'i chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir
translated: Since all phenomena are by nature the embodiment of the limitless nature of reality,

original: chos thams cad snga ma bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pas chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad snga ma bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pas chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: all phenomena are as they were before, without impermanence and so on, because all phenomena are limitless.

original: log par rtogs pa bcu gnyis pa'i don ni stong pa nyid mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bcu gnyis pa'i don ni stong pa nyid mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the twelfth misconception is stated in the line “because emptiness is limitless.”

original: lam rnam par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pas lam la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid mu med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du rtogs pa med pas stong pa nyid
analyzed: lam rnam par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pas lam la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid mu med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du rtogs pa med pas stong pa nyid
translated: Since the result of the path is not actualized by the path being cultivated, in order to dispel misconceptions about the path, it is said that because all phenomena are like an illusion, emptiness is limitless.

original: mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no realization of thatness, emptiness is limitless.

original: log par rtogs pa bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa gnyis kyi don ni sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa gnyis kyi don ni sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the thirteenth and fourteenth misconceptions is stated in the line “because mind and mental factors are limitless.”

original: blang ba dang dor ba med pas gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du ma rig pa las byung ba'i snang ba sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad la kun rdzob tu
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba med pas gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du ma rig pa las byung ba'i snang ba sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa nyid kyis na chos thams cad la kun rdzob tu
translated: Since there is nothing to adopt or reject, in order to dispel misconceptions about antidotes and their discordant factors, the appearance that arises from ignorance is posited conventionally in all phenomena as🔽mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po med pas sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po med pas sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there are no discordant factors and antidotes, mind and mental factors are limitless.

original: log par rtogs pa bco lnga pa'i don ni sems kyi spyod pa mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bco lnga pa'i don ni sems kyi spyod pa mu med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the fifteenth misconception is stated in the line “because the activity of the mind is limitless.”

original: chos can med pas chos kyi mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir snang ba'i rgyu mtshan can du dngos po rnams rnam par gnas pa chos thams cad sems kyi spyod pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa nyid kyis de bzhin du gnas
analyzed: chos can med pas chos kyi mtshan nyid la log par rtogs pa bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir snang ba'i rgyu mtshan can du dngos po rnams rnam par gnas pa chos thams cad sems kyi spyod pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa nyid kyis de bzhin du gnas
translated: Since there are no phenomena, the characteristics of phenomena are misapprehended.🔽In order to dispel that, things are established as having the reason of appearance.🔽All phenomena are characterized by arising from the mind’s activity.🔽

original: pa'i mtshan nyid med pas sems kyi spyod pa mu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid med pas sems kyi spyod pa mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no phenomenon possessor, in order to dispel the misconception about the characteristics of phenomena, it is said that things are established as having the reason of appearance, because the characteristic of the mode of being of all phenomena is the arising of the activity of mind, and because there is no characteristic of the mode of being of the mind.

original: log par rtogs pa bcu drug pa'i don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshad med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa bcu drug pa'i don ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshad med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the sixteenth misconception is stated as “because there is no measure of virtue and nonvirtue.”

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas bsgom pa la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad dge ba dang mi dge ba nye bar ma dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas bsgom pa la log par rtogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin gyi chos thams cad dge ba dang mi dge ba nye bar ma dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to dispel the misconception about meditation, it is said that all phenomena, which are the nature of the perfect limit, are the essence of the nonobservation of virtue and nonvirtue, because the characteristics of the particular and the general are untenable.

original: @313b snga ma bzhin du bsgom pa med pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos gzhal du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //🔽yul gyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir log par rtogs pa mtha' yas na yang gdul bya'i skye bo nye ba na gnas pa'i log par rtogs pa bsal bar bzhed pas skye bo byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa mi shes pa'i rgol ba thams cad kyi
analyzed: @313b snga ma bzhin du bsgom pa med pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos gzhal du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o // yul gyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir log par rtogs pa mtha' yas na yang gdul bya'i skye bo nye ba na gnas pa'i log par rtogs pa bsal bar bzhed pas skye bo byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa mi shes pa'i rgol ba thams cad kyi
translated: As before, because of the immeasurable virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena that are not cultivated, one should understand it to be the perfection of wisdom.🔽Although there are infinite misconceptions due to the distinctions of objects, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means, wishing to dispel the misconceptions of those to be tamed who are nearby,🔽establishes the meaning of the apparent contradictions of the misconceptions of all opponents who do not understand the bodhisattva's skill in means.

original: log par rtogs pa phan tshun 'gal bar snang ba'i don bsgrubs pas mi 'thad pa nyid kyis the tshom gyi ngo bo ji skad du bshad pa'i yul can nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can bcu drug yin no //

translated: Since that is not tenable, the sixteen aspects of omniscience, which have the nature of doubt and the object as explained, are established.

original: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi glan ka la go rims bzhin du don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lan gdab dgos pas byang chub sems dpa' dge ba 'dod pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi glan ka la go rims bzhin du don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi sgo nas lan gdab dgos pas byang chub sems dpa' dge ba 'dod pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas
translated: Therefore, one should answer objections from the standpoint of the two truths, respectively, in terms of the ultimate and the conventional.

original: pa rnam pa stong du bsal ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par skyed nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs par bya'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //

translated: Thus, bodhisattvas who desire virtue should generate certainty in the two truths in a thousand different ways, and then they should understand that they should realize the uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

translated: Thus, in the context of realizing the superiority of the Buddha, the third, realization of the absence of attributes, is taught for the purpose of realizing that phenomena are like the nature of a dream because one's own mind correctly knows that phenomena are of one taste.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag gi ltar na rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu don khyad par can snang ba bskyed pa'i sgo nas gnas @318a * //🔽yongs su gyur pas gyur pa chos ston pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba mdzad pa gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gdon mi za bar khas blangs dgos pa rnams ji ltar bsdu zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag gi ltar na rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu don khyad par can snang ba bskyed pa'i sgo nas gnas @318a * // yongs su gyur pas gyur pa chos ston pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba mdzad pa gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gdon mi za bar khas blangs dgos pa rnams ji ltar bsdu zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: According to you, it is necessary to definitely accept that the yogi's transformation of the basis is a nondual mind and mental factors that perform the function of teaching the Dharma and so on through generating special objects that appear as conventional truth.

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
translated: How are these included?

original: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
analyzed: de nyid khyod ni stong par bzhed //
translated: The way of the Buddha is the emptiness of the dependent.

original: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku bstan pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshul gyis chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku bstan pa nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, the body that is the nature of dharmatā is taught and the dharmakāya that is the nature of nondual wisdom is taught.

original: de ltar yin na ni rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku nyid kyang bstan pa yin pas logs shig tu bstan par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku nyid kyang bstan pa yin pas logs shig tu bstan par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then by the same reasoning, the Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body would also be taught, and so they would not have to be taught separately.

original: 'on te gsung rab las brjod pa'i phyir de dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu bstan to zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te gsung rab las brjod pa'i phyir de dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob tu bstan to zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that they are taught as the conventional of the yogi because they are mentioned in the scriptures,

original: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can chos kyi sku yang de bzhin du logs shig tu bstan par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can chos kyi sku yang de bzhin du logs shig tu bstan par 'gyur ro//
translated: by the same reasoning, the Dharma Body, which has a nondual nature, would also have to be taught separately.

original: kha cig na re sku bzhi bshad pa la //
analyzed: kha cig na re sku bzhi bshad pa la //
translated: Some people explain the four bodies as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs byas dang // de bzhin gzhan pa sprul pa ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs byas dang // de bzhin gzhan pa sprul pa ni //
translated: The essential body, the body of enjoyment, the body of transformation,

original: chos sku mdzad par bcas pa ste //
analyzed: chos sku mdzad par bcas pa ste //
translated: and the Dharma body together with its activity,

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
translated: are correctly said to be the four bodies.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig le 'ur byas pa las ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra'i mjug thogs su chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i sgra mi 'byung bas sku ni gsum kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig le 'ur byas pa las ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra'i mjug thogs su chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i sgra mi 'byung bas sku ni gsum kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, since the term “dharmakāya” does not immediately follow the term “svabhāva,” there are only three bodies.

original: gzhan dag na re nye bar bstan zin pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis dang tshig le'ur byas pa sbyar ba'i ngo bor byas pa dang ye shes kho na dang mdzad par sbyar ba'i phyir de skad gsungs pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nye bar bstan zin pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis dang tshig le'ur byas pa sbyar ba'i ngo bor byas pa dang ye shes kho na dang mdzad par sbyar ba'i phyir de skad gsungs pa yin /
translated: Others say that the statement is made in terms of the purpose already explained, the nature of the composition, and the application of the term “body” to gnosis alone and to activity alone.

original: de'i phyir phyogs gzhan nas sku bzhir gsungs pa thams cad dang mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gzhan nas sku bzhir gsungs pa thams cad dang mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not contradict the statement of four bodies in other sources.

original: de ltar yin du chug na nyan thos la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug na nyan thos la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the difference between the concentration of the absence of affliction of śrāvakas and so on and the concentration of the absence of affliction of a tathāgata?

original: bdag mthong ba las 'ga' zhig gis nyon mongs skye bar gyur na mi rung ngo zhes mi'i nyon mongs pa skye ba yongs su spong ba nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: bdag mthong ba las 'ga' zhig gis nyon mongs skye bar gyur na mi rung ngo zhes mi'i nyon mongs pa skye ba yongs su spong ba nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: It is the concentration of the disciples and so on, which completely eliminates the arising of the afflictions of humans, thinking, “It is not suitable for anyone to generate afflictions upon seeing me.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni grong la sogs par skye bo mtha' dag gi nyon mongs pa'i rgyun drungs 'byin @318b par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni grong la sogs par skye bo mtha' dag gi nyon mongs pa'i rgyun drungs 'byin @318b par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The concentration of the tathāgatas is the elimination of the continuum of afflictions of all beings in villages and so on.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: nyan thos nyon mongs med pa'i lta //
analyzed: nyan thos nyon mongs med pa'i lta //
translated: The disciples’ concentration of absence of afflictions

original: mi yi nyon mongs yongs spong zhing //
analyzed: mi yi nyon mongs yongs spong zhing //
translated: Completely eliminates the afflictions of humans.

original: grong sogs su de'i nyon mongs rnams //🔽rgyun gcod rgyal ba'i nyon mongs med //
analyzed: grong sogs su de'i nyon mongs rnams // rgyun gcod rgyal ba'i nyon mongs med //
translated: In villages and so on, their afflictions

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Are severed. The victors’ concentration of absence of afflictions.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i smon nas shes pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon nas mkhyen pa'i khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i smon nas shes pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon nas mkhyen pa'i khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the knowledge through prayer of the disciples and so on and the knowledge through prayer of the tathāgatas?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That will now be explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon nas mkhyen pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pas gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon nas mkhyen pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / dngos po la mngon par ma zhen pas gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs pas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa dang /
translated: The tathāgatas’ knowledge through prayer is asserted to be superior to the knowledge through prayer of śrāvakas and so on because it is naturally engaged in signlessness, it is free from attachment to form and so on because it is not attached to things, it is unobstructed to all objects of knowledge because it abandons afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their imprints,

original: 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa yang dag par brnyes pas 'dri ba'i lan 'debs par mdzad pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i smon nas shes pa las khyad par du 'phags par bzhed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa yang dag par brnyes pas 'dri ba'i lan 'debs par mdzad pa yin pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i smon nas shes pa las khyad par du 'phags par bzhed do //
translated: it is a permanent state because it remains for as long as saṃsāra exists and it answers all questions because it perfectly obtains discernment.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sangs rgyas smon nas mkhyen pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas smon nas mkhyen pa ni //
translated: The buddhas’ knowledge through prayer🔽is spontaneous, free of attachment,🔽unobstructed, a permanent state

original: lhun gyis grub dang chags spangs dang // thogs pa med dang rtag gnas dang // 'dri ba kun lan 'debs par bzhed //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub dang chags spangs dang // thogs pa med dang rtag gnas dang // 'dri ba kun lan 'debs par bzhed //
translated: and answers all questions.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: nyon mongs ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rmongs pa gnyis spangs pa'i khyad par nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs ba'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni khyad par shin tu phul du
analyzed: nyon mongs ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo bag chags dang bcas pa'i kun du rmongs pa gnyis spangs pa'i khyad par nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs ba'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni khyad par shin tu phul du
translated: The two kinds of obscurations, the afflictive and the cognitive, together with their habitual tendencies, are the two kinds of delusion. The Tathagata's elimination of these is the special quality of his elimination. The qualities of the elements leading to enlightenment and so forth that are present in the Tathagata's stream of being are endowed with the most sublime of all distinctions.

original: byung ba dang ldan pas khyad par gnyis po de ma thag tu bshad pa de dag ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: byung ba dang ldan pas khyad par gnyis po de ma thag tu bshad pa de dag ni nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin par gzung ngo //
translated: The two kinds of distinction just explained are to be understood as being merely illustrative.

original: de ltar yin du chug na rtag tu thugs rdze chen po'i rang bzhin can chos kyi sku la bzhugs pa na rtag tu srog chags mtha' dag gi don ji ltar mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug na rtag tu thugs rdze chen po'i rang bzhin can chos kyi sku la bzhugs pa na rtag tu srog chags mtha' dag gi don ji ltar mi mdzad ce na /
translated: If this is so, one might ask, why does the Tathagata, who is always in the nature of great compassion and who abides in the dharmakaya, not always work for the benefit of all living beings?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang phrad bas sngon skyed pa'i dge ba'i sa bon sangs rgyas la sogs ba la dmigs pa'i rgyu yongs su brtas par gyur pa na sems can gang la dus gang gi tshe chos bstan ba la sogs pa mdzad pas yun du
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang phrad bas sngon skyed pa'i dge ba'i sa bon sangs rgyas la sogs ba la dmigs pa'i rgyu yongs su brtas par gyur pa na sems can gang la dus gang gi tshe chos bstan ba la sogs pa mdzad pas yun du
translated: When the seeds of virtue previously planted by sentient beings through meeting spiritual guides and so on have fully matured, the Buddha and so on, at that time, for the sake of those sentient beings, through teaching the Dharma and so on, acts for their long term benefit.

original: phan par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i don bya ba'i phyir sngon gyi smon lam grub pas bcom ldan 'das @319a * //
analyzed: phan par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i don bya ba'i phyir sngon gyi smon lam grub pas bcom ldan 'das @319a * //
translated: At that time, the Bhagavan, through the power of his previous aspirations, acts for their benefit.

original: de dang der snang ba dang 'tsham par don gyi bya ba mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang der snang ba dang 'tsham par don gyi bya ba mdzad pa yin te /
translated: He acts for their benefit in accordance with his appearance in that and that place.

original: des na thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can chos kyi sku la bzhugs pas thams cad du yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar nye bar gnas kyang rang gi las kyi nyes pas bskyed pa la rgyu ma tshang bas 'bras bu smin par mdzad par mi snang
analyzed: des na thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can chos kyi sku la bzhugs pas thams cad du yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar nye bar gnas kyang rang gi las kyi nyes pas bskyed pa la rgyu ma tshang bas 'bras bu smin par mdzad par mi snang
translated: Therefore, the Buddha, who has the nature of great compassion, abiding in the dharmakaya, is like a wish fulfilling jewel present everywhere, but due to the fault of his own karma, the cause is incomplete and the result does not appear to be produced.

original: ngo snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: de bas na dper na lha'i rgyal pos char phab tu zin kyang til la sogs pa'i sa bon rul pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa sa bon du mi rung bar gyur pa mi skye ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas 'gro ba mtha' dag gi yid la re ba
analyzed: de bas na dper na lha'i rgyal pos char phab tu zin kyang til la sogs pa'i sa bon rul pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa sa bon du mi rung bar gyur pa mi skye ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas 'gro ba mtha' dag gi yid la re ba
translated: Therefore, just as when the king of gods sends down rain, seeds such as sesame do not grow if their nature is rotten, and so forth, in the same way, even though the buddhas are skilled in fulfilling the wishes of all migrating beings, those who lack good fortune will not obtain the good fortune of listening to the sublime Dharma and so forth.

original: yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la mkhas pa rnams 'byung yang skal ba med pas dam pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa bzang po thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la mkhas pa rnams 'byung yang skal ba med pas dam pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa bzang po thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur nas //
analyzed: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur nas //
translated: When the cause is fully ripened,

original: gang dang gang la gang dang ni //🔽gang tshe bya ba phan gyur ba //
analyzed: gang dang gang la gang dang ni // gang tshe bya ba phan gyur ba //
translated: whatever, wherever,🔽whenever, and however

original: de dang de la der snang ngo //
analyzed: de dang de la der snang ngo //
translated: it is beneficial, that appears there.

original: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
analyzed: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
translated: Even though the king of gods sends down rain,

original: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
analyzed: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
translated: unsuitable seeds do not grow.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang //🔽skal ba med pas bzang mi myong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang // skal ba med pas bzang mi myong //
translated: Even though the buddhas appear,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: those without good fortune do not experience the good.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad du snang ba'i sgo nas don gyi mdzad pa rgya che ba'i phyir dang / rgyun chags su 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs kyang bcom ldan 'das la zad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas khyab pa dang rtag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad du snang ba'i sgo nas don gyi mdzad pa rgya che ba'i phyir dang / rgyun chags su 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs kyang bcom ldan 'das la zad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas khyab pa dang rtag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, because the deeds for the sake of all beings are extensive in every way by means of the appearances as explained above, and because the Bhagavat remains for as long as cyclic existence is not empty, and because he is not exhausted, he is said to be pervasive and permanent, respectively.

original: de bas na ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku rnal 'byor pa so sor nges pa'i rgyud kyi rten la yod pa skad cig ma re re la 'byung ba ji ltar khyab pa dang rtag pa zhes bya zhes kyang bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku rnal 'byor pa so sor nges pa'i rgyud kyi rten la yod pa skad cig ma re re la 'byung ba ji ltar khyab pa dang rtag pa zhes bya zhes kyang bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not think that the body of gnosis, which is the basis of the tantra of individual yoga, which arises in every moment, is pervasive and permanent.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de ltar mdzad pa rgya che'i phyir //

translated: the uninterrupted emanation body of the Bhagavan, which is common to all ordinary beings.

analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: gang gi srid pa ji srid par //

analyzed: thub pa'i sprul sku rgyun mi 'chad //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //

translated: First, by the activity of pacifying going, which has the characteristic of non-abiding, due to manifest attachment to good and bad migrations,

analyzed: po bzhi la bkod de / thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dor ba dang blang bar bya ba'i sgo nas rtogs par mdzad nas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du rjes su chags pa la sogs pas rnam par dben pa nyid kyis sems can gyi
translated: he establishes them in the four means of gathering, such as generosity.🔽Then, by the knowledge arisen from hearing and so on, he causes them to realize the abandonment and adoption of the opposing side and the antidote.

original: don de gzhan gyi don byas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i bdag nyid la bkod de /
analyzed: don de gzhan gyi don byas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i bdag nyid la bkod de /
translated: Then, like a magician, he establishes them in the meaning of sentient beings, which is the nature of the characteristics of benefit for others and so on, by means of the emptiness that is the absence of attachment and so on.

original: de'i rjes la rang gi don 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug goms pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rang gi don 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug goms pa la'o //
translated: After that, he establishes them in the practice of the six perfections, which are distinguished by the purity of the three spheres.

original: de'i 'og tu rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi lam ste dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi lam ste dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la'o //
translated: Then, in the path of the ten virtuous actions, which is the path to buddhahood, the characteristic of one’s own and others’ aims.

original: de nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid goms pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid goms pa la'o //
translated: Then, in the cultivation of the emptiness of inherent existence of all phenomena.

original: de'i rjes la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa dang po chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa'i chos la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa dang po chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa'i chos la'o //
translated: Then, in the nondualistic Dharma, the characteristic of the realization of the all-pervading expanse of reality on the first ground, based on the perfection of generosity.

original: de nas tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas gnyis pa la sogs par tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i shes pa la 'god do //
analyzed: de nas tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas gnyis pa la sogs par tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i shes pa la 'god do //
translated: Then, in the cognition of the conventional, which is the cause for the completion of the accumulations, in all the dharmas of the perfections such as ethics on the second ground and so on.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa drug pa shes pa dang shes bya'i dngos por mngon par ma zhen pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad dmigs su med pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa drug pa shes pa dang shes bya'i dngos por mngon par ma zhen pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad dmigs su med pa la'o //
translated: Similarly, in order, based on the perfection of wisdom, in the nonapprehension of all phenomena, the characteristic of nonattachment to the things that are the objects and subjects of cognition on the sixth ground.

original: de'i 'og tu sa bdun pa la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa bdun pa la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la'o //
translated: Then, on the seventh ground, they are brought to full maturity by the power of the perfection of means.

original: de nas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la'o //

translated: Then, on the eighth ground, they are brought to the bodhisattva path that is not held in common with the listeners and solitary realizers by the power of the perfection of strength.

original: de nas yang de nyid la chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa la'o //🔽de'i rjes las dgu pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus byang chub 'thob pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas yang de nyid la chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa la'o // de'i rjes las dgu pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus byang chub 'thob pa la'o //
translated: Then, on the same path, they are brought to the elimination of clinging to all phenomena.🔽After that, on the ninth ground, they are brought to the attainment of enlightenment by the power of the perfection of aspiration.

original: de'i 'og tu ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa bcu pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnam par dag pa la bkod nas yang de nyid la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag pa'i byang chub tu so
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa bcu pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnam par dag pa la bkod nas yang de nyid la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag pa'i byang chub tu so
translated: Then, on the tenth ground, they are brought to the essence of enlightenment by the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sor nges ba dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi don dang / 'jig @323b rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi drung du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i yon tan la bkod de /

translated: The qualities of the path of meditation are the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha.

original: de lta bu'i rim pa yang de nyid la khyad par gyi lam gyi rang gi ngo bo byang chub mtha' dag 'dren par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi yan lag dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa chud mi za ba dang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pa yang de nyid la khyad par gyi lam gyi rang gi ngo bo byang chub mtha' dag 'dren par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi yan lag dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa chud mi za ba dang /
translated: The stages of the path of meditation are the nature of the path of meditation itself, which is the characteristics of the phenomena that induce all the aspects of enlightenment, the nonexpiration of karma and its result,

original: dngos po thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa dang / phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa dang / phyin ci log gi gzhi med pa spangs pa'i ye shes dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par byang ba dang dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i tshogs dang /

translated: It is the wisdom that realizes all things as they are, that abandons all errors, and that abandons the basis of error. It is the purity of the bodhisattva, which is characterized by natural purity, and the accumulation of causes for the purity that is free from all stains.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha mi dad par yongs su shes pa la bkod nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la mya ngan las 'da' ba la 'god par mdzad pa yin no //

translated: Having established them in the understanding that the conditioned and the unconditioned are not different due to the nature of emptiness, they are established in nirvāṇa on the level of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i sku la sogs par snang ba bskyed pa'i sgo nas don bya ba byed pas na de'i bdag po las gdul bya'i skye bo'i snang ba la brten pa 'di las rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun chos kyi

analyzed: ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyod spobs par byos shig ces bya ba nas brtsams te yum 'di'i spyi dang yan lag gi don legs par ma

translated: The explanation that has been done by the expression of connection is one that should be understood only by the holy ones. Therefore, I have not made a joke of refutation here.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las rjes su rig par bya ba'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /

original: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sngon gyi sbyor ba'i gtam gyi sgo nas las dang po pa'i gnas skabs nas brtsams te tshol ba'i rim pa ston pa
analyzed: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rang bzhin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sngon gyi sbyor ba'i gtam gyi sgo nas las dang po pa'i gnas skabs nas brtsams te tshol ba'i rim pa ston pa
translated: In order to realize the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the eight realizations as they have been explained, the chapter on the previous application teaches the stages of investigation, beginning from the stage of the beginner.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du ni byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blangs pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bsags pa dang ldan pa yin te sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa spong ba don du gnyer ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshogs kyi sa la gnas pa yin pas de gong nas gong du nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la sogs pa'i gdams ngag tshol ba la brtson pa yin par mngon la da ltar ni sa
translated: At that time, he is on the stage of accumulation, and it is clear that he is striving to seek the instructions on the branches of penetration and so forth.

original: bcu @324b pa'i dbang phyug nyid yin no //🔽lus la ched cher mi byed ces bya ba ni rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa sbyin par sems pa'i phyir ro //

translated: He is the lord of the tenth stage.🔽He does not value the body means that he thinks of giving away his bones, marrow and so forth.

analyzed: srog la mi lta zhes bya ba ni snying sbyin par spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not care for his life means that he is enthusiastic about giving away his heart.

analyzed: tshogs kyi sa la dang por /

analyzed: de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni // sangs rgyas rnams las zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
translated: at that time, from the buddhas,🔽in order to attain vast serenity

original: gdams ngag rgya chen thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: gdams ngag rgya chen thob par 'gyur //
translated: and wisdom, one receives extensive instructions.

translated: “Not to the left” means not to the left side.

original: shar du ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi char ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shar du ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi char ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not to the east” and so on means not in the eastern or other directions.

original: ci nas bdag las ma g-yos shing 'jig tshogs las kyang ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci nas bdag las ma g-yos shing 'jig tshogs las kyang ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order that you may not waver from the self, and also not from the perishing collection, etc.

original: bdag la sogs pa mi snang ba rnams ni yod pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa mi snang ba rnams ni yod pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self, etc., which do not appear, are not understood as existent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i lam du gnas pa bdag med pa rnams ni med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ci nas de rnams las ma g-yos pa de ltar song shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i lam du gnas pa bdag med pa rnams ni med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ci nas de rnams las ma g-yos pa de ltar song shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The selflessnesses which are present on the path of seeing of form, etc., are understood as nonexistent. In order that you may not waver from them, go in that way.

original: nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: To say you will be lost means you will turn back.🔽All of this, which is indicated by the word etc., is a hindrance to samadhi, and it produces physical fatigue, etc. By stopping all of that, it is said of samadhi that it is endowed with ease.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gags byed pa lus kyi ngal du ba la sogs pa bskyed pa 'gog pa 'di thams cad kyis ni nye bar mtshon pa'i sgo nas 'di skad du ting nge 'dzin nyid thams cad la le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gags byed pa lus kyi ngal du ba la sogs pa bskyed pa 'gog pa 'di thams cad kyis ni nye bar mtshon pa'i sgo nas 'di skad du ting nge 'dzin nyid thams cad la le lo dang / dmigs pa brjed pa dang //
translated: Laziness, forgetting the object of meditation,

original: zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / de bzhin du mi rtsol ba dang / yang rtsol ba zhes bya ba nyes pa drug po rnams kyi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed cing shar phyogs su song shig / de ltar na de thos par 'gyur
analyzed: zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang / de bzhin du mi rtsol ba dang / yang rtsol ba zhes bya ba nyes pa drug po rnams kyi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed cing shar phyogs su song shig / de ltar na de thos par 'gyur
translated: In that way, you will hear it.”

original: ro zhes gdams ngag byin pa yin te /
analyzed: ro zhes gdams ngag byin pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the instruction is given.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan la mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pas rnal 'byor pa'i 'dun pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan la mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pas rnal 'byor pa'i 'dun pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the yearning of the yogi arises through faith that is a conviction in the good qualities of concentration.

original: de nas 'dug pa'i stobs kyis brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: de nas 'dug pa'i stobs kyis brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Then, through the power of sitting, he exerts effort.

original: de nas @325a * //
analyzed: de nas @325a * //
translated: Then,

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed do //
translated: through the power of effort, he generates physical and mental pliancy.

original: de nas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba las le lo ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs ba las le lo ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, from physical and mental pliancy, laziness is reversed.

original: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa bzhi ni le lo spong ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa la sogs pa bzhi ni le lo spong ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the four beginning with faith are for the purpose of abandoning laziness.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po yin te des dmigs pa la yang dag par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po yin te des dmigs pa la yang dag par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mindfulness is the antidote to forgetting the object of meditation, because it correctly places the mind on the object.

original: shes bzhin ni zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Alertness is the antidote to laxity and excitement.

original: des rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pas ni bying ba spong la /
analyzed: des rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yid la byed pas ni bying ba spong la /
translated: By means of it, one abandons laxity through attention to the virtues of the Buddha and so on, which is the basis of joy.

original: skyo ba'i dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas ni rgod pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba'i dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas ni rgod pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And one abandons excitement through attention to impermanence and so on, which is the basis of disenchantment.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa rab tu ma zhi ba'i dus su ni mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin pas de'i gnyen por sems pa la goms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa rab tu ma zhi ba'i dus su ni mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin pas de'i gnyen por sems pa la goms par byed pa yin no //
translated: When laxity and excitement are not completely pacified, nonexertion is a fault. Therefore, one should cultivate attention as the antidote to that.

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa zhi bar gyur nas gang gi tshe sems dmigs pa las mi g-yo zhing mngon par 'du byed pa med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang rtsol ba nyes pa yin te //
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa zhi bar gyur nas gang gi tshe sems dmigs pa las mi g-yo zhing mngon par 'du byed pa med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang rtsol ba nyes pa yin te //
translated: When the mind is no longer distracted from its object and proceeds of its own accord without the application of effort, then effort is a fault.

original: des sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the mind to be distracted.

original: des na de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that equanimity should be cultivated as the antidote to that.

original: gdams ngag yang dag par thob pas na khas blangs pa'i don du de bzhin du bya'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: gdams ngag yang dag par thob pas na khas blangs pa'i don du de bzhin du bya'o zhes smras so //
translated: Since he has received the right instruction, he says, “I will do just as you have said” for the sake of the promise.

original: khas len 'di ni rigs pa dang ni ldan pa nyid yin no snyom pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: khas len 'di ni rigs pa dang ni ldan pa nyid yin no snyom pa'i dogs pa de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: This promise is reasonable.

original: nga ni sems can thams cad snang bar byed 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba smras te go sla'o //
analyzed: nga ni sems can thams cad snang bar byed 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba smras te go sla'o //
translated: Why is that? He says, “Because I want to illuminate all beings.” This is easy to understand.

original: gnag zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas rjes su bstan nas chos la bdag med pa'i sgo nas rjes su sten par byed pa ni rtag tu ngus sgra thos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gnag zag la bdag med pa'i sgo nas rjes su bstan nas chos la bdag med pa'i sgo nas rjes su sten par byed pa ni rtag tu ngus sgra thos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Having instructed them in selflessness with regard to the perishable composite, he instructs them in selflessness with regard to phenomena, as stated in the passage beginning “Sadaprarudita heard a voice in the sky.”🔽For the sake of thorough knowledge,

original: yongs su shes dang spong ba dang // mngon sum du ni bya ba'i phyir //🔽stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin gyi //
analyzed: yongs su shes dang spong ba dang // mngon sum du ni bya ba'i phyir // stong nyid la sogs ting 'dzin gyi //
translated: abandonment, and realization,🔽the three kinds of meaning of the concentrations

original: don rnam gsum du yongs su bsgrags //
analyzed: don rnam gsum du yongs su bsgrags //
translated: on emptiness and so on are proclaimed.

original: zhes gsungs pas rnam pa gang gis so sor snang ba bum pa la sog pa'i brtag pa de yongs su shes rab bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas rnam pa gang gis so sor snang ba bum pa la sog pa'i brtag pa de yongs su shes rab bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the concentration on emptiness is taught for the sake of thoroughly knowing the appearance of the individual aspects of the imputations of pot and so on.

original: brtags pa ni nog bo nyid yongs su shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: brtags pa ni nog bo nyid yongs su shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: The thorough knowledge of the imputed is the thorough knowledge of the nature of the imputed,

original: 'khrul pa tsam yin pas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam yin pas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a mere error and does not exist.

original: chos thams cad mngon par zhen pas dben pa sgyu @325b ma lta bu'i ye shes mngon sum du bya ba'i don du mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par zhen pas dben pa sgyu @325b ma lta bu'i ye shes mngon sum du bya ba'i don du mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de /
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is for the sake of directly realizing the wisdom that is like an illusion, which is devoid of manifest clinging to all phenomena.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i kun rdzob tu yang dag pa'i rnag bzhin can yongs su grub pa ni rtogs par bya'i ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i kun rdzob tu yang dag pa'i rnag bzhin can yongs su grub pa ni rtogs par bya'i ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of the realization of the perfected nature, which has the nature of reality, even in the relative of yogins.

original: chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i gzhan gyi dbang spang bar bya ba'i don du smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log tu 'byung ba nyid kyis na spang par bya ba nyid🔽yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i gzhan gyi dbang spang bar bya ba'i don du smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log tu 'byung ba nyid kyis na spang par bya ba nyid🔽yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration of signlessness is for the sake of abandoning the dependent nature that is manifest clinging to phenomena and persons. Clinging to apprehended objects and apprehending subjects is to be abandoned because it arises in an erroneous way.

original: kha cig ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa bskyed pa'i dus su sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar spyad par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i don du mtshan ma yongs su spang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig
analyzed: kha cig ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa bskyed pa'i dus su sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar spyad par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i don du mtshan ma yongs su spang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig
translated: Some say that the words “abandoning the signs” and so on are taught for the purpose of demonstrating that at the time of generating the knowledge that is the nature of hearing, contemplating, and meditating, one should practice like an illusory person.🔽🔽

original: gsum smos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gsum smos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The three phrases beginning with “completely abandoning signs” are stated for the purpose of teaching that one should practice like an illusory person at the time of generating the wisdoms of hearing, contemplation and meditation.

original: gzhan dag ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang mjug gi gnas skabs yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that they refer to the states of preparation, actual basis and conclusion of the concentration of emptiness and so on.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid kyi don du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang stong ba nyid dang zhe bya ba la sog pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid kyi don du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang stong ba nyid dang zhe bya ba la sog pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “a spiritual master who teaches emptiness” and so on is stated for the purpose of the meaning of the characteristics of a spiritual master.

original: de la tshogs kyis la bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid can nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du ma byung ba dang /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyis la bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid can nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du ma byung ba dang /
translated: In this regard, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are taught in order to generate the accumulation of merit, and the factors conducive to penetration, which have the nature of the accumulation of wisdom, are generated in order to generate the stage of action in faith.

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / dngos po med pa chos ston pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / dngos po med pa chos ston pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In due order, they are the non-arising, non-production, non-cessation, and non-existence of those.

original: yongs su rtogs la zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtsis la'o//🔽chos 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi dgos pa mthong bas so //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs la zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtsis la'o// chos 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i chos kyi dgos pa mthong bas so //
translated: Having fully considered means having fully examined.🔽Having seen the future purpose of the Dharma, one wishes for the Dharma.

original: chos la gus par bya bas zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'byung ba'i phan yon te nye bar dmigs pas so //
analyzed: chos la gus par bya bas zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'byung ba'i phan yon te nye bar dmigs pas so //
translated: Having seen the present benefit, one respects the Dharma by observing it.

original: 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags bud med drug khri brgyad stong dang lhan cig 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan par mthong ba na sems rnam par gzhan du mi bya'o zhes brjod pa ni rigs kyi bu khyod kyis bdud kyi las rnams kyang rtogs par
analyzed: 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags bud med drug khri brgyad stong dang lhan cig 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan par mthong ba na sems rnam par gzhan du mi bya'o zhes brjod pa ni rigs kyi bu khyod kyis bdud kyi las rnams kyang rtogs par
translated: When you see the noble bodhisattva Dharmodgata together with sixty-eight thousand women enjoying the five sense objects, do not let your mind be otherwise.🔽 🔽Son of noble family, you should also recognize the deeds of Mara.

original: bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning Noble one, you should also recognize the deeds of Mara, refers to the statement When you see the bodhisattva Dharmodgata together with 68,000 women enjoying the five sense objects, do not let your mind be otherwise.

original: de dag de sa zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang du gyur pa nyid med pas zil gyis mnan pa'o //🔽thabs la mkhas @326a * //
analyzed: de dag de sa zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang du gyur pa nyid med pas zil gyis mnan pa'o // thabs la mkhas @326a * //
translated: Having surpassed them, means that since they are not under his power, he has surpassed them.

original: pa nyid bstan pa ni 'di ni sems can gdul ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid bstan pa ni 'di ni sems can gdul ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching on skill in means is stated in the passage beginning This is the method for training sentient beings, and so on.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan nas don dam pa'i bden ba la brten pa ni skad cig ma de nyid la rigs kya bu khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pa bstan nas don dam pa'i bden ba la brten pa ni skad cig ma de nyid la rigs kya bu khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Having taught skill in means based on conventional truth, based on ultimate truth, he says Noble son, in that very instant, and so on.

original: skad cig ma de nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rtse bar byed pa mthong ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rtse bar byed pa mthong ba'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: In that very instant means immediately after seeing the one who is playing with the five sense objects.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas chos thams cad ni zhes bya bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas chos thams cad ni zhes bya bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, in order to respond to the doubt Why is that? it is said All phenomena... and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Empty of essence means not arisen in reality.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams bdag med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni sems can med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig lnga smos pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams bdag med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni sems can med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig lnga smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach that the five aggregates such as form are selfless, the five phrases beginning with All phenomena are devoid of sentient beings are stated.

original: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlas te bstan pa'i dgos pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzlas te bstan pa'i dgos pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The purpose of the repetition beginning with Like an illusion... has been explained earlier.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa chos 'phags lo bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs par shes nas brtson 'grus lhod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa chos 'phags lo bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs par shes nas brtson 'grus lhod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva noble Dharmodgata, knowing that he had entered into one meditative absorption for seven years, did not relax his effort.

original: phyir bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: phyir bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa nyid du'o //
translated: The statement “for the sake of the dedication” is for the sake of countering.

original: bdag gi sgra de la ji srid du 'gro bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyis la /
analyzed: bdag gi sgra de la ji srid du 'gro bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyis la /
translated: The word “self” in the phrase “for as long as he goes” refers to the collection.

original: bsam gtan la thob mngon bar shes //
analyzed: bsam gtan la thob mngon bar shes //
translated: The concentrations are the bases of supernatural powers.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas de /🔽sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas de / sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
translated: They are supernatural powers because of their accomplishment.🔽For the sake of making offerings to the innumerable buddhas

original: mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyam pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyam pa'i phyir //
translated: and for the sake of equality,

original: 'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro //🔽'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro // 'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la //
translated: he goes to the various world systems.🔽By this, for innumerable eons,

original: bskal dpag med 'gyur bsnyen bkur byas //
analyzed: bskal dpag med 'gyur bsnyen bkur byas //
translated: he serves the innumerable buddhas.

original: de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of his service to them,

original: sems ni las rung mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni las rung mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: his mind becomes supremely fit.

original: zhes bshad pas mngon par shes pa yod du zin na yang 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi rnam par thar pa mthong ba'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / de yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pa phul du phyin pa la 'phags pa chos 'phags nyid kyis byin byis brlabs pa'i phyir 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi rnam par thar pa las byung ba'i spos dang ldan pa'i grong khyer ma mthong bas bdag gi sgra
analyzed: zhes bshad pas mngon par shes pa yod du zin na yang 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi rnam par thar pa mthong ba'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / de yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs la mkhas pa phul du phyin pa la 'phags pa chos 'phags nyid kyis byin byis brlabs pa'i phyir 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi rnam par thar pa las byung ba'i spos dang ldan pa'i grong khyer ma mthong bas bdag gi sgra
translated: And he did not see the city of Gandhavati that arose from the life of Dharmodgata because he had not yet developed the method of ripening the roots of virtue of beings.

original: de la ji srid @326b du 'gro bar bya ba ma dris so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la ji srid @326b du 'gro bar bya ba ma dris so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He did not ask how far he should go, meaning that he did not ask how far he should go to see the city of Gandhavati.

original: de la kha cig na re du ba ni sgra gsang mthon pos so //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re du ba ni sgra gsang mthon pos so //
translated: Some say: The smoke was from a loud sound.

original: cho nges 'debs pa ni de las bzlog pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cho nges 'debs pa ni de las bzlog pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: The wailing was from the opposite of that.

original: gzhan dag du ba ni mchi ma 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag du ba ni mchi ma 'byin pa'o //
translated: Others say: The smoke was from tears.

original: cho nges 'debs pa ni de nyid sgra dang bcas pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: cho nges 'debs pa ni de nyid sgra dang bcas pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: The wailing was from that itself with sound.

original: mya ngan byed pa ni sems kyi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan byed pa ni sems kyi gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is the torment of the mind.

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni kyi hud re sdug bslus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig go //🔽sngar bshad pa'i chos dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i gdams ngag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa shin tu brtsams pa las tshogs kyis nyid du sems las su rung bar gyur ba na gang zhig thob pas tshig dang don 'dzin
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni kyi hud re sdug bslus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig go // sngar bshad pa'i chos dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i gdams ngag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa shin tu brtsams pa las tshogs kyis nyid du sems las su rung bar gyur ba na gang zhig thob pas tshig dang don 'dzin
translated: Lamentation is the words “Alas, how miserable! I have been deceived!”

original: par nus par 'gyur ba chos kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob la /
analyzed: par nus par 'gyur ba chos kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob la /
translated: The instruction in the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which was explained earlier, and the attention of the perfection of wisdom are well begun. When the mind becomes fit for the collection, one obtains the concentration called “stream of Dharma,” by obtaining which one is able to retain the words and their meaning.🔽When one obtains that concentration, in order to increase concentration and wisdom, one obtains instruction from the Buddhas.

original: ting nge 'dzin de thob pa na ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i don du sangs rgyas rnams la gdams ngag 'thob po zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du zhes bya🔽ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de thob pa na ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i don du sangs rgyas rnams la gdams ngag 'thob po zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du zhes bya🔽ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhuti, then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita…”

original: de ltar gdung zhing zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par 'dod pas yang dag par skye zhing ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gdung zhing zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par 'dod pas yang dag par skye zhing ngo //
translated: Thus, with such longing means with such desire, with such aspiration.

original: go cha dang dge ba dang sems can gyi dbye bas brtson 'grus 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smras pa yin no //
analyzed: go cha dang dge ba dang sems can gyi dbye bas brtson 'grus 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smras pa yin no //
translated: With three phrases beginning this effort, he speaks of the classification of armor, virtue, and sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa 'di lta bus zhes bya ba ni thob par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di lta bus zhes bya ba ni thob par 'dod pas so //
translated: With such desire means with the desire to attain.

original: rjes su 'brang zhing zhes bya ba ni bar du dor ba med pas rjes su 'brang bar gyis la'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang zhing zhes bya ba ni bar du dor ba med pas rjes su 'brang bar gyis la'o //
translated: Follow means follow without interruption.

original: de la nang gi nor rnams yod pas na 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi nor rnams yod pas na 'byor pa'o //
translated: Among those, prosperous means having internal wealth.

original: phyi'i nor rnams yod pas na rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i nor rnams yod pas na rgyas pa'o //
translated: Flourishing means having external wealth.

original: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyi 'tshe ba la sogs pa dang bral bas na bde ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyi 'tshe ba la sogs pa dang bral bas na bde ba'o //
translated: Happy means free from harm by enemy armies, and so on.

original: 'bru la sogs pa mang bas na lo legs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa mang bas na lo legs pa'o //
translated: Good harvest means abundant grain, and so on.

original: rta dang glang po la sogs pa dang mi mang bas na skye bo mang po dang mis gang ba'o //
analyzed: rta dang glang po la sogs pa dang mi mang bas na skye bo mang po dang mis gang ba'o //
translated: Full of people means full of many horses, elephants, and so on, and people.

original: bar bar gyi tshong khang gi bring ba ni tshong khang sgrigs pa'o //🔽mtha' gcig nas brtsams te pha rol gyi mthar thug par sang bas na phigs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bar bar gyi tshong khang gi bring ba ni tshong khang sgrigs pa'o // mtha' gcig nas brtsams te pha rol gyi mthar thug par sang bas na phigs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The shops are the rows of shops.🔽It is called a market because it is crowded with people who come from all directions.

original: mnyam zhing mnyam la zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re tshad mnyam yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mnyam zhing mnyam la zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re tshad mnyam yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is called even because it is equal, some say it is equal in size.

original: gzhan dag na re bzlas nas lan gnyis brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bzlas nas lan gnyis brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say it is equal in that it is repeated twice.

original: skye bo dang khyogs kyi bzhon pa dang rkang gis 'gro ba'i gnas mdzer dog med par @327a * //
analyzed: skye bo dang khyogs kyi bzhon pa dang rkang gis 'gro ba'i gnas mdzer dog med par @327a * //
translated: It is a place for people, vehicles, and pedestrians.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a place where people gather.

original: de la skye bo bzhon pa'i gnas ni glang po dang rta la sogs pa'i bzhon pa'i gnas su khyogs kyi bzhon pa'i gnas ni shi bi ka la sogs pa'i khyogs kyi bzhon pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: de la skye bo bzhon pa'i gnas ni glang po dang rta la sogs pa'i bzhon pa'i gnas su khyogs kyi bzhon pa'i gnas ni shi bi ka la sogs pa'i khyogs kyi bzhon pa'i gnas so //
translated: There, the place for people is the place for elephants, horses, and so on. The place for vehicles is the place for palanquins, etc.

original: rkang gis 'gro ba'i gnas ni rkang gnyis pas 'gro ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: rkang gis 'gro ba'i gnas ni rkang gnyis pas 'gro ba'i gnas so //
translated: The place for pedestrians is the place for those who go on foot.

original: bar gyi tshong khang gi phreng ba lnga brgya po gang dag la skye bo dang khyogs kyi bzhon pa dang rkang gis 'gro ba'i gnas mdzer dog med par gnas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /🔽des na de dag gi legs par bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: bar gyi tshong khang gi phreng ba lnga brgya po gang dag la skye bo dang khyogs kyi bzhon pa dang rkang gis 'gro ba'i gnas mdzer dog med par gnas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste / des na de dag gi legs par bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: The five hundred rows of shops are called the “well-constructed” because they are well-arranged and not crowded with people, palanquins, vehicles, and pedestrians.

original: rdzogs par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mda' yab rnams zhes bya ba ni mgo bo'i dbyibs can gyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to // mda' yab rnams zhes bya ba ni mgo bo'i dbyibs can gyi phreng ba'o //
translated: “Well-constructed” means “well-completed.”🔽The “railing” is a row shaped like a head.

original: g-yer ka'i dra ba zhes bya ba ni dril bu chung ngu'i tshogs kyis so //🔽de la mdzes pa nyid yin pas na 'jam zhing ngo //
analyzed: g-yer ka'i dra ba zhes bya ba ni dril bu chung ngu'i tshogs kyis so // de la mdzes pa nyid yin pas na 'jam zhing ngo //
translated: The “network of small bells” is a collection of small bells.🔽It is “smooth” because it is beautiful.

original: snying la 'bab pa nyid yin pas snyan pa'o //
analyzed: snying la 'bab pa nyid yin pas snyan pa'o //
translated: It is “pleasing” because it is delightful.

original: dga' bar byed pa nyid yin pas na yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa nyid yin pas na yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is “attractive” because it is charming.

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i rol mo zhes bya ba ni pi wang dang gling bu la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rol mo'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i rol mo zhes bya ba ni pi wang dang gling bu la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rol mo'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Music with five types of instruments” is a special kind of music with stringed instruments such as the lute and flute, and so on.

original: chu rjes su mthun par 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni chu g-yas phyogs su bskor bas 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: chu rjes su mthun par 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni chu g-yas phyogs su bskor bas 'bab pa'o //
translated: Flowing in harmony with the water means flowing to the right.

original: autpala dang ku mud dang / punda r'i ka dang / gzhan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba na dri bzangs dang tsan dan dang autpala sogs pas so //
analyzed: autpala dang ku mud dang / punda r'i ka dang / gzhan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba na dri bzangs dang tsan dan dang autpala sogs pas so //
translated: With lotuses, water lilies, and white lotuses, and with other fragrances, sandalwood, and utpala flowers.

original: chu zheng du shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam ste zhes bya ba la chu zheng du 'khor yug dag tu'o //
analyzed: chu zheng du shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam ste zhes bya ba la chu zheng du 'khor yug dag tu'o //
translated: The size of a chariot wheel means the size of a chariot wheel in width and breadth.
