original: sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la sngon po zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la sngon po zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: As for blue and so on, blue is the brief teaching.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i mdog sngon po dang ldan pas kha dog sngon po'o //🔽bcos pa'i sngon po nyid yin pas sngon por ston pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i mdog sngon po dang ldan pas kha dog sngon po'o // bcos pa'i sngon po nyid yin pas sngon por ston pa'o //
translated: Having a naturally blue color, it is blue in color.🔽 Being an artificial blue, it is blue-appearing.

original: gnyi gar rab tu gsal bar snang bas sngon po'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar rab tu gsal bar snang bas sngon po'o //
translated: Being both very clear and blue, it is blue.

original: ser po la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for yellow and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The way of the Buddha is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gus par byed pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la gus par byed pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the respect for that.

original: de rjes su 'gro ba ni de dang ldan pa ste thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa legs par rtogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de rjes su 'gro ba ni de dang ldan pa ste thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa legs par rtogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The one who is endowed with that is the one who is accompanied by that, and the one who has well understood the knowledge that has the nature of hearing and reflection is so called.

original: de rnams kyi sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las grub pa zhes phyi ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las grub pa zhes phyi ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “due to the ripening of their previous karma” is connected to the latter.

original: grong khyer spos dang ldan pa de dag gi dbus kyi zhes bya ba ni grong khyer dang ldan pas mngon par @327b mtshon pa'i gnas kyi bzhi mdo'i dbus na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: grong khyer spos dang ldan pa de dag gi dbus kyi zhes bya ba ni grong khyer dang ldan pas mngon par @327b mtshon pa'i gnas kyi bzhi mdo'i dbus na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in the middle of the city of Gandhavatī” is connected to the phrase “in the middle of the crossroads in the center of the city.”

original: longs spyod chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas longs spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas longs spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: The three phrases “enjoyment,” etc., refer to the divisions of lesser, middling, and greater enjoyment.

original: karka ta na'i rang bzhin la zhes bya ba ni karka ta na ni aindra n'i la'o //
analyzed: karka ta na'i rang bzhin la zhes bya ba ni karka ta na ni aindra n'i la'o //
translated: The phrase “the nature of a lion” means that a lion is Indra.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bde ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bde ba skyed pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the five sense pleasures” means that it produces physical pleasure.

original: dbang du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sems la yid bde ba yang dag par skyed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sems la yid bde ba yang dag par skyed pa'o //
translated: “They come under one’s control” means that it produces mental pleasure.🔽In this way,

original: 'di ltar / bdag yod na ni gzhan du 'du shes shing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag yod na ni gzhan du 'du shes shing //
translated: When there is a self, there is the notion of other.🔽From the standpoint of self and other comes grasping and hatred.

original: bdag gzhan cha las yongs su 'dzin dang sdang // 'di gnyis dang ni kun tu 'brel pa las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan cha las yongs su 'dzin dang sdang // 'di gnyis dang ni kun tu 'brel pa las //
translated: From being completely bound by these two

original: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: all faults come into being.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di thams cad sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'di thams cad sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: In this way, all of these afflictions, such as attachment, become the cause of the suffering of karmic ripening, because they are preceded by the manifest clinging to “I” and “mine.”

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir sems can gdul ba'i phyir bsam pa'i khyad par gyis sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar 'dod pa la yongs su spyod pa'i rgyal ba'i sras po rnams la ni nyes par 'gyur ba ma
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa la dbang thob pa'i phyir sems can gdul ba'i phyir bsam pa'i khyad par gyis sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar 'dod pa la yongs su spyod pa'i rgyal ba'i sras po rnams la ni nyes par 'gyur ba ma
translated: Because they have attained mastery over afflictions through meditating on all phenomena as illusionlike, the bodhisattvas who enjoy sense objects like an illusory person due to their special intention in order to tame sentient beings are not affected by faults.

original: yin no // de bzhin du /
analyzed: yin no // de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas ni //
translated: the bodhisattva who is a householder

original: skye ba kun tu rtag par yang //
analyzed: skye ba kun tu rtag par yang //
translated: will always, in all his lives,

original: 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas ni //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas ni //
translated: become a universal monarch

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: thabs chen po dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: thabs chen po dang ldan pa la //
translated: For those who possess great means,🔽samsara has the nature of peace

original: 'khor ba zhi ba'i bdag nyid dang // nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhi ba'i bdag nyid dang // nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //
translated: and afflictions become the branches of enlightenment.

original: de phyir rgyal sras bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal sras bsam mi khyab //
translated: Therefore, the buddhas' heirs are inconceivable.

original: ces bshad pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gdul ba'i thabs su 'dod pa la yongs su longs spyod par ston pa la nyes pa med /
analyzed: ces bshad pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gdul ba'i thabs su 'dod pa la yongs su longs spyod par ston pa la nyes pa med /
translated: Thus, there is no fault in teaching that bodhisattvas enjoy sense objects as a means to tame sentient beings.

original: sdom pa bzung ba nyid kyis 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa bzung ba nyid kyis 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who indulges in sense objects by merely taking the vow would be degenerate.

original: shing bal bting pa zhes bya ba la shing bal ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: shing bal bting pa zhes bya ba la shing bal ni go bar zad do //
translated: Spread with cotton is clear.

original: stan bar tshangs can ni la ba'i rigs khyad par can no //
analyzed: stan bar tshangs can ni la ba'i rigs khyad par can no //
translated: A mattress is a special type of cloth.

original: snying po can ni stan nang tshangs can zlum po'o //
analyzed: snying po can ni stan nang tshangs can zlum po'o //
translated: With a core is a round mattress.

original: gos kyi bla re zhes bya ba ni gos las byas pa'i bla re'o //
analyzed: gos kyi bla re zhes bya ba ni gos las byas pa'i bla re'o //
translated: A canopy of cloth is a canopy made of cloth.

original: yod pa nyid yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang nus pa yid ches pa dang dad pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa bstan pa'i don du @328a * //
analyzed: yod pa nyid yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang nus pa yid ches pa dang dad pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa bstan pa'i don du @328a * //
translated: In order to teach faith that has the aspects of existence, possession of good qualities, ability, confidence, and longing,

original: chos rnams la brten pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams la brten pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: he says in the Dharma and so on, with three phrases.

original: rgyun ma chad par zhes bya ba ni bar ma chad par ro //
analyzed: rgyun ma chad par zhes bya ba ni bar ma chad par ro //
translated: Without interruption means without a break.

original: yun ring por don du gnyer ba'i don thob pa'i thabs thob pas bde ba chung du dang 'bring dang chen po thob pas go rims bzhin du dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig drug smos pa yin no //
analyzed: yun ring por don du gnyer ba'i don thob pa'i thabs thob pas bde ba chung du dang 'bring dang chen po thob pas go rims bzhin du dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig drug smos pa yin no //
translated: The six words beginning with “joy” refer to the attainment of the lesser, middling, and great bliss through the attainment of the means for attaining the goal that has been sought for a long time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag gis bsam pa rnam par dag pa thob pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos par gyur to zhes gsungs pa ni de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag gis bsam pa rnam par dag pa thob pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos par gyur to zhes gsungs pa ni de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement “having attained the pure thought through the Tathagata’s instruction, he heard the perfection of wisdom” is the passage beginning with “Then the Bodhisattva-mahasattva Sadaprarudita . . . ”

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyi chos nyan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni thos nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyi chos nyan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni thos nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement “the listening to the Dharma by those who have the perfect cause is fruitful” is the passage beginning with “Having heard . . . ”

original: mi gnas pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du shes so //
translated: The “non-abiding perception” is the perception of illusion-like.

original: rtogs pa thams cad chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the lines beginning “The door of meditative absorption called…”

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la rnam par gnas na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu nyid la sogs par rnam par lta ba de ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la rnam par gnas na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu nyid la sogs par rnam par lta ba de ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: When one abides in a meditative absorption, one sees the illusory nature of all phenomena. This is called the meditative absorption of seeing the nature of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mi dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The meditative absorption of the nonapprehension of the nature of all phenomena and so on should be explained in the same way.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi rtogs pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi rtogs pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bcu gnyis so //
translated: The four aspects of clear realization are divided into small, medium and great, and so there are twelve samadhis, such as the one called the view of the nature of all phenomena.

original: yang de las nges par 'byung pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa nyid la sgyu ma rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin lnga bcu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang de las nges par 'byung pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa nyid la sgyu ma rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin lnga bcu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Again, it should be understood that there are fifty samadhis, such as the one called the abandonment of illusion, on the level of devoted engagement that is the outcome of that.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'di nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo yin na yang byis pa'i rgud pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'di nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' so so'i skye bo yin na yang byis pa'i rgud pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das shing ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs dang /
translated: For the noble Cloud of Jewels Sutra teaches that even though bodhisattvas on this level of devoted engagement are ordinary beings, they have completely transcended all the faults of childishness and possess countless samadhis, powers of mental retention,

original: rnam par thar pa dang / mngon par shes pa grangs med pa dang ldan par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / mngon par shes pa grangs med pa dang ldan par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: liberations, and higher cognitions.

original: bsam ba rnam par dag pa'i stobs nyid kyis @328b sa dang po rtogs pa'i don du mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i snang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i gdams ngag rgya cher thob po zhes gsungs pa ni ting nge 'dzin de dag la gnas🔽pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam ba rnam par dag pa'i stobs nyid kyis @328b sa dang po rtogs pa'i don du mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i snang ba sngon du 'gro ba'i gdams ngag rgya cher thob po zhes gsungs pa ni ting nge 'dzin de dag la gnas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The power of pure thought itself, in the context of meditative equipoise for the sake of realizing the first ground, is said to be the extensive instruction preceded by the appearance of the Tathagata.

original: phyogs gzhan dag las sa dang po la sogs pa la sangs rgyas brgya la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba nyid du khong du chud bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan dag las sa dang po la sogs pa la sangs rgyas brgya la sogs pa mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba nyid du khong du chud bar bya ste /
translated: In other contexts, it is said that on the first ground and so on, one sees a hundred buddhas and so on, but that should be understood as definite.

original: gzhan la sgrub pa dag dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la sgrub pa dag dgag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is not denied that others do that.

original: de bas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa la de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa la de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa nye bar dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, on the level of earnest aspiration, one focuses on countless tathagatas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis 'byung ba ni 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis 'byung ba ni 'gal ba'i phyir ji ltar de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could this be, since it is contradictory for two Tathagatas to appear in one world system?

original: kha cig na re 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa mthong ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa mthong ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One sees immeasurable Bhagavat Buddhas dwelling in other world systems.

original: gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes lhan cig skye ba bkag pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa 'jug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis snga phyi med par 'jig rten du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes lhan cig skye ba bkag pa gang yin pa de ni bstan pa 'jug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Others say: The statement that it is impossible for two Tathagatas to appear in the world without one preceding and the other following is stated with reference to the entry of the teaching.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis kyi bstan pa 'jig rten du cig car mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di nyid der gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis kyi bstan pa 'jig rten du cig car mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di nyid der gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement that two Tathagatas do not appear in the world simultaneously is that the teaching of two Tathagatas does not appear in the world simultaneously.🔽The appearance of two Tathagatas is like this:

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis de dag gi 'byung ba ni 'di yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du gyur pa nyid kyis de dag gi 'byung ba ni 'di yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is for the sake of others.

original: bstan pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entry of the teaching is like this:

original: de ltar yin dang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i gnas nyid du yang dgongs pa mnyam pa nyid kyis dang / bstan pa'i rim pa gcig tu byas pa rnams rgyu ma tshad ba med pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa du ma rnams cig car 'byung ba mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i gnas nyid du yang dgongs pa mnyam pa nyid kyis dang / bstan pa'i rim pa gcig tu byas pa rnams rgyu ma tshad ba med pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa du ma rnams cig car 'byung ba mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, in this world system, many Tathagatas are seen to appear simultaneously, because of the equality of their intentions and the fact that the stages of teaching are the same, and because there is no lack of causes.

original: yang gzhan dag ni snga phyi med par ma yin no zhes gsungs pas de rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba ni rjes su gnang ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni snga phyi med par ma yin no zhes gsungs pas de rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba ni rjes su gnang ba nyid yin la /
translated: Others say that it is not without a sequence, and so they allow that they appear in sequence.

original: byung ba de dag ni chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med par yod pa nyid yin gyi 'on kyang bsod nams dang mi ldan pa la mi snang bar zad do //
analyzed: byung ba de dag ni chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med par yod pa nyid yin gyi 'on kyang bsod nams dang mi ldan pa la mi snang bar zad do //
translated: Those who appear are not totally extinguished in the Dharma Body and the Body of Beatitude, but they do not appear to those who are not vessels of merit.

original: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams kyis ni bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du nyung du'am mang po nye bar mthong ba yin no zhes 'chad do //🔽la la @329a * //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams kyis ni bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du nyung du'am mang po nye bar mthong ba yin no zhes 'chad do // la la @329a * //
translated: Those who possess merit see a small or large number of buddhas in accordance with their merit.

original: ni de'i tshe der de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi byin gyi rlabs sam 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi mthus cho 'phrul mdzad pa'i dus su so so'i skye bo rnams dang 'dra bar sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med par yin no zhes zer ro //🔽yang kha cig ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs kyis las dang po pa dang 'dra bar rang gi sems de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med par snang bar rtogs pa nyid skyes pas de bzhin gshegs pa dpag
analyzed: ni de'i tshe der de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi byin gyi rlabs sam 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi mthus cho 'phrul mdzad pa'i dus su so so'i skye bo rnams dang 'dra bar sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med par yin no zhes zer ro // yang kha cig ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs kyis las dang po pa dang 'dra bar rang gi sems de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med par snang bar rtogs pa nyid skyes pas de bzhin gshegs pa dpag
translated: Some say: At that time, through the blessing of one Tathagata or through the power of the noble Avalokitesvara, when the time of performing miracles arrives, they manifest as innumerable emanation buddhas like ordinary beings.

original: tu med pa mthong ba yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: tu med pa mthong ba yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others say: Through the power of meditation possessing the inconceivable door of liberation, they realize that their own mind appears as innumerable tathagatas like a beginner, and thus they see innumerable tathagatas.

original: mgo la thod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mgo la gos dkris pa thogs pa bzhin du khyed kyis zung shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mgo la thod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mgo la gos dkris pa thogs pa bzhin du khyed kyis zung shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Like a turban on the head means: just as one wears a turban on the head, you should hold it. This is the meaning of you should take it up.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rigs kyi bu de'i mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rigs kyi bu de'i mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, in response to the doubt why is that? it is said, Son of noble family, by the power of that... and so on.

original: rab tu gdung zhing zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu gdung zhing zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Agitated means mentally unhappy.

original: de'i rin gyi zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bdag gi lus btsongs na ni gzhan gyi kha na las pas deng 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir mchod pa dang shin tu bral bar 'gyur bas dus re zhig tsam du bdag gi lus btsongs
analyzed: de'i rin gyi zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bdag gi lus btsongs na ni gzhan gyi kha na las pas deng 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir mchod pa dang shin tu bral bar 'gyur bas dus re zhig tsam du bdag gi lus btsongs
translated: The price of that means: if I were to sell my body for as long as I live, I would be completely lacking in worship because there would be no opportunity to go due to the fault of others. Therefore, for a short time, I will sell my body.

original: pa'i rin gyis so //
analyzed: pa'i rin gyis so //
translated: For the price of that, I will worship the guru.

original: tshogs kyis la yang mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis lha'i mchod pa la sogs pa yod pa srid mod kyi /
analyzed: tshogs kyis la yang mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis lha'i mchod pa la sogs pa yod pa srid mod kyi /
translated: Although it is possible that the assembly has divine worship and so on by the power of superknowledge,

original: de'i rin 'dzin pa ni chos la gus par bya ba'i don du yin no zhes bya ba kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: de'i rin 'dzin pa ni chos la gus par bya ba'i don du yin no zhes bya ba kha cig gi'o //
translated: Some say: The price is held for the purpose of honoring the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag ni chos mi nyan pa'i don du gnyer ba nyid kyis na rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa la rtsol ba'i dran pa dang bral ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni chos mi nyan pa'i don du gnyer ba nyid kyis na rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa la rtsol ba'i dran pa dang bral ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: They are devoid of mindfulness that strives for magical powers and higher knowledge, because they are intent on not listening to the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag gi brtson 'grus zhan pa rnams chos tshol ba la spro ba bskyed pa bstan pa'i don du yin no zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi brtson 'grus zhan pa rnams chos tshol ba la spro ba bskyed pa bstan pa'i don du yin no zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is for the purpose of teaching those of weak effort to be enthusiastic about seeking the Dharma.

original: la la ni rim pa 'dis tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa'i don bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: la la ni rim pa 'dis tshong dpon gyi bu mo la sogs pa'i don bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some explain: It is for the purpose of the merchant's daughter and so on.

original: zhig cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i 'tshe bas rnam par zhig pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhig cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i 'tshe bas rnam par zhig pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The three phrases beginning with destroyed are applied in order to the destruction of oneself, others, and both, respectively.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir dang 'dod pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba dang nyams su ma myong ba'i 'dod pa'i don du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir dang 'dod pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba dang nyams su ma myong ba'i 'dod pa'i don du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of desire and on account of desire means for the sake of desired objects that are experienced and not experienced.

original: dga' ba chen po dang 'bring dang chung du thob pas sems dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin @329b no ;
analyzed: dga' ba chen po dang 'bring dang chung du thob pas sems dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin @329b no ;
translated: The three phrases beginning with “the mind is delighted by attaining great, middling, and small delight” are stated.

original: / gang 'dod pa sbyin no zhes bya ba la kha cig na re mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis snying la sogs pa byin du zin kyang chos nyan pa'i bar chad du 'gyur bar ma mthong bas sbyin no zhes khas blangs pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: / gang 'dod pa sbyin no zhes bya ba la kha cig na re mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis snying la sogs pa byin du zin kyang chos nyan pa'i bar chad du 'gyur bar ma mthong bas sbyin no zhes khas blangs pa yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some say: Although one gives the heart, etc. through the power of the higher perceptions, one promises to give because one does not see that it will be an obstacle for listening to the Dharma.

original: la la ni chos la mchod pa'i don du gnyer ba nyid kyi bar chad du 'gyur ba yang ma rtsis pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: la la ni chos la mchod pa'i don du gnyer ba nyid kyi bar chad du 'gyur ba yang ma rtsis pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that one does not consider that it will be an obstacle for those who seek to worship the Dharma.

original: bsam pa che ba nyid ni mchod pa chen po yin gyi rdzas mang po nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gang yongs su gtang ba de nga la byin cig ces smras pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa che ba nyid ni mchod pa chen po yin gyi rdzas mang po nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gang yongs su gtang ba de nga la byin cig ces smras pa yin no //
translated: The thought is: Give to me that which you are giving up.

original: na tsha dag byed ces bya ba ni gnod pa ngag go //
analyzed: na tsha dag byed ces bya ba ni gnod pa ngag go //
translated: The word pain means harm.

original: yon tan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi spyi'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi spyi'o //
translated: The word aspect means a universal of a quality.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The word distinction means a particular quality.

original: de la yid dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pas na 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la yid dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin pas na 'dod pa'o //
translated: The word desire means that which is agreeable to the mind.

original: nyes pa mi bskyed pa yin pas na bzod pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa mi bskyed pa yin pas na bzod pa'o //
translated: The word patience means that which does not produce faults.

original: yul 'di la ni nga'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dbang du gyur pa'am bdag por gyur pa ma yin te nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul 'di la ni nga'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dbang du gyur pa'am bdag por gyur pa ma yin te nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word power means that which is not under one's control, that which is not one's own, that which is not one's possession.

original: skye bo dbang po rnon po dang 'bring dang rtul po la snang ba la ltos nas skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo dbang po rnon po dang 'bring dang rtul po la snang ba la ltos nas skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum smos pa yin no //
translated: The three phrases, “momentary,” etc., are mentioned in terms of the appearance of the sharp, middling, and dull faculties of beings.

original: 'phral du skyes pa'i nad med pas na nad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral du skyes pa'i nad med pas na nad med pa'o //
translated: It is “without disease” because it is free from the disease that arises suddenly.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i nad la ltos nas 'byung du rung ba nyid med pas na 'tshe ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i nad la ltos nas 'byung du rung ba nyid med pas na 'tshe ba med pa'o //
translated: It is “without afflictions” because it is not subject to the afflictions that arise later.

original: tshur shog ces bya ba ni spyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshur shog ces bya ba ni spyon cig pa'o //
translated: “Come here” means “please come.”

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni khang pa'o //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni khang pa'o //
translated: “House” means “home.”

original: dgyer gsol zhes bya ba ni thong cig pa'o //
analyzed: dgyer gsol zhes bya ba ni thong cig pa'o //
translated: “Please give” means “please grant.”

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas nga ni dbul te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽mang zhing rgya che ba dag yod na zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi dbye bas rnam pa dpag tu med pa ni mang po'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas nga ni dbul te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // mang zhing rgya che ba dag yod na zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi dbye bas rnam pa dpag tu med pa ni mang po'o //
translated: As before, the objection is anticipated: “Why is that?” and the response is given: “I am poor, etc.”🔽“Many and vast” means that the varieties of substances are innumerable, and thus they are “many.”

original: rnam pa re re zhing mtha' yas pa ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa re re zhing mtha' yas pa ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: Each variety is limitless, and thus they are “vast.”

original: gnang bar mdzad du gsol lo zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnang ba stsol cig pa'o //
analyzed: gnang bar mdzad du gsol lo zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnang ba stsol cig pa'o //
translated: Please grant it means Please give your permission.

original: rtag tu dus rgyang ring mo zhig nas mthong ste zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa khyad par can thob pa'i phyir na chos 'phags kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo mthong ba'i nus pa yod pas grong khyer spos ldan rgyang ring mo zhig nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu dus rgyang ring mo zhig nas mthong ste zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa khyad par can thob pa'i phyir na chos 'phags kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo mthong ba'i nus pa yod pas grong khyer spos ldan rgyang ring mo zhig nas mthong ngo //
translated: Always seeing from afar means that because he had attained a special realization, he had the ability to see the door of Dharmodgata's liberation, so he saw the city of Gandhavatī from afar.

original: koo shi ka de gang na bzhugs zhes bya ba ni chos don du gnyer ba nyid kyi mngon par shes pa'i rtsol ba dang bral bas dris pa yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de gang na bzhugs zhes bya ba ni chos don du gnyer ba nyid kyi mngon par shes pa'i rtsol ba dang bral bas dris pa yin no //
translated: Kauśika, where is he? means he asked because he was free from the effort of supernormal knowledge due to his very pursuit of the Dharma.

original: rgya rim pa bdun gyis btab nas zhes bya ba ni rnyed @330a * //
analyzed: rgya rim pa bdun gyis btab nas zhes bya ba ni rnyed @330a * //
translated: Sealed with seven seals means that it is difficult to obtain.

original: dka' zhing don che ba nyid kyis 'di la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du sku regs bdun gyis shin tu dam par bcings nas mdud pa'i gnas bdun la rang gi ming gi rgya bdun gyis rgyas btab nas bzhag pa yin no zhes kha cig gis 'dod
analyzed: dka' zhing don che ba nyid kyis 'di la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du sku regs bdun gyis shin tu dam par bcings nas mdud pa'i gnas bdun la rang gi ming gi rgya bdun gyis rgyas btab nas bzhag pa yin no zhes kha cig gis 'dod
translated: Some believe that it was tied with seven knots in order to generate respect for this perfection, since it is difficult to understand and has great benefit, and that it was sealed with seven seals bearing its name at the seven places where the knots were tied.

original: do / skal ba dang ldan pa nyid du mkhyen nas shin tu mgu bar bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul mdzad pa ni de nas me tog de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi spyi bo'i steng na zhes bya ba la sogs pa🔽smos pa yin no //
analyzed: do / skal ba dang ldan pa nyid du mkhyen nas shin tu mgu bar bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul mdzad pa ni de nas me tog de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi spyi bo'i steng na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate his own good fortune and to make him very happy, he performed the miracle of supernormal power, as stated in the passage beginning with the words, “Then those flowers were placed above the head of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dharmodgata.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byon pa dang bzhud pa yongs su shes pa zhu bar bya ba'i phyir sngon byung ba'i tshul gsol ba ni rigs kyi bu bdag 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshol zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byon pa dang bzhud pa yongs su shes pa zhu bar bya ba'i phyir sngon byung ba'i tshul gsol ba ni rigs kyi bu bdag 'di na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshol zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa yin no
translated: In order to ask about the coming and going of the tathāgatas, he requested the former events, as stated in the passage beginning with the words, “Son of noble family, I was seeking the perfection of wisdom here.”

original: // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las /🔽rtag tu du'i le'u zhes bya ste sum cu pa'o /🔽// / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon pa dang bzhud pa bkag pas mthong ba'i lam bskyed par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad bdag med bar ston pas de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bshad pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi snang ba las / rtag tu du'i le'u zhes bya ste sum cu pa'o / // / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon pa dang bzhud pa bkag pas mthong ba'i lam bskyed par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad bdag med bar ston pas de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'phags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The chapter of the Ornament of Clear Realization, the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom,🔽called “Always Weeping,” is the thirtieth.🔽🔽Having taught that all phenomena are selfless in order to stop the coming and going of the Tathāgatas and to generate the path of seeing, the noble Avalokiteśvara said, “Subhūti, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who would practice the profound perfection of wisdom should view it in this way.”🔽

original: kha cig na re de bzhin nyid dang / mi skye ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: kha cig na re de bzhin nyid dang / mi skye ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: This is the commentary on the thirtieth chapter, having thirty-two verses, called “the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan pas go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rab tu phye ba nyid ston pa yin no zhes
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan pas go rims bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi rab tu phye ba nyid ston pa yin no zhes
translated: Since the element of space is taught to be free from attachment, cessation, and the intrinsic reality of the element of space, respectively, the Bhagavān Buddhas teach the eight realizations, such as the knowledge of all aspects, and so on.

original: zer ro // de nyid kyi phyir rigs kyi bu chos de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zer ro // de nyid kyi phyir rigs kyi bu chos de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Son of noble family, the Tathāgata is not separate from those dharmas, and so on.”

original: chos de dag las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan nyid kyi ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos de dag las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan nyid kyi ma yin gyi /
translated: “Those dharmas” refers to the dharmas such as the knowledge of all aspects. The Tathāgata is not separate from them.

original: 'on kyang 'di rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, the suchness of those is the Tathāgata. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan dag ni gtan tshigs dang dpe lhag pa'i phyir na lhag pa tshar gcod pa'i gnas yin par rigs pa sra mo rnams kyis kyang brjod @330b pa yin na de ji ltar rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pa bcom ldan 'das dpe lhag par gsungs pa yin zhes rtsod
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gtan tshigs dang dpe lhag pa'i phyir na lhag pa tshar gcod pa'i gnas yin par rigs pa sra mo rnams kyis kyang brjod @330b pa yin na de ji ltar rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pa bcom ldan 'das dpe lhag par gsungs pa yin zhes rtsod
translated: Others say that the Lord Buddha, the supreme master of reasoning, taught the example of the eye sense faculty as superior because it is superior to the example of the seed, since the reason and example are superior.

original: pa bkod nas gang du rtogs par bya ba gcig kho na yin pa zhes bya ba der ni de la grags pa gcig kho na brjod par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa bkod nas gang du rtogs par bya ba gcig kho na yin pa zhes bya ba der ni de la grags pa gcig kho na brjod par rigs pa yin no //
translated: In response to this objection, it is said that in the passage, “Where there is only one thing to be understood,” it is logical to state only what is renowned to that person.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor der ni blo gros tha dad pa mang po 'dus pa yin pas de'i dbang du mdzad nas dpe mang po gsungs pa rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor der ni blo gros tha dad pa mang po 'dus pa yin pas de'i dbang du mdzad nas dpe mang po gsungs pa rigs pa yin no //
translated: In that circle of disciples, many different minds were gathered, so it is logical that from their perspective many examples were taught.🔽These examples are analyzed, but they are not exhaustive.

original: dpe 'di dag kyang rnam par brtags pas yin gyi bsdu ba ni ma yin no zhes de ltar tshig lhag pa thams cad la rtsod pa spong brjod par byed do //
analyzed: dpe 'di dag kyang rnam par brtags pas yin gyi bsdu ba ni ma yin no zhes de ltar tshig lhag pa thams cad la rtsod pa spong brjod par byed do //
translated: This is how the opponent rejects all objections to the statement that the examples are incomplete.

original: de bzhin du dpe nyid brjod pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs shes rab can rnams kyi dpog pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe nyid brjod pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs shes rab can rnams kyi dpog pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes so //
translated: Likewise, the wise infer dependent origination, etc. from the mere statement of the example, so it is not stated.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan nas brtags pa mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i don du gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na skyes bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan nas brtags pa mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i don du gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na skyes bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: Thus, after teaching the nature of the Tathagatas, in order to prevent attachment to conceptualization, it is said, “For example, son of noble family, a person, etc.”

original: smig rgyu zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi khyad par can no //
analyzed: smig rgyu zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi khyad par can no //
translated: Mirage means a special ray of sunlight.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir na byis pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir na byis pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Because the nature of things is not fully understood, they have the nature of fools.

original: phyin ci log tu rtogs pas na shes rab 'chal ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtogs pas na shes rab 'chal ba'o //
translated: Because of mistaken understanding, they have bad wisdom.

original: de la chu ni rang bzhin gyis ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu'i chu'i rnam pa la 'od zer gyis gdungs pa'i mya ngan ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la chu ni rang bzhin gyis ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu'i chu'i rnam pa la 'od zer gyis gdungs pa'i mya ngan ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: There, water does not exist by nature means that the appearance of water in a mirage is not an object of perception for one tormented by the rays of the sun.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i yul gzhan yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i yul gzhan yin na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object of a cognition having the aspect of another is another, there is an absurd consequence.

original: dngos po thams cad ni phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yang dag par na chu ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yang dag par na chu ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since all things have the nature of mutual exclusion, in reality water is not the nature of a mirage, etc.

original: de bas na de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni yul med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni yul med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the cognition that observes that is mistaken because of the nonexistence of an object.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi skur mi lta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi skur mi lta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In response to the doubt, “Why is it like the previous one?,” he says, “The Tathāgata should not be viewed in terms of a form body.”

original: kun brtags pa ni gcig tu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi sku'i bdag nyid can ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gcig tu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi sku'i bdag nyid can ma yin no //
translated: Since the imagined is emptiness in one way, the Tathāgata is not the nature of a form body.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i don du regs kyi bu 'di lta sta dper na sgyu mas sprul pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i don du regs kyi bu 'di lta sta dper na sgyu mas sprul pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin na //
translated: In order to stop the adherence to the other-dependent as really existent, it is said, “Son of noble family, it is thus: for example, a magical creation...,” and so on.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni brdzun pa nyid yin pas sprul pa la ni 'gro ba la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha @331a * //🔽tshig go // rigs kyi bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid can la'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni brdzun pa nyid yin pas sprul pa la ni 'gro ba la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha @331a * // tshig go // rigs kyi bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi bdag nyid can la'o //
translated: Since the aspects of object and subject are false, it is said that in a magical creation there is no going and so on.

original: yongs su grub par mngon par zhen pa bsam par bya ba'i don du rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su grub par mngon par zhen pa bsam par bya ba'i don du rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Son of noble family, in the same way, in the body of the Tathāgata,” which has the nature of the other-dependent, “in order to stop the adherence to the perfect as really existent, it is said, ‘Son of noble family, it is thus: for example, a person asleep and dreaming...’ and so on.

original: rmi lam ni brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam ni brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a dream is false,

original: skye ba de dang gzhan na yang //
analyzed: skye ba de dang gzhan na yang //
translated: in this life and in others,

original: dus de dang ni dus gzhan na //
analyzed: dus de dang ni dus gzhan na //
translated: at that time and at other times,

original: thams cad du ni phyi rol dmigs //
analyzed: thams cad du ni phyi rol dmigs //
translated: externally perceived objects do not exist at all.

original: yul dang dus gzhan bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the self of another place and time.

original: rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul ni //
translated: The object of the consciousness of a dream

original: yul de dang ni yul gzhan no //
analyzed: yul de dang ni yul gzhan no //
translated: Is not that place, nor is it another.

original: snyam na mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: snyam na mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If it were,

original: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i shes pa rnam pa gzhan la dmigs na ni ha cang thal ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i shes pa rnam pa gzhan la dmigs na ni ha cang thal ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then consciousness possessing one aspect would have many aspects as its object, which is absurd.

original: phyi rol gyi ngo bo yin par yang mi 'thad de //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngo bo yin par yang mi 'thad de //
translated: Nor is it tenable that it is an external entity,

original: khang pa shin tu chung ngu'i nang du ri dang shing dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa dpag tshad mang po'i tshad tsam nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang pa shin tu chung ngu'i nang du ri dang shing dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa dpag tshad mang po'i tshad tsam nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in a very small house, one perceives as an object a mountain, a tree, an ocean, and so on, which are obstructed and many yojanas in size.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i shes pa skye ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pas rmi lam ni brdzun pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i shes pa skye ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pas rmi lam ni brdzun pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the arising of such a consciousness is itself an error, a dream is false.

original: rigs kyi bu de de bzhin te chos thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas rmi lam lta bu'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni tshad mas 'thad pa'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos thams cad ni rmi🔽lam dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de de bzhin te chos thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas rmi lam lta bu'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni tshad mas 'thad pa'i skye ba dang bral ba nyid kyis na yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos thams cad ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: All phenomena, which have the nature of the consummate, are like a dream, because they are free from arising, which is established by valid cognition.

original: chos nyid mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bor mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bor mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: Because they do not know reality, they do not realize the nature of non-arising.

original: 'gro ba drug po zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba lnga las lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba lnga las ni logs shig tu bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug po zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba lnga las lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba lnga las ni logs shig tu bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six classes of beings refers to the five classes of beings such as gods, and the class of demigods, which is set apart from the five classes of gods and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos de dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos de dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The hearers of the Bhagavān are like this.

original: tshul khrims las ni nyams bla yi //
analyzed: tshul khrims las ni nyams bla yi //
translated: It is better to violate morality

original: lta bas nams kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: lta bas nams kyang ma yin te //
translated: than to have a view at any time.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris 'thob //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris 'thob //
translated: Through morality, one attains the higher realms,

original: lta bas go 'phang mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: lta bas go 'phang mchog tu 'gro //
translated: but through the view, one goes to the highest state.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid kyis lhag bar mos pa de dag kho na bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid kyis lhag bar mos pa de dag kho na bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma yin no //
translated: In this way, those who are devoted to the illusion-like reality are the disciples of the Lord.

original: kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i don gsum de kho na'i rang bzhin yin pa bkag pa na skye bo blo dman pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa med pa nyid yin na zhes rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs @331b pa ni
analyzed: kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i don gsum de kho na'i rang bzhin yin pa bkag pa na skye bo blo dman pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa med pa nyid yin na zhes rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs @331b pa ni
translated: When the reality of the three realities, imagined, etc., is denied, the weak-minded think that the Tathagata does not exist. In order to dispel that notion, the reality of dependent origination is taught.🔽The Tathagata exists, as is said in the Ratnamegha:

original: yod do zhes gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod do zhes gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, it is thus. For example, in the great ocean, etc.

original: sems can gang dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten nas bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can gang dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten nas bya ba ni /
translated: The Tathagata is the object of those whose roots of virtue are based on the Tathagata.

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: The world of various actions arises from karma.

original: zhes bshad bas sems can rnams kyi thun mong gi dge ba'i las la brten nas kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu can yin ba'i phyir de rnams rgyu med pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad bas sems can rnams kyi thun mong gi dge ba'i las la brten nas kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu can yin ba'i phyir de rnams rgyu med pa can ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because they are the cause of the roots of virtue in the conventional sense, in dependence on the common virtuous karma of sentient beings, they are not without a cause.

original: rkyen de dag yod na ni zhes bya ba la shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rkyen de dag yod na ni zhes bya ba la shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: If those conditions exist,🔽the Blessed Buddhas appear in the world.🔽The bodies of those Blessed Buddhas are not without a cause,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sku rgyu med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba nyid kyi sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyi skur yongs su grub pa yin pas rgyu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sku rgyu med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba nyid kyi sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyi skur yongs su grub pa yin pas rgyu med pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are fully accomplished as bodies by the power of the roots of virtue of sentient beings who are to be trained by the Buddhas, they are not without a cause.

original: thun mong gi las las byung ba nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: thun mong gi las las byung ba nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that they arise from common karma,

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das thun mong ma yin pa'i las las nges par 'byung bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir sngon gyi spyod pas yongs su grub pa yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das thun mong ma yin pa'i las las nges par 'byung bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir sngon gyi spyod pas yongs su grub pa yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: now, in order to teach that the Blessed Ones arise from uncommon karma, he says, “because they are fully accomplished by previous conduct,” and so on.

original: de la kha cig na re mos pas spyod pa'i sas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi spyod pas yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re mos pas spyod pa'i sas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi spyod pas yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: Some say: It is fully accomplished from previous practice because it is distinguished by the level of practice with devoted interest.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa spyor ba'i sa bdun gyi nye bar len pa las nges par skye ba nyid yin pas na rgyu la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa spyor ba'i sa bdun gyi nye bar len pa las nges par skye ba nyid yin pas na rgyu la rag las pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on causes because it definitely arises from the appropriating of the seven levels of engagement, such as the level of the joyous.

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i sa gsum gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid kyis na rkyen la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i sa gsum gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid kyis na rkyen la rag las pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on conditions because it arises from the coemergent cause of the three resultant levels, such as the immovable.

original: kun tu 'od kyi sas bsdus pa nyid yin pas sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'od kyi sas bsdus pa nyid yin pas sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It arises from the evolution of previous karma because it is subsumed by the level of universal radiance.

original: de bas na ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the nature of the tathāgatas does not exist, as it is said, “It does not exist anywhere in the worlds of the ten directions.”

original: don dam don byed nus pa gang //
analyzed: don dam don byed nus pa gang //
translated: Whatever is able to perform a function

original: de 'dir don dam yod pa yin //
analyzed: de 'dir don dam yod pa yin //
translated: is here said to be ultimately existent.

original: zhes bshad bas tshad mas 'chad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i stobs kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes skye bo dmigs pa can gyi mngon par zhen pa dgag bar bya ba'i phyir rigs kyi bu
analyzed: zhes bshad bas tshad mas 'chad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i stobs kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yin no zhes skye bo dmigs pa can gyi mngon par zhen pa dgag bar bya ba'i phyir rigs kyi bu
translated: Thus, in order to refute the clinging of those who have a reference point, thinking that dependent origination itself is the perfect Tathagata by the power of the cause and effect explained by valid cognition, the following is said:

original: 'di lta ste pi wang gi sgra 'byung ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste pi wang gi sgra 'byung ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: the sound of a lute arises, and so on.

original: de la shing bu la brten pa ni rgyud dkris pa yu ba'i rtse mo la gzhag pa'i shing @332a * //🔽la sogs pa'i dril shing ngo //
analyzed: de la shing bu la brten pa ni rgyud dkris pa yu ba'i rtse mo la gzhag pa'i shing @332a * // la sogs pa'i dril shing ngo //
translated: There, the support of the stick is the stick of the strings that is placed at the top of the handle of the wrapped strings.

original: rgyud la ni ngos na gnas ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rgyud la ni ngos na gnas ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The strings are the particular strings that are placed on the side.

original: sgra de yang pi wang gi khog ba las ma byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyed par byed pa cig med par ston to //
analyzed: sgra de yang pi wang gi khog ba las ma byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyed par byed pa cig med par ston to //
translated: The sound does not arise from the body of the lute, and so on shows that there is no single producer.

original: de dag thams cad 'dus pa las sgrar gdags so zhes bya ba 'dis kyang sgrar btags pa yin par bstan pas tshogs pa ni yang dag par skyed pa po'i ngo bo yin pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'dus pa las sgrar gdags so zhes bya ba 'dis kyang sgrar btags pa yin par bstan pas tshogs pa ni yang dag par skyed pa po'i ngo bo yin pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: position that the collection is the entity that generates.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rgyu dus mas 'bras bu gcig gam du ma zhig byed dam /
analyzed: rgyu dus mas 'bras bu gcig gam du ma zhig byed dam /
translated: Does the cause that exists at one time give rise to one or many effects?🔽Similarly, does a single cause give rise to many or a single effect? These are

original: de bzhin du rgyu gcig kyang 'bras bu du ma'am gcig byed do zhes rnam pa bzhir brtag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu gcig kyang 'bras bu du ma'am gcig byed do zhes rnam pa bzhir brtag go //
translated: the four possibilities.

original: de la gal te rgyu dus mas 'bras bu gcig byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na //
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu dus mas 'bras bu gcig byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na //
translated: If the position is that the cause that exists at one time gives rise to a single🔽effect, then, since it is accepted that a single visual consciousness is given rise🔽to by the eye, form, light, and attention, although the causes are different, the

original: de'i tshe mi ga dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pas mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig bu skyed par khas len pa na rgyu tha dad kyang 'bras bu tha dad med pas rgyu tha dad pa ni 'bras bu tha dad par byed bar mi
analyzed: de'i tshe mi ga dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pas mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig bu skyed par khas len pa na rgyu tha dad kyang 'bras bu tha dad med pas rgyu tha dad pa ni 'bras bu tha dad par byed bar mi
translated: effect is not different. Therefore, the different causes would not give rise to🔽different effects. This is the first absurd consequence.

original: 'gyur la de bzhin du rgyu tha mi dad pa med kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu tha mi dad pa ni 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur la de bzhin du rgyu tha mi dad pa med kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu tha mi dad pa ni 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, even though the causes are not undifferentiated, the effect is not undifferentiated, so the undifferentiated cause would not be the agent of the undifferentiated effect.

original: de bas na rgyu'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba dag la ltos pa med pas 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba dag la ltos pa med pas 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the differentiation and nondifferentiation of the effect are not dependent on the differentiation and nondifferentiation of the cause, the differentiation and nondifferentiation of the effect would be causeless.

original: de ltar yin no yang tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa ni rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin no yang tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa ni rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then because there is nothing other than differentiation and nondifferentiation, the variegated would either always exist or never exist,

original: rgyu med pa ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the causeless is not dependent on anything.

original: gal te 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni tshogs pa yin la /
translated: If the assemblage is the producer of the effect,

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'di dag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rjes su byed pa la bzo ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'di dag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rjes su byed pa la bzo ba ma yin nam /
translated: And after that, is it not the case that the effects, which are either different or non-different from the cause, are made by that which is either different or non-different from the cause?

original: des na ji ltar de dag rgyu med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de dag rgyu med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then could they be causeless?

original: 'di ni snying po yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni snying po yod ba ma yin te /
translated: This has no essence.

original: 'di ltar tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa las gzhan ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa las gzhan ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
translated: Thus, what is called an “assembly” is nothing other than an assembly.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid tshogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid tshogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: However, the intrinsic reality of the assembly is expressed by the term “assembly.”

original: de rnams phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo mig la sogs pa tha dad par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo mig la sogs pa tha dad par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Those are mutually different, such as the eye and so on.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa gcig nyid kyis 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus na /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa gcig nyid kyis 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par nus na /
translated: If a single, non-different assembly is able to generate the effect, the eye consciousness,

original: de'i tshe tshogs ba gzhan gyi @332b nang du gtogs pa'i tshogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyis kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa ci ste skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshogs ba gzhan gyi @332b nang du gtogs pa'i tshogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyis kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa ci ste skyed par mi byed /
translated: At that time, why don’t the things that are included in the collection of other causes and conditions generate eye consciousness?

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa las sa la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid yin pas skyed par mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa las sa la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid yin pas skyed par mi byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that since earth and so on are different from the eye and so on, they do not generate eye consciousness,

original: mig la sogs pa yang phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad pas ji ltar skyed par byed pa yin no zhes rjod par byed /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad pas ji ltar skyed par byed pa yin no zhes rjod par byed /
translated: then we reply: since the eye and so on are also different from each other in terms of their intrinsic natures, how could they generate eye consciousness?

original: gal te skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they generate eye consciousness because they have the nature of generating eye consciousness,

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa nyid las gzhan pa nyid ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyed par byed pa nyid las gzhan pa nyid ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Because that which is different from the nature of generating eye consciousness is posited as not having the nature of generating eye consciousness.

original: de bas na gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de las gzhan dag ldog pa na skyed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de las gzhan dag ldog pa na skyed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when the others are different from that which has the nature of generating eye consciousness, they do not generate eye consciousness.

original: skyed par byed pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because it is different from the producer, like any other thing.

original: 'di snyam du gzhan la bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo med do zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzhan la bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo med do zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that the other does not have the nature of being produced.

original: 'on kyang gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de gzhan la med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig gis skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de gzhan la med do //
translated: However, that nature of being a producer which one has, the other does not have.

original: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is only by its own nature that it is a producer, not by the nature of another,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not that nature itself.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog par ma grub pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tha dad pa yang yin la /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog par ma grub pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tha dad pa yang yin la /
translated: Since it is not established that it is a reversal from the nature of being a producer, it is different just as it is,

original: rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: and it is a producer by its own nature. What contradiction is there in this?

original: 'di ltar skyed par byed pa gcig las ldog pa ni de'i ngo bor mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyed par byed pa gcig las ldog pa ni de'i ngo bor mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, a reversal from a single producer does not mean that it is not its nature,

original: 'bras bu de dang mi ldan par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang mi ldan par ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not endowed with that effect.

original: de kho nas 'bras bu de bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de kho nas 'bras bu de bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, “What is the logic of saying that only that which is the cause of a particular effect produces that effect?”🔽If that were the case, since only that which is the cause of a particular effect produces that effect, what need is there for other things to produce that effect?

original: gal te de lta yin na gcig po de kho nas 'bras bu de byas pa yin pas 'bras bu de byed pa la gzhan dag dgos pa ci zhig yod /🔽'di snyam du 'di gcig pus kyang nus na 'dir bdag cag rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes gang las ldog par 'gyur ba /🔽dngos po rnams rtog pa sngon du btang nas byed pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na gcig po de kho nas 'bras bu de byas pa yin pas 'bras bu de byed pa la gzhan dag dgos pa ci zhig yod / 'di snyam du 'di gcig pus kyang nus na 'dir bdag cag rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes gang las ldog par 'gyur ba / dngos po rnams rtog pa sngon du btang nas byed pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
translated: If you think, “If this alone is able to produce it, what need is there for us to produce it?”🔽There is no entity that is produced by positing a thought prior to it.

original: de dag ni sems pa med par byed pa can rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pa la 'du ba'i chos can dag de byed pa na de ltar 'gyur ba la ni klan ka btsal bar 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sems na de lta na ni
