original: 'o na rgyu gcig gis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyis kyang byed bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gcig gis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyis kyang byed bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the nature of an effect that is generated by one cause is also generated by another,

original: de lta yin na ni @333a * //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni @333a * //
translated: then in that case,

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid tha dad par ma mthong bas /
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid tha dad par ma mthong bas /
translated: since the nature of the effect is not seen to be different due to the difference in characteristics of the cause,

original: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'bras bu mi 'dra ba med pa tha mi dad pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis tha dad pa byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'bras bu mi 'dra ba med pa tha mi dad pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis tha dad pa byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the difference in causes would not be a maker of the difference in the effect, because the difference in causes generates the undifferentiated effect.

original: 'on te phan tshun rnam par chad pa'i lus can yin yang mig la sogs pa nyid rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te phan tshun rnam par chad pa'i lus can yin yang mig la sogs pa nyid rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par nges pa yin te /
translated: But even though they have a mutually distinct body, the eye and so on are definitely the generators of visual consciousness due to some specific nature,

original: gzhan zhing la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhing la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the field and so on.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi khyad par de ni mig la sogs pa de dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'di dag ga las yin zhes bya ba de tsam du ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi khyad par de ni mig la sogs pa de dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'di dag ga las yin zhes bya ba de tsam du ni 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the specific nature of those eye and so on would be “from where is this specific nature?”

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ltas pa med pas nged pa med par thal bas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ltas pa med pas nged pa med par thal bas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were causeless, then it would follow that it would be without a basis, because of the fear of being without a basis.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par de ni rang gi rgyud las yin no zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par de ni rang gi rgyud las yin no zhes brjod la /
translated: They say that the specific nature of those is from its own continuum.

original: de skyed pa'i bdag nyid kyang de las gzhan pa'i rgyu las yin pas rgyu brgyud pa thog ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i bdag nyid kyang de las gzhan pa'i rgyu las yin pas rgyu brgyud pa thog ma med pa yin no //
translated: And the nature of generating that is from a cause other than that, so the continuum of causes is without beginning.

original: de bas na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyu brgyud pa ni 'dod pa nyid kyis thug pa med pa yin yang skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyu brgyud pa ni 'dod pa nyid kyis thug pa med pa yin yang skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of causes of this kind, even though it is endless by its very nature, is not faulty.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i tshogs mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las 'bras bu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i tshogs mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las 'bras bu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa skye ba yin te /
translated: Thus, a result that is not of a different nature arises from a collection of causes that is of a different nature.

original: de bas na cha de tsam kho nas rgyu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ba dag las 'bras bu tha dad pa dang ; tha mi dad pa dag yin par brjod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de bas na cha de tsam kho nas rgyu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ba dag las 'bras bu tha dad pa dang ; tha mi dad pa dag yin par brjod do snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, one should think that the result is of a different nature and not of a different nature from the causes that are of a different nature and not of a different nature, respectively, to that extent.

original: de ni snying po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni snying po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa brjod pa de kho na sgrub pa'am sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas ji ltar rgyu'i chos kyi stobs kyis thams cad thams cad kyi sgrub byed ma yin pa de bzhin du tha dad par khyad
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa brjod pa de kho na sgrub pa'am sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas ji ltar rgyu'i chos kyi stobs kyis thams cad thams cad kyi sgrub byed ma yin pa de bzhin du tha dad par khyad
translated: Because of this, it is logical that only that which is ascertained for both parties is either a proof or a refutation. Just as the power of the property of the reason does not prove everything for everyone, in the same way, even though there is no difference in the way they are distinct, everything does not prove everything.

original: par med kyang thams cad thams cad sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar rgyu 'bras ci 'brel pa khas len pa grangs can la sogs pa dag la brjod na mdzes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: par med kyang thams cad thams cad sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar rgyu 'bras ci 'brel pa khas len pa grangs can la sogs pa dag la brjod na mdzes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If this were stated to the Sāṃkhya and so on, who accept a relation of cause and effect, it would be beautiful.

original: gang zhig de kho nar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sel ba dbu ma de dag la ni de dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni rang gi rgyu las yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rgyu'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa rang
analyzed: gang zhig de kho nar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sel ba dbu ma de dag la ni de dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni rang gi rgyu las yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rgyu'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pa rang
translated: But for the Mādhyamika, who refutes the entity of cause and effect in reality, the reason that has the property of the cause, “because of being a particular nature of its cause,” is not established for himself.

original: gi phyogs grub par bya ba'i don du grub pa lta bur ji ltar nye bar len /
analyzed: gi phyogs grub par bya ba'i don du grub pa lta bur ji ltar nye bar len /
translated: How could he use it to establish his own position as if it were established?

original: 'on te rgyu'i chos kyi mthu khas mi len na mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba bzlog dka'o zhes 'dod @333b na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i chos kyi mthu khas mi len na mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba bzlog dka'o zhes 'dod @333b na de ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you do not accept the power of the phenomena of causes, then it is difficult to reverse the contradiction with direct perception and so on.

original: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis ji ltar mthong ba mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis ji ltar mthong ba mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because the distinction “in reality” prevents the refutation of what is seen.

original: 'o na ji ltar mthong ba 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mthong ba 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Well then, how is what is seen refuted?

original: des na 'dis ni bsal ba rus sbal gyi spu 'byid pa yin te /🔽ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni khams mi len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'dis ni bsal ba rus sbal gyi spu 'byid pa yin te / ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni khams mi len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this is like removing the hair of a turtle.🔽Since the entity of cause and effect is not accepted as it is seen, it is not accepted as it is not seen.

original: de kho na nyid ni tshad ma dang ldan pa yin pa nyid kyis na tshad ma dang mi ldan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas mi len pa'i phyir na ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa ji ltar khas ma blangs /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni tshad ma dang ldan pa yin pa nyid kyis na tshad ma dang mi ldan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas mi len pa'i phyir na ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa ji ltar khas ma blangs /
translated: Since reality is endowed with valid knowledge, the entity of cause and effect that is not endowed with valid knowledge is not accepted. Therefore, how is it not accepted as it is seen?

original: 'di ltar mngon sum la ni 'di tsam kho na snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum la ni 'di tsam kho na snang ba yin te /
translated: In this way, only this much appears to direct perception:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin na de yang kho po cag gis ma bkag go //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin na de yang kho po cag gis ma bkag go //
translated: If it is said that “when this exists, that comes to be,” then that is not refuted by us.

original: tshad mas 'thad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po brjod pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad mas 'thad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po brjod pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is expressed as the effect of a cause that is established by a valid cognition is not to be understood by direct perception.

original: mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis tshad mas 'thad pa'i rang bzhin nyid nges par 'dzin pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis tshad mas 'thad pa'i rang bzhin nyid nges par 'dzin pa'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because direct perception is nonconceptual, it is devoid of the capacity to ascertain the nature that is established by a valid cognition.

original: dngos por snang ba nyid las de dang tha mi dad pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin snang ba yin no zhes smras pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos por snang ba nyid las de dang tha mi dad pa rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin snang ba yin no zhes smras pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that the nature that is not different from the mere appearance of an entity appears in that way.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin ma yin yang sgra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin ma yin yang sgra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though it does not have that kind of nature, a rope may appear as a snake.

original: snang ba 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: snang ba 'di ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
translated: It is also wrong to say that this appearance is mistaken.

original: bden pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i snang ba la yang bden pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i snang ba la yang bden pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, with respect to appearances that are asserted to be real, there is no reason for them to be real.

original: don bya ba byed pa nyid bden pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa nyid bden pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the performance of a function is the reason for reality,

original: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i bya ba byed pa nyid kho na don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i bya ba byed pa nyid kho na don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: that is not so, because if the performance of the function of an effect is the performance of the function of an object,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyi don dam par mi 'thad pa'i ngo bo ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa'i phyir de ni shes par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyi don dam par mi 'thad pa'i ngo bo ni kun rdzob tu khas blangs pa'i phyir de ni shes par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then since the performance of the function of an object is not tenable ultimately in the way that it has been explained, it is not a reason for reality.

original: thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin na yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin na yul dang dus la sogs pa nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If all is false, there would be no determination of place, time, and so on.

original: gal te rgyu med pa nyid du khas blangs na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad pa'i ba rnag pa mi bzod pa nyid kyis ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba'i rang gi rgyu snga ma la brten nas dus dang yul
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa nyid du khas blangs na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad pa'i ba rnag pa mi bzod pa nyid kyis ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba'i rang gi rgyu snga ma la brten nas dus dang yul
translated: If you accept that it is causeless, then this fault would ensue. But because it cannot withstand analysis, it is delightful when not examined.🔽The subsequent effect arises in this way, in dependence on its own prior cause, in terms of time, place,

original: la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma 'di lta bu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma phyi ma 'di lta bu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: de nyid kyis na kun rdzob tu rgyu med pas na ri bong gi ra la sogs pa ma skyes pa yin @334a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na kun rdzob tu rgyu med pas na ri bong gi ra la sogs pa ma skyes pa yin @334a * //
translated: Therefore, because it is causeless in the relative, the rabbit’s horns and so on are not produced.

original: no ; / gal te rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid yin na ji ltar mthong ba yang ci'i phyir mi dgag ce na /
analyzed: no ; / gal te rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid yin na ji ltar mthong ba yang ci'i phyir mi dgag ce na /
translated: If the reasoning is the same, why do you not refute what is seen?

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyar ro //
translated: Because it would contradict direct perception and so on.

original: 'o na ni 'di rigs pa nyid ma yin te gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di rigs pa nyid ma yin te gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, this reasoning is not correct, because it is possible to refute it.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ji ltar rigs pa'i de kho na nyid de ltar gnod pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar gnod pa mthong ba ji lta ba ma yin pa de ltar ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa'i de kho na nyid de ltar gnod pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar gnod pa mthong ba ji lta ba ma yin pa de ltar ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of the object is not accepted as it is logically established, and because the object is not as it is seen to be, but as it is logically established.

original: 'on te rgyu du ma nyid 'bras bu du ma byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa khas len te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu du ma nyid 'bras bu du ma byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa khas len te /
translated: Or else, the second position is accepted, that a cause that is multiple produces a multiple effect.

original: rgyu rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyis na rgyu byed pas bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi khyad bar ma 'dres pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyis na rgyu byed pas bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi khyad bar ma 'dres pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the specific nature of the cause is applied to the specific nature of the effect, and the specific nature of the effect is not mixed up with the specific nature of the cause.

original: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa las ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa las ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, consciousness as the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition is the cause of visual consciousness, which is the nature of perception.

original: mig gi dbang po las ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid de nyid gzugs la 'dzin par rung ba nyid du so sor nges pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po las ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid de nyid gzugs la 'dzin par rung ba nyid du so sor nges pa yin no //
translated: The eye faculty is the determiner of the very nature of the cognition, which is suitable to apprehend form.

original: yul las ni de dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul las ni de dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: The object is the determiner of the very nature of the cognition, which is of the same nature as the object.

original: de ltar na dngos su na rnam par dbye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu tha dad ma yin yang rgyu rnams kyi ngo bo tha dad pa dag gis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos su na rnam par dbye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu tha dad ma yin yang rgyu rnams kyi ngo bo tha dad pa dag gis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, although the effect is not different in nature from the cause, which is actually undifferentiated, the causes themselves are definitely different in nature, because of their different natures.

original: rgyu tha dad ba las de'i 'bras bu'i tha dad pa med ba ma yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad ba las de'i 'bras bu'i tha dad pa med ba ma yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the effect is not different from the different causes,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pa khas len na ni rnam par shes pa de du mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pa khas len na ni rnam par shes pa de du mar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the very nature of the cognition and so on are mutually different, then that consciousness would be multiple,

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it would not be different from the very nature of the cognition and so on, like the individual natures of the cognition and so on.

original: 'on te de rnams las tha mi dad ba ma grub pa de lta na ni rnam par shes pa du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de rnams las tha mi dad ba ma grub pa de lta na ni rnam par shes pa du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are not established as not different from those, then consciousness would not be manifold.

original: de rnams las tha dad par khas blangs na rnam par shas pa rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams las tha dad par khas blangs na rnam par shas pa rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one asserts that they are different from those, then consciousness would be without a cause.

original: rgyu'i byed pa rnam par shes pa las gzhan rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa la nye bar spyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa rnam par shes pa las gzhan rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa la nye bar spyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function of a cause would be applied to that which is the nature of understanding and so on, which are other than consciousness.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: In that case,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur / zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur / zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: the error would arise that it would always exist or not exist.

original: 'on te ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas tha dad par khas mi len na de lta na ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas tha dad par khas mi len na de lta na ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if, fearing the errors that have been explained, one does not assert that they are different, then in that case understanding and so on would not be mutually different,

original: rnam par shes @334b pa gcig las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes @334b pa gcig las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are not other than a single consciousness, like the nature of consciousness itself.

original: de bas na rgyu'i byed pa'i yul tha dad par brtags pa don med pas rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mig la sogs pa las zhes sngar bshad pa'i nyes pas phog par 'gyur ro //🔽'on te 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa du ma las ldog pa dang ldan pa yang dag par skye ba mthong bas chos tha dad pa rtog pas bzhag nas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yid la byed pa las ni rtogs
analyzed: de bas na rgyu'i byed pa'i yul tha dad par brtags pa don med pas rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mig la sogs pa las zhes sngar bshad pa'i nyes pas phog par 'gyur ro // 'on te 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa du ma las ldog pa dang ldan pa yang dag par skye ba mthong bas chos tha dad pa rtog pas bzhag nas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yid la byed pa las ni rtogs
translated: Therefore, since it is pointless to investigate the distinct objects of the cause, the fault explained earlier applies to the claim that the eye and so on are essentially distinct.

original: pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu dang rjes su mthun par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbye bas yul tha dad par rtog pas sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu dang rjes su mthun par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbye bas yul tha dad par rtog pas sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: But since one sees that the effect is produced by the possession of the negation of many non-realizers, and so on, the object is imputed to be distinct by the conception that posits distinct phenomena. The conception of the nature of the realizer is imputed by the conception that posits the object as distinct by means of the classification of phenomena such as the realizer, which is in accordance with the cause.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na de rnams las tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes pa du ma nyid dang shes pa gcig las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba gnyi ga la gtan tshigs su🔽ma grub pa yin no zhes 'dod na /🔽gal te de ltar na ni khyad par de rnams rtog pas sbyar ba nyid yin pas nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rgyu'i byed pa la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams las khyad par tha dad pa kho nar
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na de rnams las tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes pa du ma nyid dang shes pa gcig las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams tha mi dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba gnyi ga la gtan tshigs su ma grub pa yin no zhes 'dod na / gal te de ltar na ni khyad par de rnams rtog pas sbyar ba nyid yin pas nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rgyu'i byed pa la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams las khyad par tha dad pa kho nar
translated: Because they do not exist, it is illogical to say that consciousness is not different from them, and that consciousness is not different from many things because it is not different from a single thing.

original: 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that, then because those differences are merely imputed by thought, like a sky flower and so on, they do not rely on the activity of a cause. Therefore it is illogical to say that different things are different from things that are not different by nature.

original: 'on te ltos pa yin no zhes mngon par zhen pa de ltar na yang rtogs pas sbyar ba'i rtogs pa'i bdag nyid las sogs pa rgyu'i byed pa bzhag pas na brtags pa nyid yin gyi yang dag pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ltos pa yin no zhes mngon par zhen pa de ltar na yang rtogs pas sbyar ba'i rtogs pa'i bdag nyid las sogs pa rgyu'i byed pa bzhag pas na brtags pa nyid yin gyi yang dag pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you insist that they are dependent, then since the activity of the cause is posited in terms of the imagined nature, which is constructed by imagination, it is imagination, not reality.

original: de lta na ni 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the effect would be without a cause,

original: rgyu'i byed bas brtags pa'i bdag nyid rnams la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed bas brtags pa'i bdag nyid rnams la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of the cause is applied to the imagined nature.

original: 'on te brjod zin pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas 'bras bu ni tha dad pa ma yin pa gcig pu yin la bye brag ni tha dad kyang 'bras bu las tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te brjod zin pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas 'bras bu ni tha dad pa ma yin pa gcig pu yin la bye brag ni tha dad kyang 'bras bu las tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if, fearing the previously mentioned error, you assert that the effect is not different, that it is one, and that the difference is different from the effect,

original: de lta na ni 'o na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba'i chos dang ldan pas chos dang chos dag dngos su zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar tha dad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba'i chos dang ldan pas chos dang chos dag dngos su zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar tha dad pa'i phyir na /
translated: then in that case, since the phenomena that possess difference and non-difference are directly different like the moon and the stars,

original: spyi tha dad pa nyid nan gyis thog tu 'bab pa dang / phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i nyes pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do //🔽'on kyang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin par khas len pa na gzugs las 'bras bu rnam @335a * //
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa nyid nan gyis thog tu 'bab pa dang / phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i nyes pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do // 'on kyang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin par khas len pa na gzugs las 'bras bu rnam @335a * //
translated: But it is not only the fault of the absurd consequence of the difference of the universal and the particular, and the possession of a characteristic of mutual contradiction.

original: par shes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: par shes pa mi skye ste /
translated: But if you accept that the effect is not different from the nature of the cognition, then consciousness as an effect does not arise from form.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo la gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo la gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not different from the nature of the cognition, like the nature of the cognition itself.

original: yul gyi rnam pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs las kyang de skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs las kyang de skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would arise from form, because it is not different from the aspect of the object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the nature of the aspect of the object itself.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu gcig las skye ba dang mi skye ba dang rgyu gcig la yang skyed par byed pa dag cig car de kho nar 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu gcig las skye ba dang mi skye ba dang rgyu gcig la yang skyed par byed pa dag cig car de kho nar 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, arising and not arising from one effect and one cause, and producing and not producing one another simultaneously, are contradictory in reality.

original: 'di snyam du rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu skye bzhin par mthong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu skye bzhin par mthong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the effect that is of that kind is seen to be in the process of arising,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba yang tshad mar ma gyur cig snyam pas tshad mas gnod pa bzhin du yang mthong ba thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa mthong ba yang tshad mar ma gyur cig snyam pas tshad mas gnod pa bzhin du yang mthong ba thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as it is not the case that the perception of two moons, etc. is valid knowledge, it is not the case that all perceptions are valid knowledge.

original: 'on te rgyu gcig pu kho nas 'bras bu du ma byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum pa khas len to zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu gcig pu kho nas 'bras bu du ma byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum pa khas len to zhe na /
translated: If you accept a third position, that a single cause produces many effects,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: gcig las 'bras bu du ma skyed na rgyu tha dad pa ni 'bras bu tha dad par byed par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir tha dad pa yang tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig las 'bras bu du ma skyed na rgyu tha dad pa ni 'bras bu tha dad par byed par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir tha dad pa yang tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: If a single cause produces many effects, then a different cause would not produce a different effect, and a different effect would not have a different cause.

original: des na sna tshogs kyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sna tshogs kyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the difference of the various things and the nondifference of the various things would be causeless.

original: gang gi rgyu gcig po yin na yang 'bras bu du ma byed pa de ni tha mi dad kyang bdag nyid kyi khyad par de 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu gcig po yin na yang 'bras bu du ma byed pa de ni tha mi dad kyang bdag nyid kyi khyad par de 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that although it has a single cause, it produces many effects, then although it is not different, it has such a difference in its nature.

original: rgyu de bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang gi 'bras bu gcig skyed pa de nyid kyis ci gzhan yang yin nam /🔽de nyid kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang gi 'bras bu gcig skyed pa de nyid kyis ci gzhan yang yin nam / de nyid kyis so zhe na /
translated: But if the cause is a particular nature that produces one effect, then does it also produce another effect by that very nature?

original: ji ltar 'bras bu tha dad pa yin /🔽'on te gzhan gyis so zhen /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu tha dad pa yin / 'on te gzhan gyis so zhen /
translated: If it does, then how could the effect be different?

original: 'o na ni rgyu tha mi dad pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu tha mi dad pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it does not, then it is not tenable that the cause is not different,

original: bdag nyid kyi khyad par la gzhan pa'i dngos po ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi khyad par la gzhan pa'i dngos po ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the particular nature of the cause does not exist as another thing.

original: 'di snyam du gal te ji ltar grangs can pa'i ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rgyus 'bras bu bskyed ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te ji ltar grangs can pa'i ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bor gyur pa'i rgyus 'bras bu bskyed ba yin na /
translated: If you think that if a cause that has become the nature of an effect produces an effect,

original: de'i tshe gcig ni du ma'i ngo bor 'gyur ba 'gal bas du ma skyed par rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig ni du ma'i ngo bor 'gyur ba 'gal bas du ma skyed par rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: then it is not tenable that a single cause produces many effects because it is contradictory for one to be the nature of many,

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par skyed par nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu nye ba tsam gyis 'bras bu tha dad pa med pa skyed pa na rtsod pa 'dis brdzi bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i 'bras bu skye ba gang yin pa 'di nyid rgyu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag las 'bras bu tha dad pa dang
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par skyed par nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu nye ba tsam gyis 'bras bu tha dad pa med pa skyed pa na rtsod pa 'dis brdzi bar mi 'gyur ro // tha dad pa dang tha mi dad ba skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i 'bras bu skye ba gang yin pa 'di nyid rgyu tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag las 'bras bu tha dad pa dang
translated: Because when an effect that is not different is produced by a cause that is merely present, whose nature is to produce either a different or non-different effect, it cannot be refuted by this dispute.🔽If an effect that is different or non-different arises from a cause whose nature is to produce either a different or non-different effect, then an effect that is different or non-different arises from a cause that is different or non-different.

original: tha mi dad pa 'byung ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa 'byung ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that,

original: 'di yang @335b log pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang @335b log pa yin te /
translated: this is also incorrect.

original: gang gi phyir 'di nyid du 'di ltar rnam par dpyad par bya ste mig gi ngo bo nyid gang gis mig gi skad cig ma skyed pa de nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skyed dam ci /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di nyid du 'di ltar rnam par dpyad par bya ste mig gi ngo bo nyid gang gis mig gi skad cig ma skyed pa de nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa yang skyed dam ci /
translated: Because here, in this very context, this should be analyzed: By what nature of the eye does the eye produce the eye’s moment? By that very nature, does it also produce eye consciousness?

original: de nyid kyis so zhen /
analyzed: de nyid kyis so zhen /
translated: If you say it is by that very nature,🔽then the eye and eye consciousness would be simultaneous.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang mig kho nar 'gyur te mig bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyus bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mig bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang mig kho nar 'gyur te mig bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyus bskyed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mig bzhin no //
translated: And that consciousness would be just the eye, because it is generated by the cause that is the intrinsic nature of the generation of the eye, like the eye.

original: yang na ngo bo nyid gang gis rnam par shes ba skyed pa ni nyid kyis mig kyang yin na /
analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyid gang gis rnam par shes ba skyed pa ni nyid kyis mig kyang yin na /
translated: Or, if the eye is that which generates consciousness by its intrinsic nature,

original: de lta na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyus bskyed ba nyid yin pas mig kyang mig gi rnam par shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyus bskyed ba nyid yin pas mig kyang mig gi rnam par shes par 'gyur te /
translated: then the eye would be the eye consciousness, because it is generated by the cause that is the generation of the eye consciousness,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the eye consciousness.

original: yang na so sor mig dang mig ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyus bskyed pa'i mig dang mig ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang na so sor mig dang mig ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyus bskyed pa'i mig dang mig ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Or, the eye and the non-eye would be generated by the cause that is the intrinsic nature of the individual eye and non-eye,

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa ma yin pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa ma yin pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the same way, consciousness and non-consciousness would be generated by the cause that is the intrinsic nature of the generation of consciousness and non-consciousness.

original: 'di ni de bzhin du yin no zhes khas len na yang khyed cag mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pas shin tu nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin du yin no zhes khas len na yang khyed cag mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pas shin tu nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you accept that this is so, then you are utterly defeated by direct perception and the others.

original: 'on te mig gi ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi mig gi skad cig ma skyed la gzhan gyis ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi mig gi skad cig ma skyed la gzhan gyis ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the nature of the eye produces the eye’s momentary state, and something else produces the eye consciousness,

original: ngo bo nyid de dag ci mig las tha dad pa yin na ma 'on te tha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de dag ci mig las tha dad pa yin na ma 'on te tha mi dad pa yin /
translated: then are those natures different from the eye or not?

original: gal te tha dad pa yin na ni de'i tshe de dag nyid dngos sun don byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos su ni skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur la mig ni dngos po ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yin na ni de'i tshe de dag nyid dngos sun don byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos su ni skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur la mig ni dngos po ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are different, then they would be the actual entities that perform the function, and therefore they would be the actual producers, but the eye would not be an entity,

original: ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function.

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin na ni de'i tshe gcig pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i mig kyang tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin na ni de'i tshe gcig pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i mig kyang tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are not different, then at that time the eye, which is asserted to be a single entity, would be different.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid dang tha mi dad pas rang bzhin gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid dang tha mi dad pas rang bzhin gnyis bzhin no //
translated: It is like the two natures of being different from each other and not being different from each other.

original: de lta na yang gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, their identity would be destroyed.

original: yang na rang bzhin dag kyang gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin dag kyang gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the natures would be identical,

original: mig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mig bzhin no //
analyzed: mig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mig bzhin no //
translated: because they are not different from the eye.

original: de la yang mig gi ngo bo nyid gang gi sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa bshad zin to //🔽'on te rang gi rgyu las gcig bskyed ba'i ngo bor skyes pa'i rgyu ni de bzhin du 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de la yang mig gi ngo bo nyid gang gi sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa bshad zin to // 'on te rang gi rgyu las gcig bskyed ba'i ngo bor skyes pa'i rgyu ni de bzhin du 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed la /
translated: And in that case, the error that has been explained, “What is the nature of the eye . . . ,” and so on, would apply.

original: de bzhin du du ma skyed par byed pa yang rang gi rgyu nyid las skyes pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du du ma skyed par byed pa yang rang gi rgyu nyid las skyes pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: But suppose one maintained that a cause that produces a single effect arises in the nature of a single thing from its own cause, and that a cause that produces many effects arises in the nature of many things from its own cause.

original: de skad smra ba ni skabs nyid brjed pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad smra ba ni skabs nyid brjed pa yin te /
translated: But this is just a case of forgetting the point at issue.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar gcig dang du ma skyed par @336a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar gcig dang du ma skyed par @336a * //
translated: How can a cause that produces many effects

original: byed pa yin pa 'gog par byed pa de bzhin du gcig skyed par byed pa yin pa yang 'gog par 'dod pas dbu ma pa la de skad ci ste brjod /
analyzed: byed pa yin pa 'gog par byed pa de bzhin du gcig skyed par byed pa yin pa yang 'gog par 'dod pas dbu ma pa la de skad ci ste brjod /
translated: Just as you refute the production of one, so too you wish to refute the production of many. Why do you say this to the Madhyamika?

original: dbu ma ba ma yin pa la yang don med de /
analyzed: dbu ma ba ma yin pa la yang don med de /
translated: It is also meaningless to say this to one who is not a Madhyamika,

original: de ni gcig dang du ma skyed par byed pa 'di 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig dang du ma skyed par byed pa 'di 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he accepts the production of one and many.

original: gal te 'di snyam du tha dad pa skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa skye ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du tha dad pa skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa skye ba yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that from a nature that is certain to produce different effects, different effects arise,

original: de ltar na 'o na 'bras bu rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin par 'gyur pa des na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na 'bras bu rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su byed pa ma yin par 'gyur pa des na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the effect would not conform to the nature of the cause, and it follows that it would be causeless.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi mig las mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa mig ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yang skye ba'i phyir tha dad pa med pa ji ltar skye /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa skyed par nges pa'i rang bzhin gyi mig las mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa mig ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yang skye ba'i phyir tha dad pa med pa ji ltar skye /
translated: Since an eye that is a nature certain to produce different effects produces an eye and an eye consciousness that are not different from itself, how could it produce different effects?

original: 'di ltar rgyu ni 'bras bu so so la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i nus pa rnams dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir 'bras bu tha dad pa byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ni 'bras bu so so la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i nus pa rnams dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir 'bras bu tha dad pa byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, since the cause is related to the various powers of the effect, it does not produce a different effect.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo las so zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo las so zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: But if it is said that it is from its own nature,

original: gang gis na sngar bshad pa'i 'gal ba yod kyang de khyad du bsad nas rang gi phyogs bsrung bar kun du spyod pas lan 'ga' sems dpa'i khur spangs nas khyed bde bar gnas pa rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba rnag bzhin sna tshogs can 'di ci zhig
analyzed: gang gis na sngar bshad pa'i 'gal ba yod kyang de khyad du bsad nas rang gi phyogs bsrung bar kun du spyod pas lan 'ga' sems dpa'i khur spangs nas khyed bde bar gnas pa rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba rnag bzhin sna tshogs can 'di ci zhig
translated: then what is this so-called “own nature” that you, the defender of your own position, have abandoned the burden of the mind and are now living happily, having ignored the contradictions explained earlier?

original: yin / rgyu'i chos kyi stobs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yin / rgyu'i chos kyi stobs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the power of the property of the cause,

original: de lta ma yin te sngar bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te sngar bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because it has already been refuted earlier.

original: yongs su snang bzhin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su snang bzhin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: You also cannot say that it is the nature that is perceived.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa la snang bzhin pa ni bstan bcos la sogs pa la brten nas kun brtags pa'i de kho nar skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa la snang bzhin pa ni bstan bcos la sogs pa la brten nas kun brtags pa'i de kho nar skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousness that possesses the experience of form and so on appears to be the imagined reality of arising and so on, based on treatises and so on.

original: blo gang zhig gi bsam blo gang zhig yod na de nyid sgrib par byed pa 'jig rten grags pa de lta bu ni kun rdzob tu bzhed do //
analyzed: blo gang zhig gi bsam blo gang zhig yod na de nyid sgrib par byed pa 'jig rten grags pa de lta bu ni kun rdzob tu bzhed do //
translated: The intellect that is accepted as conventional is that which, when it exists, obscures suchness, and is renowned in the world.

original: de na rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin sna tshogs pa 'di dag thams cad bden pa yin la /
analyzed: de na rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin sna tshogs pa 'di dag thams cad bden pa yin la /
translated: All these various natures that are realized are true.

original: gzhan du na ni brdzun ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni brdzun ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, they would be false.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ji ltar mthong bzhin pa ni bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ji ltar mthong bzhin pa ni bzlog dka'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of cause and effect, just as it is seen, is difficult to reverse.

original: de ltar yin dang kha cig gis 'di skad du kun rdzob ni dngos bo med pa yin la skye ba dngos po yin pa'i phyir cig car don bya bar rung ba dang mi rung ba'i dngos po khas blangs pa yin no //🔽'on te kun rdzob skye ba yin na de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di skye ba skye'o zhes khas len pa yin bas mi 'dod ba ci yang bsgrubs pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang kha cig gis 'di skad du kun rdzob ni dngos bo med pa yin la skye ba dngos po yin pa'i phyir cig car don bya bar rung ba dang mi rung ba'i dngos po khas blangs pa yin no // 'on te kun rdzob skye ba yin na de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di skye ba skye'o zhes khas len pa yin bas mi 'dod ba ci yang bsgrubs pa med do //
translated: If that is so, then some would say, “You have accepted that the relative is a nonthing and arising is a thing, and so it is not tenable for a thing and a nonthing to perform a function simultaneously.🔽But if the relative is arising, then at that time the statement ‘arising arises’ is an acceptance that arising arises, and so nothing is established that is not already accepted.

original: @336b de bzhin du skye ba med pa ni don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par ma skyes pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don yang skye ba med pas skye ba med do zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: @336b de bzhin du skye ba med pa ni don dam pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par ma skyes pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don yang skye ba med pas skye ba med do zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, the statement ‘nonarising is the ultimate’ and ‘nonarising in the ultimate’ would mean ‘nonarising is nonarising.’

original: de lta na yang grub pa la bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ma shes pas skabs kyi don la mi mkho bar ma 'brel pa 'ba' zhig mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis smras🔽par zad do //
analyzed: de lta na yang grub pa la bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid ma shes pas skabs kyi don la mi mkho bar ma 'brel pa 'ba' zhig mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis smras par zad do //
translated: But the refutation that you have stated, “If that were so, it would be the establishment of what is already established,” and so on, is spoken with manifest pride, without any connection to the topic at hand, because you do not understand the definition of the conventional.

original: 'on te rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig kho na byed do zhes bya ba phyogs bzhi pa khas len na 'di shin tu mi mdzes te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig kho na byed do zhes bya ba phyogs bzhi pa khas len na 'di shin tu mi mdzes te /
translated: But if you accept the fourth possibility, that a single cause produces a single effect, this is very ugly.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma skyed par byed pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams la rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid med pas long ba nyid la sogs pa'i thal bar gsal bar thal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma skyed par byed pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams la rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid med pas long ba nyid la sogs pa'i thal bar gsal bar thal lo //
translated: In that case, it is clear that the absurd consequence follows that the eye and so on would be blind, because they do not produce their own consciousnesses, since they produce only the momentary instances of their own type.

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa nyid skyed par byed pa nyid yin par khas len na yang mig la sogs pa'i rigs rgyun chad pas shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig gi rjes la mig la sogs pa med cing shes pa yang med pa des na 'gro ba rnams
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa nyid skyed par byed pa nyid yin par khas len na yang mig la sogs pa'i rigs rgyun chad pas shes pa'i skad cig ma gcig gi rjes la mig la sogs pa med cing shes pa yang med pa des na 'gro ba rnams
translated: If you accept that consciousness itself is the producer, then the continuity of the eye and so on is interrupted, and after the moment of consciousness there is no eye and so on, and no consciousness.

original: kyis long ba la sogs pa de nyid 'bad pa med par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis long ba la sogs pa de nyid 'bad pa med par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the blind and so on would obtain their sight and so on without effort.

original: de bas na gang dang gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa de ni don dam par ma brtags /
analyzed: de bas na gang dang gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa de ni don dam par ma brtags /
translated: Therefore, whatever is dependently arisen is not ultimately existent,

original: gcig bur nyams dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig bur nyams dga' ba yin te /
translated: but is like a reflection, delightful only if not investigated.

original: dper na sgyu ma byed pa sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma byed pa sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa lta bu'o//
translated: For example, like an illusory elephant and so on created by a magician.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag thams cad de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag thams cad de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: All these things, form and so on, are like that. This is a reason from [the Buddha’s] own point of view.

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since dependently arisen things are seen just as they are seen, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in the compatible class.

original: snga ma'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor is it inconclusive, because the evidence is shown to undermine the incompatible class in the manner stated above.

original: de ltar na rigs pa 'dis rkyen la rag las te 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sgro btags pa yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yang rnam par gzhag pa yin te shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs pa 'dis rkyen la rag las te 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sgro btags pa yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yang rnam par gzhag pa yin te shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: Thus, by this reasoning, the body of the Lord is established as a mere conceptual designation, since it functions in dependence on conditions. But enough of this extensive discussion.

translated: “Dependent on conditions” means arisen from cooperative conditions.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyi snang ba'i yul du 'gyur bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sbyor ba du mas yongs su grub @337a * //🔽pa yin no //

translated: “Established by many applications of wholesome roots” means that it is the object of the light of the power of the wholesome roots of those to be trained.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas ji ltar chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pas ji ltar chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mthong ba'i lam rtogs pas khyod kyis yang dag par shes pa yin pas na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam rtogs pas khyod kyis yang dag par shes pa yin pas na /

analyzed: de bas na dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phyin ci log dang 'gal ba ngo bo nyid med par shes pas spangs te /
translated: Therefore, you have abandoned the distorted mind that is characterized by clinging to things.

original: de'i rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus pa rim gyis bsal nas sa dang po la sogs par khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Having gradually removed all the afflictive and cognitive obstructions that are rooted in that, you will definitely attain unsurpassed perfect awakening on the first ground and so forth.

original: gdul bya rnams la chos phyin ci ma log par bshad pa'i stobs kyis rtogs pa skyes par gyur to zhes ston pa ni yang de bzhin gshegs pa byon pa dang bzhud pa med pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //

translated: This is indicated by “When this was explained, that the Tathagata does not come or go,” and so on.

original: slar the tshom mi 'jug go zhes bya ba ni grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa rnams kyi nang nas gang yang rung ba gcig bu zhig spangs pa med pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa bstan pa'i stobs kyis mthong ba'i lam rtogs pa'i mthu las the tshom spangs

translated: “One does not again engage in doubt” means that from among those who have the same realization and happiness, there is no one who has abandoned any of them. By the power of realizing the path of seeing through the power of teaching the selflessness of phenomena, one abandons doubt through the power of realizing the path of seeing.

original: pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs spangs pa gsal bar byed pa des na bla na med pa'i byang chub la slar the tshom 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //

translated: This clarifies that one abandons the collection of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing. Therefore, one does not again engage in doubt with respect to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bskang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa dang po'i dbang du byas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: In order to perfect the roots of virtue means that, from the perspective of the first ground, it is because one engages in the perfection of generosity.

translated: The statement that the appearance of the unmistaken view arises by the power of meditation with a completely pure attitude is from the passage beginning with “Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāprarudita heard the sound of the gods” and so on.

translated: And in order to demonstrate the activity of the body of the Dharma, which is to establish beings to be trained in the stages of the ten grounds in accordance with their good fortune, the four lines beginning with the words, “Because all phenomena are unapprehendable,”

analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i rnam pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi snang ba byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du la rmi lam gyi gnas skabs dang 'dra bar dus de srid cig skyes so zhes gsungs ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po
translated: The bodhisattva Sadaprarudita, for example, was born for that length of time, as if in a dream, in the presence of the appearances of the aspects of the samadhis that teach the perfection of wisdom.🔽The bodhisattva mahāsattva

translated: If it is the case that the concentrations that focus on the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained are stable in every way, then it contradicts the sutra.

analyzed: 'di ltar bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos ni tshogs kyis nas brtsams te sa dang po'i bar du rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the first incalculable eon is from the beginning of the collection until the first bhumi is completed.

translated: The second is from the stainless bhumi up to the seventh bhumi.🔽Again, the third incalculable eon is from the immovable bhumi up to the buddha bhumi.🔽Thus, buddhahood is attained through three incalculable eons.

analyzed: de ltar na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur ba yin pas sgra ji bzhin pa nyid kyi mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /

analyzed: gsum tshan du mtshungs pas na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Since they are the same in being sets of three, it is said that three incalculable eons are required.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //

translated: Thus, when the master Vasubandhu’s commentary on the Ornament of the Sutras explains the perfection of the accumulations, it says that one passes through one incalculable eon.
